  15. 内容
  16. Contents
  17. 第二版前言
  18. Preface to the second edition
  19. 介绍
  20. Introduction
  21. 第一部分：基础问题
    1. 1. 现象
    2. 2.意向性
    3. 3. 方法论考虑
    4. 4. 科学与生活世界
    5. 5. 深入挖掘：从表层到深度的现象学
    6. 6.梅洛-庞蒂《知觉现象学》序言
  22. Part I: Foundational issues
    1. 1. The phenomena
    2. 2. Intentionality
    3. 3. Methodological considerations
    4. 4. Science and the lifeworld
    5. 5. Digging deeper: From surface to depth phenomenology
    6. 6. Merleau-Ponty's preface to Phenomenology of Perception
  23. 第二部分：具体分析
    1. 7. 空间性和具体化
    2. 8.主体间性和社会性
    3. 9.批判与政治现象学
  24. Part II: Concrete analyses
    1. 7. Spatiality and embodiment
    2. 8. Intersubjectivity and sociality
    3. 9. Critical and political phenomenology
  25. 第三部分：应用现象学
    1. 10. 经典应用：心理学、精神病学、社会学
    2. 11. 定性研究和认知科学的当前争论
    3. 12. 一种方法、一种态度、一个理论框架
  26. Part III: Applied phenomenology
    1. 10. Classical applications: Psychology, psychiatry sociology
    2. 11. Current debates in qualitative research and the cognitive sciences
    3. 12. A method, an attitude, a theoretical framework
  27. 结论
  28. Conclusion
  29. 词汇表
  30. Glossary
  31. 参考
  32. References
  33. 指数
  34. Index

背书

Endorsements

“清晰、引人入胜、富有洞察力，没有比扎哈维新版著作更好的介绍现象学哲学的过去、现在和未来的方式了。”

“Clear, engaging and insightful, there is no better introduction to the past, present and future of phenomenological philosophy than this new edition of Zahavi’s book.”

–英国爱丁堡大学戴夫·沃德

– Dave Ward, University of Edinburgh, UK

本书细致入微，以问题为导向，通俗易懂，堪称现象学的最佳入门之作。文笔流畅，清晰地阐释了关键概念和理论，同时涵盖了现象学传统的广度。修订版现在还提供了批判现象学的介绍，这或许是当今现象学界讨论最多的趋势。

“Nuanced, problem-driven, and accessible, this is simply the best introduction to phenomenology. Lucidly written, it presents clear explanations of key concepts and theories while covering the breadth of the phenomenological tradition. The revised edition now also provides an introduction to Critical Phenomenology, likely the most-discussed trend in phenomenology today.”

– Tobias Keiling，英国华威大学

– Tobias Keiling, University of Warwick, UK

对上一版的赞扬：

Praise for the previous edition:

对于当今寻求现象学思维途径，或帮助他人找到途径的人来说，在英语语境下，哪种资源才是最佳切入点尚不明确。丹·扎哈维的《现象学：基础》一书的首要优点在于彻底改变了这种思维定式。它为英语读者提供了一个通俗易懂、清晰易懂、引人入胜的现象学切入点，忠实地（但不乏味地）呈现了关键概念和见解，并阐述了它们与当代多个研究领域的相关性，而且没有明显的错误或疏忽，这无疑是一项不小的成就。

“For the one seeking a way into phenomenological thinking today, or a way to help others find one, it has not been obvious, in the English context, what resource should serve as the best point of entry. The first great merit of Dan Zahavi’s book, Phenomenology: The Basics, is to change this calculus for good. Offering English readers an entry point into phenomenology that is accessible, lucid, and engaging, presents key concepts and insights faithfully (but not ploddingly), along with their pertinence in multiple fields of contemporary research, and doing this without obvious error or negligence, is no small achievement.”

– 卡尔·赫夫蒂，《阅读宗教》

– Karl Hefty, Reading Religion

“这是世界顶尖现象学家对现象学的清晰、权威的介绍，包括其在社会学和心理学中的实际应用。”

“A lucid and authoritative introduction to phenomenology including its practical applications in sociology and psychology from one of the world’s leading phenomenologists.”

– 德莫特·莫兰 (Dermot Moran)，美国波士顿学院

– Dermot Moran, Boston College, USA

“扎哈维的《现象学：基础》将指导几代哲学家和科学家研究意识、具身性、共同性和常态。”

“Zahavi’s Phenomenology: The Basics will guide several generations of philosophers and scientists in the study of consciousness, embodiment, communality and normality.”

– Sara Heinämaa，芬兰于韦斯屈莱大学

– Sara Heinämaa, University of Jyväskylä, Finland

“丹·扎哈维是他那一代最多产、最有洞察力的现象学家之一，他为现象学研究提供了简洁、清晰且富有智慧的介绍。”

“Dan Zahavi, one of the most prolific and insightful phenomenologists of his generation, has provided a concise, clear and intellectually stimulating introduction to the study of phenomenology.”

– Alessandro Duranti，美国洛杉矶加利福尼亚大学

– Alessandro Duranti, University of California, Los Angeles, USA

“这本清晰易懂的书触及了现象学的核心，对于任何研究现象学传统的学生来说都是必读书籍。”

“This lucid book gets to the core of what phenomenology is all about, and is essential reading for any students of that tradition.”

– Piet Hut，美国普林斯顿高等研究院

– Piet Hut, Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton, USA

现象学基础知识

PHENOMENOLOGYTHE BASICS

《现象学：基础》简洁而引人入胜地介绍了二十世纪重要的哲学运动之一，以及一个不断发展和多样化的学科。然而，它也是一个具有挑战性的学科，其要素可能难以掌握。

Phenomenology: The Basics is a concise and engaging introduction to one of the important philosophical movements of the twentieth century and to a subject that continues to grow and diversify. Yet it is also a challenging subject, the elements of which can be hard to grasp.

这本通俗易懂的著作介绍了现象学的核心思想，以及胡塞尔、海德格尔和梅洛-庞蒂等现象学主要思想家的论证。本书由现象学领域的权威专家丹·扎哈维撰写，探讨并解释了以下关键问题：

This lucid book provides an introduction to the core ideas of phenomenology and to the arguments of its principal thinkers, including Husserl, Heidegger, and Merleau-Ponty. Written by a leading expert in the field, Dan Zahavi examines and explains key questions such as:

  • 什么是现象学分析？
  • What is a phenomenological analysis?
  • 现象学的方法论基础是什么？
  • What are the methodological foundations of phenomenology?
  • 现象学对于意向性、具体化、主体间性和生活世界有何看法？
  • What does phenomenology have to say about intentionality, embodiment, intersubjectivity, and the lifeworld?
  • 古典现象学的思想与定性研究和认知科学中正在进行的争论有何关系？
  • How do ideas from classic phenomenology relate to ongoing debates in qualitative research and the cognitive sciences?

第二版经过了彻底的修订和扩充。它包含一个关于批判现象学的新章节，并更新了现象学在精神病学、心理学和定性研究中的应用讨论。

This second edition has been thoroughly revised and expanded. It contains a new chapter on critical phenomenology and updated discussions of the application of phenomenology in psychiatry, psychology, and qualitative research.

《现象学：基础知识》包含关键术语表和进一步阅读的建议，对于任何寻求简洁易懂地介绍这一丰富而迷人的主题的人来说，它都是一个极好的起点。

Including a glossary of key terms and suggestions for further reading, Phenomenology: The Basics is a superb starting point for anyone seeking a concise and accessible introduction to this rich and fascinating subject.

丹·扎哈维是丹麦哥本哈根大学哲学教授，兼哥本哈根主体性研究中心主任。他与肖恩·加拉格尔合著的《现象学心灵》 （第三版，2021年）也可由劳特利奇出版社购买。

Dan Zahavi is Professor of Philosophy at the University of Copenhagen, Denmark, and Director of the Center for Subjectivity Research in Copenhagen. His book The Phenomenological Mind (third edition, 2021), coauthored with Shaun Gallagher, is also available from Routledge.

系列

Series

基础知识

THE BASICS

《基础知识》是一系列非常成功的通俗易懂的指南，以通俗易懂、不具术语的形式概述了某一学科领域的基本原理。

The Basics is a highly successful series of accessible guidebooks which provide an overview of the fundamental principles of a subject area in a jargon-free and undaunting format.

这些书籍面向初次接触某一学科的学生，既介绍了该学科的基本知识，也为进一步学习提供了理想的跳板。本书包含50多本涵盖人工智能、女性研究等学科的书籍，是学生了解某一学科领域的理想起点。

Intended for students approaching a subject for the first time, the books both introduce the essentials of a subject and provide an ideal springboard for further study. With over 50 titles spanning subjects from Artificial Intelligence to Women’s Studies, The Basics are an ideal starting point for students seeking to understand a subject area.

每篇文章都附有进一步学习的建议，并逐步介绍某个主题的复杂性和细微差别。

Each text comes with recommendations for further study and gradually introduces the complexities and nuances within a subject.

无神论格雷厄姆·奥皮

ATHEISMGRAHAM OPPY

情感迈克尔·布雷迪

EMOTIONMICHAEL BRADY

心灵哲学艾米·金德

PHILOSOPHY OF MINDAMY KIND

形而上学（第二版）迈克尔·雷亚

METAPHYS (SECOND EDITION)MICHAEL REA

自由意志（第二版）梅根·格里菲斯

FREE WILL (SECOND EDITION)MEGHAN GRIFFITH

批判性思维（第二版）斯图尔特·汉斯科姆

CRITICAL THINKING (SECOND EDITION)STUART HANSCOMB

全球发展丹尼尔·哈米特

GLOBAL DEVELOPMENTDANIEL HAMMETT

食品伦理（第二版）罗纳德·桑德勒

FOOD ETHICS (SECOND EDITION)RONALD SANDLER

洞察力本斯·纳奈

PERCEPTIONBENCE NANAY

时间哲学格雷姆·福布斯

PHILOSOPHY OF TIMEGRAEME FORBES

因果关系斯图尔特·格伦南

CAUSATIONSTUART GLENNAN

语言哲学伊桑·诺瓦克

PHILOSOPHY OF LANGUAGEETHAN NOWAK

斯多葛伦理学克里斯托弗·吉尔和布列塔尼·波拉特

STOIC ETHICSCHRISTOPHER GILL AND BRITTANY POLAT

政治哲学巴斯·范德沃森

POLITICAL PHILOSOPHYBAS VAN DER VOSSEN

面试马克·霍尔顿

INTERVIEWINGMARK HOLTON

现象学（第二版）丹·扎哈维

PHENOMENOLOGY (SECOND EDITION)DAN ZAHAVI

该系列的其他书籍可以在以下网址找到：https://www.routledge.com/The-Basics/book-series/B

Other titles in the series can be found at: https://www.routledge.com/The-Basics/book-series/B

现象学

PHENOMENOLOGY

基础知识

SECOND EDITION

丹·扎哈维

Dan Zahavi

保留所有权利。未经出版商书面许可，不得以任何形式或任何电子、机械或其他已知或今后发明的手段（包括影印和录制）或任何信息存储或检索系统转载、复制或使用本书的任何部分。

All rights reserved. No part of this book may be reprinted or reproduced or utilised in any form or by any electronic, mechanical, or other means, now known or hereafter invented, including photocopying and recording, or in any information storage or retrieval system, without permission in writing from the publishers.

商标声明：产品或公司名称可能是商标或注册商标，仅用于识别和解释，并不意图侵权。

Trademark notice: Product or corporate names may be trademarks or registered trademarks, and are used only for identification and explanation without intent to infringe.

奉献精神

dedication

For Eliyahu

  5. 第一部分：基础问题
    1. 1. 现象
    2. 2.意向性
    3. 3. 方法论考虑
    4. 4. 科学与生活世界
    5. 5. 深入挖掘：从表层到深度的现象学
    6. 6.梅洛-庞蒂《知觉现象学》序言
  6. Part I: Foundational issues
    1. 1. The phenomena
    2. 2. Intentionality
    3. 3. Methodological considerations
    4. 4. Science and the lifeworld
    5. 5. Digging deeper: From surface to depth phenomenology
    6. 6. Merleau-Ponty's preface to Phenomenology of Perception
  7. 第二部分：具体分析
    1. 7. 空间性和具体化
    2. 8.主体间性和社会性
    3. 9.批判与政治现象学
  8. Part II: Concrete analyses
    1. 7. Spatiality and embodiment
    2. 8. Intersubjectivity and sociality
    3. 9. Critical and political phenomenology
  9. 第三部分：应用现象学
    1. 10. 经典应用：心理学、精神病学、社会学
    2. 11. 定性研究和认知科学的当前争论
    3. 12. 一种方法、一种态度、一个理论框架
  10. Part III: Applied phenomenology
    1. 10. Classical applications: Psychology, psychiatry, sociology
    2. 11. Current debates in qualitative research and the cognitive sciences
    3. 12. A method, an attitude, a theoretical framework
  11. 结论
  12. Conclusion
  13. 词汇表
  14. Glossary
  15. 参考
  16. References
  17. 指数
  18. Index

第二版序言

PREFACE TO THE SECOND EDITION

早在2003年，我就用丹麦语出版了一本现象学的简介。在随后的几年里，这本书被翻译成德语（2007年）、冰岛语（2008年）和日语（2015年）。2016年，我联系了劳特利奇出版社，询问他们是否有兴趣出版英文译本。我们很快达成了协议，但当我开始翻译丹麦语版本时，我意识到2003年的原文有很多可以改进的地方。最终，我决定彻底修改和重写全文。最终，这本书的篇幅更长，我相信也更加精彩。

Back in 2003, I published a short introduction to phenomenology in Danish. In the years that followed, the book was translated into German (2007), Icelandic (2008), and Japanese (2015). In 2016, I contacted Routledge and asked whether they might be interested in publishing an English translation. We quickly reached an agreement, but when I started translating the text from Danish, I came to realize that there were many ways in which the original text from 2003 could be improved upon. In the end, I decided to rework and rewrite the entire text completely. The result became a much longer and, I believe, far better book.

第一版于2019年出版。感谢劳特利奇出版社鼓励我参与修订和扩充的第二版。前八章的改动相当小，包括一些细微的调整和文体改进，第七章也进行了一些浓缩，但引言有所扩充，第九章是新内容，第十至十二章也进行了重写。

The first edition was published in 2019. I am grateful to Routledge for encouraging me to work on a revised and expanded second edition. The changes to the first eight chapters are fairly modest. They include some minor tweaks and stylistic improvements and in the case of Chapter 7 some condensations, but the introduction is expanded, Chapter 9 is new, and chapters 10–12 have been rewritten.

谨以此第二版献给我的父亲 Eliyahu Zahavi，他是一位自学成才的记者，一直支持我的教育。

I dedicate this second edition to the memory of my father Eliyahu Zahavi, a self-taught journalist, who always supported my own education.

介绍

INTRODUCTION

DOI：10.4324/9781003350682-3

DOI: 10.4324/9781003350682-3

现象学是20世纪哲学的主导传统之一。埃德蒙德·胡塞尔是其创始人，其他有影响力的倡导者包括马克斯·舍勒、马丁·海德格尔、埃迪特·斯坦因、让-保罗·萨特、莫里斯·梅洛-庞蒂和埃马纽埃尔·列维纳斯。其影响力如此之大的原因之一是，几乎所有后续的德国和法国哲学理论都可以理解为现象学的延伸或回应。因此，正确理解现象学不仅因其本身而重要，也因为它对于理解20世纪和21世纪哲学的后续发展至关重要。

Phenomenology counts as one of the dominant traditions in 20th-century philosophy. Edmund Husserl was its founder, but other influential proponents were Max Scheler, Martin Heidegger, Edith Stein, Jean-Paul Sartre, Maurice Merleau-Ponty, and Emmanuel Levinas. One reason for its influence is that almost all subsequent theory formations in German and French philosophy can be understood as either extensions of or reactions to phenomenology. A proper grasp of phenomenology is, consequently, important not only for its own sake, but also because it remains a sine qua non for an understanding of subsequent developments in philosophy in the 20th and 21st centuries.

多年来，现象学对哲学的诸多领域做出了重大贡献，并对意向性、感知、具身性、情感、自我意识、主体间性、时间性、历史性和真理等主题提供了开创性的分析。它对还原论、客观主义和科学主义进行了有的放矢的批判，并深入探讨了生活世界的复兴。通过对人类存在的详细阐述，将主体理解为具身的、嵌入社会和文化的“在世存在”，现象学为一系列经验学科提供了至关重要的贡献。包括精神病学、社会学、心理学、人类学、护理学和认知科学。

Over the years, phenomenology has made major contributions to many areas of philosophy and offered groundbreaking analyses of topics such as intentionality, perception, embodiment, emotions, self-consciousness, intersubjectivity, temporality, historicity, and truth. It has delivered a targeted criticism of reductionism, objectivism, and scientism, and argued at length for a rehabilitation of the lifeworld. By presenting a detailed account of human existence, where the subject is understood as an embodied and socially and culturally embedded being-in-the-world, phenomenology has provided crucial inputs to a whole range of empirical disciplines, including psychiatry, sociology, psychology, anthropology, nursing studies, and the cognitive sciences.

尽管如今许多现象学经典著作都写于20世纪上半叶，但现象学依然是人们灵感的源泉，近年来更是重新引发了人们的兴趣。事实上，毫不夸张地说，现象学目前正在经历某种复兴。

Even though many of the by-now classical works in phenomenology were written in the first half of the 20th century, phenomenology continues to be a source of inspiration and has in recent years been the subject of renewed interest. Indeed, it would not be an exaggeration to claim that phenomenology is currently undergoing something of a renaissance.

尽管现象学在很多方面已经发展成为一个具有许多分支的异质运动；尽管所有后胡塞尔现象学家都已经与胡塞尔原始纲领的各个方面保持距离；尽管声称现象学是一个具有明确学说体系的哲学体系有些夸张，但人们不应该忽视已经并将继续团结其支持者的总体哲学关注点和共同主题。

Although phenomenology has, in many ways, developed as a heterogeneous movement with many branches; although all post-Husserlian phenomenologists have distanced themselves from various aspects of Husserl’s original programme; and although it would be an exaggeration to claim that phenomenology is a philosophical system with a clearly delineated body of doctrines, one should not overlook the overarching philosophical concerns and common themes that have united and continue to unite its proponents.

鉴于在像本文这样的导论中不可能对所有现象学家都一一进行公正的论述，我将主要借鉴胡塞尔、（早期）海德格尔和梅洛-庞蒂的著作——这三位思想家对现象学发展的决定性影响毋庸置疑。尽管许多现象学入门书籍都包含关于这三位思想家的单独章节，但我将另辟蹊径。我不会阐明和强调他们的差异——在我看来，由于对胡塞尔奠基性思想的根本性误解，这些差异常常被夸大——我将主要关注他们的共性。

Given that it will be impossible to do justice to all the phenomenologists in an introduction like the present, I will primarily draw on the work of Husserl, (the early) Heidegger, and Merleau-Ponty – three thinkers whose decisive influence on the development of phenomenology is undeniable. Whereas many introductory books on phenomenology contain separate chapters on these thinkers, I will proceed differently. Rather than articulating and highlighting their differences – differences that, in my view, have often been overstated due to a fundamental misinterpretation of Husserl’s founding ideas – my emphasis will instead primarily be on their commonalities.

在本书的第一部分，我将聚焦于现象学中的哲学概念本身。我将探讨方法论问题、对第一人称视角的关注、对生活世界的分析，并简要描述这一传统的发展历程。

In the first part of the book, I will focus on the very conception of philosophy found in phenomenology. I will discuss the question of method, the focus on the first-person perspective, the analysis of the lifeworld, and also briefly describe how the tradition has developed.

在本书的第二部分，我将把更偏向方法论的思考放在一边，转而提供一些具体的现象学分析的详细案例。我将首先探讨对空间性和具身性的现象学探索，然后再转向对主体间性和社群的分析。本部分的最后一章第二部分，在某种程度上可以看作是最后一部分的过渡章节，将讨论最近出现的被称为批判现象学，并提供一些例子来说明如何从更适应社会和政治问题的现象学视角来处理具体化现象。

In the second part of the book, I will put the more methodological considerations to the side, and instead offer some detailed examples of concrete phenomenological analyses. I will first consider phenomenological explorations of spatiality and embodiment, and then turn to analyses of intersubjectivity and community. The final chapter of part two, which to some extent can be seen as a transitional chapter to the final part, will discuss the recent emergence of what has become known as critical phenomenology and offer some examples of how a phenomenological perspective that is more attuned to social and political issues approaches the phenomenon of embodiment.

本书的第三部分将展示现象学在哲学之外的应用。我将讨论心理学、精神病学和社会学领域的经典贡献，以及定性研究和认知科学领域的最新讨论。

The third part of the book will demonstrate how phenomenology has been applied outside of philosophy. I will discuss both classical contributions from the fields of psychology, psychiatry, and sociology, and more recent discussions within qualitative research and the cognitive sciences.

我写这本书的主要目的是呈现现象学，而非为其辩护。简而言之，我的目标是以尽可能通俗易懂的方式阐述一些独特的现象学思想，而不是为了捍卫这些思想免受各种批评的冲击。读者若有兴趣更系统地捍卫现象学，或希望更广泛地参与研究文献的学术交流，最好另寻他处。1

My main ambition in writing this book has been to present rather than defend phenomenology. In short, the aim has been to expound a number of distinctive phenomenological ideas in as accessible a way as possible, and not to defend these ideas against the various criticisms they have been subjected to. Readers interested in a more systematic defence of phenomenology or in a more extensive scholarly engagement with the research literature are better served by looking elsewhere.1

剧中人

DRAMATIS PERSONAE

埃德蒙德·胡塞尔（1859-1938）

Edmund Husserl (1859-1938)

胡塞尔相对较晚才开始接触哲学。他出生于摩拉维亚的普罗斯尼茨（当时属于奥地利帝国），在莱比锡、柏林和维也纳学习物理、数学、天文学和哲学。他于1883年获得数学博士学位，直到随后的几年里，他才对哲学产生了浓厚的兴趣，部分原因是参加了心理学家兼哲学家弗朗茨·布伦塔诺的讲座。胡塞尔的第一部主要著作《逻辑研究》出版于 1900-1901 年，凭借这部著作，胡塞尔在哥廷根大学获得一个职位，并于 1901 年至 1916 年在该校任教。他的下一部主要著作《关于纯粹现象学和现象学哲学的观念 I》出版于 1913 年。1916 年，胡塞尔迁居弗莱堡，接替新康德主义者海因里希·李凯尔特担任哲学教授。随后几年，艾迪特·斯坦因和马丁·海德格尔都担任他的助手。当胡塞尔1928 年退休后，海德格尔接替了他。退休后不久，胡塞尔应邀前往巴黎举办一系列讲座，旨在向法国听众介绍现象学的基本思想。这些讲座后来由埃马纽埃尔·列维纳斯和加布里埃尔·佩弗翻译成法语，并于 1931 年以《笛卡尔的沉思录》为名出版。三十年代，胡塞尔在德国国家社会主义政权下饱受折磨。由于犹太血统，胡塞尔被禁止从事任何官方学术活动，进而失去了教学、出版的权利，最终也失去了德国国籍。深受这一发展影响的胡塞尔仍然继续他的工作，并更加热情地坚持哲学在欧洲陷入非理性主义时期的现实意义。 1935年，胡塞尔受邀前往维也纳和布拉格讲学，这些讲座为他最后一部著作《欧洲科学的危机与先验现象学：现象学哲学导论》（1936年）奠定了基础。1938年4月27日，胡塞尔去世后不久，一位年轻的方济各会修士赫尔曼·利奥·范·布雷达成功地将胡塞尔的众多研究手稿从德国偷运到比利时一座修道院，并安全藏匿。第二次世界大战爆发前，胡塞尔档案馆在鲁汶建立，至今仍可在那里找到原始手稿。

Husserl came to philosophy at a relatively late age. Born in Proßnitz, Moravia (then part of the Austrian Empire), he studied physics, mathematics, astronomy, and philosophy in Leipzig, Berlin, and Vienna. He obtained his doctoral dissertation in mathematics in 1883, and it was only during the following years that he became seriously interested in philosophy, partially as a result of attending lectures by the psychologist and philosopher Franz Brentano. Husserl’s first major work, Logical Investigations, was published in 1900–1901, and it was on the basis of this work that Husserl obtained a position at the university in Göttingen, where he taught from 1901 to 1916. His next major work, Ideas Pertaining to a Pure Phenomenology and to a Phenomenological Philosophy I, was published in 1913. In 1916, Husserl moved to Freiburg, where he took over the chair in philosophy from the neo-Kantian Heinrich Rickert. In the following years, both Edith Stein and Martin Heidegger worked as his assistants. When Husserl retired in 1928, he was succeeded by Heidegger. Shortly after his retirement, Husserl was invited to Paris to give a series of lectures meant to introduce a French audience to the basic ideas of phenomenology. These lectures were later translated into French by Emmanuel Levinas and Gabrielle Peiffer and published as Cartesian Meditations in 1931. During the thirties, Husserl came to suffer under the German National Socialist Regime. Barred from any kind of official academic activity due to his Jewish ancestry, Husserl in turn lost his right to teach, to publish, and eventually also to his German citizenship. Deeply affected by this development, Husserl nevertheless continued his work, insisting even more passionately on the relevance of philosophy at a time when Europe was descending into irrationalism. In 1935, Husserl was invited to give lectures in Vienna and Prague, and these lectures constituted the foundation for his last work, The Crisis of European Sciences and Transcendental Phenomenology: An Introduction to Phenomenological Philosophy (1936). Shortly after Husserl’s death on April 27, 1938, a young Franciscan Herman Leo van Breda succeeded in smuggling Husserl’s many research manuscripts out of Germany and into safety in a monastery in Belgium. Before the start of the Second World War, the Husserl Archives were established in Leuven, where the original manuscripts are still to be found.

马克斯·舍勒（1874-1928）

Max Scheler (1874-1928)

马克斯·舍勒在慕尼黑一个正统犹太家庭长大。他曾在慕尼黑、柏林和耶拿学习医学、哲学和心理学，并于1897年在耶拿大学获得博士学位。1901年，舍勒第一次见到胡塞尔。这次会面对舍勒来说意义重大。正如他后来写道：“我的方法论意识，在于对……的统一性和意义的理解。”我对胡塞尔作品持现象学态度”，并继续说道，“我对我理解和实践这种态度的方式负全部责任”。2舍勒因其颇为动荡的私生活而臭名昭著。1899年，舍勒皈依天主教，并与阿梅莉·冯·德维茨-克雷布斯结婚。这段不幸的婚姻很快就破裂了，据称是因为舍勒的众多风流韵事。持续不断的婚姻问题引发了一系列公开丑闻，最终导致舍勒失去了教学1910 年至 1919 年间，舍勒被迫担任讲师、散文家和政论家来赚取收入。然而，到了 1913 年，舍勒已经在现象学界获得了一定的地位，胡塞尔邀请他成为新成立的《哲学和现象学研究年鉴》的联合编辑。在此期间，舍勒还出版了他的一些最具影响力的著作，包括《现象学和同情心与爱与恨的理论》（后来以更广为人知的《论同情心的本质》为标题重新出版了一个扩展版）和《伦理学的形式主义和非形式的价值伦理学》。舍勒的声誉不断增长，到第一次世界大战结束时，他被认为是德国最具影响力的天主教思想家之一。然而，1919年在科隆担任哲学教授后不久，舍勒便公开脱离了天主教信仰。这不仅使他与科隆昔日的支持者疏远，也使许多受他影响皈依天主教的现象学同事感到不安。1928年，舍勒获聘法兰克福大学哲学与社会学系。他接受了这个职位，但他的健康状况每况愈下——很可能是因为他每天吸烟60到80支的习惯——最终导致一系列心脏病发作，并于1928年5月19日因心力衰竭去世。

Max Scheler was brought up in an orthodox Jewish household in Munich. He studied medicine, philosophy, and psychology in Munich, Berlin, and Jena, and obtained his doctorate from the latter university in 1897. In 1901, Scheler met Husserl for the first time. It was a meeting that would prove quite decisive for Scheler. As he was subsequently to write, “I owe the methodological consciousness of the unity and sense of the phenomenological attitude to the work of Husserl”, while then continuing, “I take full responsibility for the manner in which I understand and execute this attitude”.2 Scheler was notorious for his rather tumultuous private life. In 1899, Scheler converted to Catholicism and married Amélie von Dewitz-Krebs, an unhappy marriage that quickly fell apart, allegedly because of Scheler’s many love affairs. Ongoing marital problems led to a number of public scandals that eventually saw Scheler lose his teaching position and forced him to earn his income as a lecturer, essayist, and publicist in the years 1910–1919. By 1913, Scheler had, however, managed to gain such a standing in phenomenological circles that he was asked by Husserl to become co-editor of the newly established Jahrbuch für Philosophie und Phänomenologische Forschung (Yearbook for Philosophy and Phenomenological Research). During this period, Scheler also published some of his most influential works, including Phenomenology and Theory of the Feeling of Sympathy and of Love and Hate (later republished in an extended version under the better-known title of On the Nature of Sympathy) and Formalism in Ethics and Non-Formal Ethics of Value. Scheler’s reputation continued to grow and by the end of the First World War, he was considered one of the most influential Catholic thinkers in Germany. Shortly after taking up a position as professor of philosophy in Cologne in 1919, however, Scheler publicly distanced himself from the Catholic faith. This not only alienated him from his erstwhile supporters in Cologne, but also from many of his phenomenological colleagues who, due to his influence, had converted to Catholicism. In 1928, Scheler was offered the chair in philosophy and sociology at the University of Frankfurt. He accepted the position, but his deteriorating health – most likely due to his habit of smoking 60–80 cigarettes per day – culminated in a series of heart attacks, and on May 19, 1928, he died of heart failure.

马丁·海德格尔（1889-1976）

Martin Heidegger (1889-1976)

海德格尔最初在弗莱堡学习天主教神学和中世纪哲学，但在 1911 年决定专注于哲学。1913 年，他通过了论文答辩，两年后获得了任教资格，论文题目是邓斯·司各特的《范畴论和意义论》 。后一部作品提交给了里凯尔特，胡塞尔是这位哲学家的继任者。海德格尔从 1918 年到 1923 年担任胡塞尔的助手，之后成为马尔堡大学的特聘教授。1927 年，海德格尔的主要著作《存在与时间》出版，1928 年，他接替胡塞尔在弗莱堡的教席。1929 年，海德格尔发表了著名的就职演讲《什么是形而上学？》。希特勒上台后，海德格尔当选为弗莱堡大学校长，并成为纳粹党。然而，不到一年之后，他辞去了校长职务，并慢慢退出大学政治。然而，正如他 2014 年出版的所谓的《黑色笔记本》（一种哲学日记）所表明的那样，海德格尔与纳粹主义的调情既不是短暂的，也不是肤浅的。直到 1944 年，海德格尔都定期讲课，但战争结束后，他因政治倾向而被禁止授课，并于 1946 年被剥夺了教授职位。海德格尔于 1949 年恢复名誉教授职务，从那时起直到去世前不久，他一直在广泛讲学，正是在这一时期，他创作了《语言》（ 1950 年）、《建筑、栖居、思考》（1951 年）和《关于技术的问题》（1953 年）等主要著作。

Heidegger started out studying Catholic theology and medieval philosophy in Freiburg, but in 1911 decided to concentrate on philosophy. In 1913 he defended his dissertation, and two years later his habilitation entitled Duns Scotus’ Theory of the Categories and of Meaning. The latter work was submitted to Rickert, the philosopher whose successor was Husserl. Heidegger worked as Husserl’s assistant from 1918 until 1923, when he became extraordinary professor at the university in Marburg. In 1927, Heidegger’s main opus Being and Time was published, and in 1928 he took over Husserl’s chair in Freiburg. In 1929, Heidegger gave his famous inaugural lecture What is Metaphysics? After Hitler’s assumption of power, Heidegger was elected rector of Freiburg University, and became a member of the Nazi Party. Less than a year later, however, he stepped down from his rectorship and slowly withdrew from university politics. As the 2014 publication of his so-called Black Notebooks, a kind of philosophical diary, demonstrates, Heidegger’s flirtation with Nazism was, however, neither short-lived nor superficial. Until 1944, Heidegger gave regular lectures, but after the end of the war he was prohibited from teaching because of his political sympathies, and in 1946 he was deprived of his professorship. Heidegger was reinstated as professor emeritus in 1949, and from then, and until shortly before his death, he lectured extensively, and it was during this period that central works such as Language (1950), Building Dwelling Thinking (1951), and The Question Concerning Technology (1953) were written.

艾迪特·斯坦因（1891-1942）

Edith Stein (1891-1942)

斯坦因出生于普鲁士布雷斯劳（现波兰弗罗茨瓦夫）的一个犹太家庭。她最初在布雷斯劳大学学习心理学，但她的一位教授向她介绍了胡塞尔的《逻辑研究》，她对这部作品非常感兴趣，因此在 1913 年决定转学到哥廷根跟随胡塞尔学习。斯坦因成为哥廷根哲学学会的活跃成员，该学会由一群年轻活跃的现象学家（阿道夫·莱纳赫、罗曼·英加登、海德维希·康拉德-马蒂乌斯）组成。最终，胡塞尔接受斯坦因作为他的博士生，并推荐她研究移情。她于 1916 年以优异成绩毕业，论文的部分内容随后以《论移情问题》为名发表。毕业后，斯坦因成为胡塞尔的助手。她的主要工作是编辑胡塞尔的研究手稿并准备出版。她参与了胡塞尔的《观念II》（最终于1952年出版）及其《内在时间意识讲座》（由海德格尔于1928年出版，对斯坦因的作品仅略加提及）。胡塞尔不参与斯坦因的修订，而是倾向于创作新的文本，最终，这种对自身工作的缺乏参与导致斯坦因沮丧地辞去了职务。此时，斯坦因的学术生涯遭遇了挫折。由于身为女性和犹太人，她无法获得提交其预定的教授资格论文《心理学哲学与……》的许可。 尽管在各个大学尝试过，但斯坦因最终还是选择了人文学科。有一段时间，斯坦因做过私人教师，但在与西奥多·康拉德和海德薇格·康拉德-马蒂乌斯的交谈中，她对托马斯·阿奎那和阿维拉的德兰产生了兴趣，并皈依了天主教。斯坦因最终在明斯特的德国科学教育学院获得了一份教职，但在国家社会主义者掌权后，她被解雇了。1933 年 10 月，斯坦因被送入科隆的赤足加尔默罗修道院。1938 年，出于安全原因，她转到了荷兰的一所修道院，但荷兰并没有成为她长久的避风港。1942 年 7 月 20 日，荷兰主教谴责纳粹种族主义，这激怒了德国当局，并导致他们逮捕纳粹占领的荷兰境内受洗的犹太裔天主教徒。斯坦因被盖世太保监禁，并被送往奥斯维辛集中营，于 1942 年 8 月 9 日在毒气室中被杀害。1998 年，斯坦因被教皇约翰·保罗二世封为圣人。

Stein was born into a Jewish family in Breslau, Prussia (now Wroclaw, Poland). She initially studied psychology at the University of Breslau, but one of her professors introduced her to Husserl’s Logical Investigations, a work she found so interesting that she in 1913 decided to transfer to Göttingen in order to study with Husserl. Stein became an active member of the Göttingen Philosophical Society, which was composed of a group of young and active phenomenologists (Adolf Reinach, Roman Ingarden, Hedwig Conrad-Martius). Eventually, Husserl accepted Stein as his doctoral student and recommended her to work on empathy. She graduated summa cum laude in 1916, and part of the dissertation was subsequently published as On the Problem of Empathy. After her graduation, Stein became Husserl’s assistant. Her primary work was to edit Husserl’s research manuscripts and prepare them for publication. She worked on Husserl’s Ideas II (eventually published in 1952) and his Lectures on the Consciousness of Internal time (published by Heidegger in 1928, with only the slightest acknowledgment of Stein’s work). Rather than engaging with Stein’s revisions, Husserl tended to produce new texts and in the end this lack of engagement with her work made Stein resign from her position in frustration. At this point, Stein’s academic career hit a stumbling block. Because of being both a woman and Jewish she was unable to obtain permission to submit her intended habilitation thesis Philosophy of Psychology and the Humanities despite trying at various universities. For a while Stein then worked as a private tutor, but through conversations with Theodor Conrad and Hedwig Conrad-Martius, she became interested in Thomas Aquinas and Teresa of Ávila and converted to Catholicism. Stein eventually obtained a teaching position at the German Institute for Scientific Pedagogy in Münster, but after the rise to power of the National Socialists, she was dismissed from her job. In October 1933, Stein was admitted to the Discalced Carmelite monastery in Cologne. In 1938, she transferred for safety reasons to a convent in the Netherlands, though that country did not remain a safe haven for long. The condemnation of Nazi racism by the Dutch bishops on July 20, 1942, infuriated the German authorities and led to them arresting baptised Catholics of Jewish origin in Nazi-occupied Netherlands. Stein was imprisoned by the Gestapo, and sent to Auschwitz, where she was murdered in the gas chambers on August 9, 1942. Stein was canonised as a saint by Pope John Paul II in 1998.

让-保罗·萨特（1905-1980）

Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980)

萨特在巴黎高等师范学院学习哲学，并结识了整整一代法国知识分子领袖，包括西蒙娜·德·波伏娃、雷蒙·阿隆、莫里斯·梅洛-庞蒂、西蒙娜·薇依、埃马纽埃尔·穆尼埃、让·伊波利特和克洛德·列维-斯特劳斯。他与哲学家同行波伏娃的关系堪称传奇。1931年至1945年期间，萨特在勒阿弗尔、拉昂和巴黎的中学任教。20世纪30年代初，阿隆和列维纳斯向他介绍了胡塞尔和海德格尔的哲学，并于1933年至1934年前往柏林学习现象学。三十年代后半期，萨特出版了四本关于意识的著作：探讨自我意识结构的《自我的超越》 （1936）、 《想象力》（1936）、《想象界》（1940）和《情感理论提纲》（1939）。这四部作品都表明萨特对胡塞尔哲学的熟悉。第二次世界大战爆发，萨特应征入伍，并于1940年被德军俘虏。在囚禁期间，萨特研读了海德格尔的《存在与时间》。1941年获释后，萨特积极投身反抗运动，并于1943年出版了他的哲学巨著《存在与虚无》，这表明海德格尔的影响力日益增强。1945年，萨特创办了文学与政治评论杂志《现代时代》 （Les Temps Moderne ），并担任该杂志主编多年（期间与梅洛-庞蒂共同编辑）。战后，萨特决定辞去教职，全身心投入文学和编辑工作。因此，萨特是20世纪极少数未受雇于大学的有影响力的哲学家之一。战后时期，萨特的政治参与度有所提升，他对……的同情也随之增加。萨特信仰马克思主义，钦佩苏联，尽管他从未加入共产党。萨特对苏联的支持一直持续到 1956 年苏联入侵匈牙利。1960 年，萨特出版了他的第二部主要著作《辩证理性批判》，这部著作证明了他对政治和社会的参与。1964 年，萨特被授予诺贝尔文学奖，但萨特拒绝了。萨特直到晚年仍然积极参与政治。他反对法国在阿尔及利亚的战争，与伯特兰·罗素一起积极反对越南战争，也是 1968 年 5 月巴黎抗议活动的积极支持者。1980 年 4 月萨特去世时，有 5 万人参加了他的葬礼。

Sartre studied philosophy at École Normale Supérieure, where he met a whole generation of leading French intellectuals, including Simone de Beauvoir, Raymond Aron, Maurice Merleau-Ponty, Simone Weil, Emmanuel Mounier, Jean Hippolyte, and Claude Lévi-Strauss. His relation to his fellow philosopher Beauvoir became legendary. In the period 1931–1945, Sartre taught at high schools in Le Havre, Laon, and Paris. He was introduced to Husserl’s and Heidegger’s philosophy in the early thirties by Aron and Levinas, and in 1933–1934 went to Berlin to study phenomenology. In the second half of the thirties, Sartre published four books on consciousness: The Transcendence of the Ego (1936), which dealt with the structure of self-consciousness, Imagination (1936), The Imaginary (1940), and Sketch for Theory of the Emotions (1939). All four works reveal Sartre’s familiarity with Husserl’s philosophy. At the outbreak of the Second World War, Sartre was drafted and was taken prisoner by the Germans in 1940. During his captivity, Sartre studied Heidegger’s Being and Time. After his release in 1941, Sartre became active in the resistance, and in 1943 published his philosophical masterpiece Being and Nothingness, which shows Heidegger’s increasing influence. In 1945, Sartre established the literary and political review Les Temps Moderne (Modern Times), which he edited for many years (in periods jointly with Merleau-Ponty). After the war, Sartre decided to stop teaching in order to devote himself to his literary and editorial work. Sartre is, consequently, one of the very few influential 20th-century philosophers who was not employed at a university. During the post-war period, Sartre’s political engagement increased, as did his sympathy for Marxism and his admiration for the Soviet Union, although he never became a member of the Communist party. Sartre’s support for the Soviet Union remained intact until the Soviet invasion of Hungary in 1956. In 1960, Sartre published his second main work, Critique of Dialectical Reason, which testifies to his political and social engagement. In 1964, Sartre was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature, but declined it. Sartre remained politically active until late in life. He opposed France’s war in Algeria, was active against the Vietnam War along with Bertrand Russell, and was also a vocal supporter of the May 1968 protests in Paris. When Sartre died in April 1980, 50,000 people attended his funeral.

莫里斯·梅洛-庞蒂（1908-1961）

Maurice Merleau-Ponty (1908-1961)

梅洛-庞蒂在巴黎著名的高等师范学院学习哲学，在那里他结识了西蒙娜·德·波伏娃和克洛德·列维-斯特劳斯。他参加了胡塞尔在巴黎的讲座，尽管梅洛-庞蒂当时的德语并不流利，但这些讲座给他留下了深刻的印象，促使梅洛-庞蒂开始更详细地研究胡塞尔的著作。几年后，1939 年春，他成为比利时鲁汶新成立的胡塞尔档案馆的第一位外国访客。战争和德国入侵比利时暂时中断了巴黎和鲁汶之间的联系，但早在 1942 年，梅洛-庞蒂就迈出了在巴黎建立研究中心的第一步，该中心应该包含胡塞尔手稿的副本。同年，梅洛-庞蒂出版了他的第一本书《行为结构》。 1945年，他发表了可以说是他的主要著作《知觉现象学》。1949年，梅洛-庞蒂成为他在索邦大学获得了儿童心理学和教育学博士学位，并于 1952 年被选为法国学院哲学系主任。他是有史以来最年轻的教授，直到1961年5月英年早逝。二战后，梅洛-庞蒂越来越多地参与政治，并出版了多本散文集，包括《人文主义与恐怖》（1947年）、《意义与非意义》（1948年）和《辩证法的历险记》（1955年）。在政治兴趣浓厚的同时，梅洛-庞蒂也继续教学，他在索邦大学和法国学院的许多讲座都体现了他对其他学科的广泛兴趣，包括儿童心理学、结构语言学、民族学和精神分析。1960年，另一本由散文组成的卷本《迹象》出版，1964年，梅洛-庞蒂死后出版了残篇《看得见的与看不见的》，许多人认为这是梅洛-庞蒂的第二部主要著作。

Merleau-Ponty studied philosophy at the prestigious École Normale Supérieure in Paris, where he befriended Simone de Beauvoir and Claude Lévi-Straus. He attended Husserl’s lectures in Paris, and although Merleau-Ponty was not fluent in German at the time, the lectures nevertheless made such an impression that Merleau-Ponty began a more detailed study of Husserl’s writings. A few years later, in the spring of 1939, he became the first foreign visitor to the newly established Husserl Archives in Leuven, Belgium. The war and the German invasion of Belgium put a temporary stop to the contact between Paris and Leuven, but already in 1942, Merleau-Ponty took the first steps to establish a research centre in Paris, which should contain copies of Husserl’s manuscripts. The same year, Merleau-Ponty published his first book, The Structure of Behavior. This was followed in 1945 by what is arguably his main work, Phenomenology of Perception. In 1949, Merleau-Ponty became professor of child psychology and pedagogy at the Sorbonne, and in 1952 he was elected to the chair of philosophy at the Collège de France, the youngest ever appointed to the position, which he held until his untimely death in May 1961. After the Second World War, Merleau-Ponty became increasingly engaged in politics, and he published a number of books of essays, including Humanism and Terror (1947), Sense and Non-Sense (1948), and Adventures of the Dialectic (1955). In parallel with his political interests, Merleau-Ponty continued teaching, and many of his lectures from the Sorbonne and Collège de France bear witness to his extensive interest in other disciplines, including child psychology, structural linguistics, ethnology, and psychoanalysis. In 1960, Signs, another volume consisting of essays, was published, and in 1964 the fragmentary The Visible and the Invisible, which many consider Merleau-Ponty’s second main work, was published posthumously.

埃马纽埃尔·列维纳斯（1906-1995）

Emmanuel Levinas (1906-1995)

埃马纽埃尔·列维纳斯出生于立陶宛考纳斯（当时属于俄罗斯帝国）。高中毕业后，列维纳斯前往法国，在斯特拉斯堡开始学习哲学。1928 年，他在德国弗莱堡与胡塞尔和海德格尔一起学习。当他的博士论文《胡塞尔现象学中的直觉理论》于 1931 年发表时，列维纳斯作为法国德国现象学最重要的专家之一的声誉得到了巩固。到第二次世界大战爆发时，列维纳斯已成为法国公民，并被征召入伍。像萨特一样，他很快被捕，并在德国囚禁中度过了战争的剩余时间。因此，他避免了大多数被德国人杀害的犹太家人的命运。战后，列维纳斯成为巴黎东方以色列师范学院院长，随后在普瓦捷大学（1961年）、楠泰尔大学（1967年）以及1973年起在巴黎索邦大学任职。列维纳斯战后早期的作品《从存在到存在者》（1947年）、《时间与他者》（1948年）和《与胡塞尔和海德格尔一起发现存在》 （1949年）展现了他对胡塞尔和海德格尔思想的借鉴，但也已揭示了列维纳斯自身思想的主题，例如他者的角色以及伦理学与本体论的关系。列维纳斯关于后者主题的研究在他的两部杰作《总体与无限》（1961年）和《存在与存在》（1973年）中达到了顶峰。《存在之外或超越本质》（1974）。除了许多哲学著作外，列维纳斯还出版了一系列关于塔木德的评论和论文。犹太教。

Emmanuel Levinas was born in Kaunas in Lithuania (then part of the Russian Empire). After completing high school, Levinas left for France where he started philosophy studies in Strasbourg. In 1928, he spent time in Freiburg in Germany studying with Husserl and Heidegger. When his doctoral dissertation, The Theory of Intuition in Husserl’s Phenomenology, was published in 1931, Levinas’s reputation as one of the foremost experts on German phenomenology in France was consolidated. By the time of the outbreak of the Second World War, Levinas had become a French citizen, and was drafted into the army. Like Sartre, he was soon captured and spent the rest of the war in German captivity. He was thereby spared the fate of most of his Jewish family who were killed by the Germans. After the war Levinas became the director of the École Normale Israélite Orientale in Paris, and then obtained positions at the University of Poitiers (1961), Nanterre (1967), and from 1973 at the Sorbonne in Paris. Levinas’s early post-war works From Existence to Existents (1947), Time and the Other (1948), and Discovering Existence with Husserl and Heidegger (1949) display his indebtedness to both Husserl and Heidegger, but already announce themes that characterise Levinas’s own thinking, such as the role of the other and the relation between ethics and ontology. Levinas’s work on these latter topics reached its culmination in his two masterpieces, Totality and Infinity (1961) and Otherwise than Being or Beyond Essence (1974). Next to many philosophical books, Levinas also published a series of Talmudic commentaries and essays on Judaism.

笔记

NOTES

  1. 例如，请参阅Zahavi, D. (2003)。胡塞尔的现象学。斯坦福，加利福尼亚州：斯坦福大学出版社；Zahavi, D. (2005)。主观性和自我：研究第一人称视角。剑桥，马萨诸塞州：麻省理工学院出版社；Zahavi, D. (2014)。自我与他人：探索主观性、同理心和羞耻感。牛津：牛津大学出版社；Zahavi, D. (2017)。胡塞尔的遗产：现象学、形而上学和先验哲学。牛津：牛津大学出版社；Gallagher, S. 和 Zahavi, D. (2021)。现象学心灵。第三版。伦敦：劳特利奇。

进一步阅读的建议

SUGGESTIONS FOR FURTHER READING

  • Dermot Moran，《现象学导论》。伦敦：劳特利奇，2000。
  • Dermot Moran, Introduction to Phenomenology. London: Routledge, 2000.
  • 赫伯特·施皮格伯格，《现象学运动：历史导论》。海牙：马丁努斯·尼霍夫，1965年。
  • Herbert Spiegelberg, The Phenomenological Movement: A Historical Introduction. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff, 1965.

第一部分基础问题

PART I FOUNDATIONAL ISSUES

DOI：10.4324/9781003350682-2

DOI: 10.4324/9781003350682-2

接下来的六章旨在对现象学的本质进行一个基本的概述。它进行的是什么样的探索？现象学主要甚至完全关注心灵，还是同样关注世界？什么是现象本身是什么？我们该如何研究它？我们与世界联系的方式有哪些？谈论一棵树和感知一棵树有什么区别？科学世界与我们从日常经验中了解的世界有何关联？说现象学是先验哲学的一种，这是什么意思？本章将介绍现象学的一些主要主题和问题，描述其方法，并概述其发展历程。

The aim of the following six chapters is to offer a basic overview of what phenomenology is all about. What kind of exploration is it engaged in? Is phenomenology primarily or even exclusively focused on the mind or is it equally about the world? What is a phenomenon in the first place, and how do we go about investigating it? What are the different ways in which we can relate to the world? What is the difference between talking about a tree and perceiving it? How does the world of science relate to the world we know from everyday experience? And what does it mean to say that phenomenology is a form of transcendental philosophy? The chapters will present some of the overarching themes and problems of phenomenology, describe its method(s), and outline its development.

1现象

1 THE PHENOMENA

DOI：10.4324/9781003350682-4

DOI: 10.4324/9781003350682-4

严格来说，现象学是指研究现象的科学。但什么是现象？现象学家研究的是什么样的现象？他们主要感兴趣的是壮观的现象，还是真正现象性的现象？西蒙娜·德·波伏娃在自传中讲述了萨特最初接触胡塞尔现象学的历程。当时，他们正和刚从德国回来的朋友雷蒙·阿隆一起去一家鸡尾酒吧。阿隆指着他点的杏子鸡尾酒对萨特说：“你看，我亲爱的朋友，如果你是一位现象学家，你就可以谈论这杯鸡尾酒，并从中汲取哲学思想！”阿隆说得没错。即使是对简单事物的日常体验，也可以作为现象学分析的出发点。事实上，如果哲学要避免陷入陈腐抽象的死胡同，就必须重新与丰富的日常生活联系起来。然而，重要的是，现象学关注的是我们如何体验，而不仅仅是体验了什么。现象学关注的并非仅仅关注经验对象的重量、稀有性或化学成分，而是对象展现或展示自身的方式，即它如何呈现。物理对象、器皿、艺术品、旋律、事态、数字，或其他人类的呈现方式。此外，同一个物体可能以各种不同的方式呈现：从不同视角，在强烈或微弱的光照下，被感知、想象、渴望、恐惧、期待或回忆。简而言之，现象学可以被视为对这些不同类型的给定性的哲学分析。

Strictly speaking, phenomenology means the science or study of phenomena. But what is a phenomenon? And what kind of phenomena do phenomenologists investigate? Are they mainly interested in spectacular phenomena, in truly phenomenal phenomena? In her autobiography, Simone de Beauvoir recounts how Sartre was first introduced to Husserl’s phenomenology. They were both visiting a cocktail bar with their friend Raymond Aron, who had just returned from Germany. Aron pointed to the apricot cocktail he had ordered and said to Sartre: “You see, my dear fellow, if you are a phenomenologist, you can talk about this cocktail and make philosophy out of it!”1 Aron was quite right. Even the everyday experience of simple objects can serve as the point of departure for a phenomenological analysis. Indeed, if philosophy is to avoid the dead end of stale abstractions, it has to reconnect to the richness of everyday life. Importantly, however, phenomenology is interested in how rather than merely in what we experience. Rather than simply focusing on, say, the weight, rarity, or chemical composition of the object of experience, phenomenology is concerned with the way in which the object shows or displays itself, i.e., in how it appears. There are important differences between the ways in which a physical object, a utensil, a work of art, a melody, a state of affairs, a number, or other human beings present themselves. Moreover, it is possible for one and the same object to appear in a variety of different ways: From this or that perspective, in strong or faint illumination, as perceived, imagined, wished for, feared, anticipated, or recollected. Briefly stated, phenomenology can be seen as a philosophical analysis of these different types of givenness.

闹钟

THE ALARM CLOCK

这听起来可能很抽象，让我们考虑一个具体的例子。我正在为一位朋友寻找生日礼物，在哥本哈根市中心的一家古董店里寻找。不知何时，我注意到一个古董闹钟。闹钟是什么样子的？什么样的现象是什么？首先，我们应该认识到这个问题没有简单的答案，因为闹钟可以以多种方式出现。我不仅可以看到、触摸和听到它，它还可以出现在我的脑海中，就像我可以看到它的图片或者只是使用它一样。为了简单起见，现在让我们只关注闹钟在所讨论情境中的出现方式，即感知方式。根据照明（自然阳光、霓虹灯、聚光灯等），闹钟会有所不同。然而，无论情况如何，即使在最佳照明条件下，我也永远无法看到整个闹钟，因为它总是以透视的方式出现。如果我看着放在商店桌子上的闹钟，我可能可以看到它的顶部和两侧，但我看不到它的背面、底部或内部。如果我在桌子上走动，我可能可以看到闹钟的背面。如果我把它从桌上拿起来，或许可以观察它的底部，但无论我做什么，闹钟都会继续以透视的方式呈现。当新的方面显现出来时，之前的方面就会从视野中消失。这似乎是一个相当微不足道的观察，在日常生活中习以为常，无需深思熟虑，但在现象学家手中，它却蕴含着通往丰富洞见的钥匙。首先考虑这样一个事实：尽管我们从未见过完整的闹钟，但我们并不怀疑或以任何方式质疑闹钟远不止于它所呈现的样子。它拥有感知上不存在的部分和属性。事实上，这些缺失的方面即使不在场，它们也会在我们的感知中发挥作用。没有它们，闹钟的正面就不会看起来像正面。因此，感知体验涉及存在与缺失。当我们感知一个物体时，我们体验到的总是比直观呈现的更多。我们所看到的正面指向闹钟的另一面，这些面暂时不存在，但可以通过进一步的探索来揭示。更一般地说，我们所看到的从来都不是孤立存在的，而是被包围并置于一个影响我们所见事物意义的视野。

This might all sound very abstract, so let us consider a concrete example. I am on the lookout for a birthday present for a friend of mine and am searching in a vintage shop in central Copenhagen. At some point, I notice an antique alarm clock. How does an alarm clock appear? What kind of phenomenon is it? To start with, we should recognise that there is no simple answer to this question, since an alarm clock can appear in numerous ways. Not only can I see, touch, and hear it, but it can also appear in thought, just as I might see a picture of it or simply use it. To keep matters simple for now, let us just focus on the way the alarm clock appears in the situation in question, namely perceptually. Depending on the illumination (natural sunlight, neon lights, spotlights, etc.), the alarm clock will appear differently. Regardless of the circumstances, however, and even under optimal lighting conditions, I will never be able to see the entire alarm clock, since it will always appear perspectivally. If I look at the alarm clock as it is positioned on the desk in the shop, I might be able to see its top, and two of its sides, but I cannot see its backside or bottom or inside. If I move around the desk, I might be able to see the backside of the alarm clock. If I lift it from the desk, I might be able to inspect its bottom, but regardless of what I do, the alarm clock will continue to appear perspectivally. When new aspects are revealed, former aspects will disappear from view. This might seem like a fairly trivial observation, something so taken for granted in daily life that no further thoughts are required, but in the hands of the phenomenologists, it contains the key to a wealth of insights. Consider first the fact that although we never see the entire alarm clock, we do not doubt or in any way question that there is more to the alarm clock than what appears. It has parts and properties which are not perceptually present. In fact, these absent aspects play a role in our perception, even when absent. Without them, the front of the alarm clock would not appear as a front. Perceptual experience consequently involves an interplay of presence and absence. When we perceive an object, we always experience more than what is intuitively presented. The front that we do see points to other sides of the alarm clock that are momentarily absent, but which can be revealed by further exploration. More generally speaking, what we see is never given in isolation, but is surrounded by and situated in a horizon that affects the meaning of what we see.

这一视界涵盖的远不止对象暂时不可见的方面。毕竟，我们遇到的从来不是孤立的对象，而只是嵌入在更大背景中的对象。我眼前的闹钟摆放在某个房间的桌子上，而根据这个房间是销售室、考场还是律师办公室，闹钟会以不同的方式出现，并赋予其不同的含义。

This horizon encompasses more than simply the momentarily unseen aspects of the object in question. After all, we never encounter isolated objects, but only objects that are embedded within a larger context. The alarm clock I am looking at is standing on a desk that is located in a particular room, and depending on whether the room in question is a salesroom, an examination hall, or a lawyer’s office, the alarm clock will appear in different ways, with different meanings.

即使我正关注着闹钟，我的意识领域也不会被它耗尽。闹钟周围可能还有其他手表、杯子、钢笔、几本书等等。当我专注于闹钟时，我并没有注意到它周围的事物。但我并没有忽视其他器具、我所站的地板、房间里的灯光等等。我只是意识到它们是基础，也就是说，它们是整体的一部分，充当着背景是为了关注闹钟。虽然这些物件属于背景，但它们本身可以通过注意力的转变而成为主题。事实上，这种主题转变的可能性正是基于这样一个事实：我的主题位于一个与之共同赋予的场域中，而我可以在精神上（以及身体上）在其中移动。

My field of consciousness is not exhausted by the alarm clock, even if I am attending to it. The alarm clock might be surrounded by other watches, cups, pens, a couple of books, etc. When focusing on the alarm clock, I do not pay attention to its surroundings. But I am not oblivious to the other utensils, the floor I am standing on, the illumination in the room, etc. I am merely conscious of them as ground, i.e., they are parts of the totality which serve as the background for attending to the alarm clock. And although these objects belong to the background, they can become themes in their own right through a change of attention. Indeed, the possibility of such a thematic change is exactly based on the fact that my theme is situated in a field that is co-given with it, and in which I can mentally (and physically) move around.

为了进一步分析，我们先来思考一下“闹钟以透视方式出现”的含义。当闹钟以感知方式出现时，它总是以特定的角度出现在感知者面前，并且与感知者保持一定距离。但这又能告诉我们关于感知者的什么信息呢？要使闹钟以某种方式出现，感知者必须位于闹钟所占据的同一空间中。但感知者的空间定位意味着感知者被具身化。一个真正脱离肉身的感知者没有空间位置，或者换句话说，闹钟只能以它本来的样子出现在一个具身感知者面前。没有纯粹的智力视角，也没有没有任何视角，只有具体化的视角。

To proceed further in our analysis, let us consider for a moment what it means to say that the alarm clock appears perspectivally. When the alarm clock appears perceptually, it always appears at a certain angle and at a certain distance from the perceiver. But what does this tell us about the perceiver? For the alarm clock to appear in the way it does, the perceiver must be located in the same space that is occupied by the alarm clock. But for the perceiver to be spatially located is for the perceiver to be embodied. A truly disembodied perceiver would have no spatial location, or, to put it differently, the alarm clock can only appear the way it does to an embodied perceiver. There is no purely intellectual point of view and there is no view from nowhere, there is only an embodied point of view.

身体在感知中扮演着至关重要的角色，这一点也可以用一种略微不同的方式来阐释。即使我们最初只面对一个非常有限的视角，我们也很少会满足于最初的一瞥。正如胡塞尔所指出的，客体召唤我们进一步探索：

That the body plays a crucial role in perception can also be illustrated in a slightly different manner. Even if we initially are only confronted with a very limited perspective on the object, we rarely remain satisfied with the first glimpse. As Husserl points out, the object beckons us to explore further:

这里还有更多值得一看的地方，把我翻过来，这样你就能看到我的所有侧面，让你的目光穿过我，靠近我，打开我，分解我；一遍又一遍地打量我，把我翻过来，看清我的所有侧面。你会这样认识我，认识我的一切，我所有的外在特质，我所有内在的感知特质。2

There is still more to see here, turn me so you can see all my sides, let your gaze run through me, draw closer to me, open me up, divide me up; keep on looking me over again and again, turning me to see all sides. You will get to know me like this, all that i am, all my surface qualities, all my inner sensible qualities.2

我们如何进行这样的探索？我们如何更好地了解闹钟？用手拿起它并转动它，或者绕着桌子走一圈观察它的背面。但所有这些都需要并涉及身体的参与和互动。因此，我们了解到，感知探索并非静止地吸收信息，而是一项身体活动。我们移动眼睛、头部、躯干、手臂和手，以及整个身体。这种活动，这种身体探索，这种通过发现闹钟越来越多的方面来更好地了解闹钟，并非瞬间完成的。它需要时间。而时间确实也起着至关重要的作用。当我们先看闹钟的正面，然后转过身去观察它的背面时，正面可能会逐渐从视野中消失，但不会从脑海中消失。我们对闹钟的熟悉程度会不断增加，因为我们能够记住过去看到的内容。当我们改变视角和位置时，我们不会像观看三张不同的快照一样，先看到闹钟的正面，再看到它的侧面，再看到它的背面。如果我们拿起闹钟，在手中旋转，我们会体验到它的外观是如何逐渐变化的，而不是突然变化的。但要让闹钟以这种方式出现，我们的意识流就不能是一系列瞬间且不连贯的感知，而必须具有特定的时间结构和配置，必须以某种方式在时间和经验上统一起来。此外，时间在这里也扮演着不同的角色。在强调语境和视野，我们不应仅仅从空间的角度来思考，也应从时间的角度来思考。我们基于过去，并带着对未来的计划和期望来面对现在。我们过去的经历不会消失，也不会对我们无动于衷。当我注意到闹钟时，我决定进一步探究，不仅因为我从过去的经验中知道我的朋友睡得很沉，也因为我对未来的计划——我打算送给他一份礼物。

How do we carry out such an exploration? How do we get to know the alarm clock better? By picking it up by hand and turning it around, or by walking around the desk so that we can observe its backside. But all of this calls for and involves bodily engagement and interaction. We consequently learn that perceptual exploration, rather than being a question of an immobile intake of information, is a bodily activity. We move our eyes, our head, our torso, our arms and hands, and our entire body. This activity, this bodily exploration, this getting to know the alarm clock better by discovering more and more of its aspects, is not instantaneous. It takes time. And time does indeed play a crucial role as well. When first looking at the front of the alarm clock and then moving around to observe its back, the front might gradually disappear from sight, but not from mind. Our familiarity with the alarm clock increases because we are able to retain that which we have seen in the past. When executing a change of perspective and position, we do not first experience the front of the alarm clock and then its side and then its back as if we were viewing three distinct snapshots. If we pick up the alarm clock and turn it around in our hand, we experience how its appearance changes gradually, rather than abruptly. But for the alarm clock to appear in this manner, our stream of consciousness cannot be a series of instantaneous and disconnected perceptions, but must have a particular temporal structure and configuration, must somehow be temporally and experientially unified. In addition, time also plays a different role here. When highlighting the importance of context and horizon, we shouldn’t merely think of this in spatial terms, but also in temporal terms. We encounter the present on the basis of the past, and with plans and expectations for the future. Our past experiences are not lost and do not leave us untouched. When noticing the alarm clock, I decided to investigate it further, not only because I knew from past experiences that my friend is a heavy sleeper, but also because of my plans for the future – I intended to present him with a gift.

这就引出了我想从这个例子中提炼的最后一点。闹钟出现时，它出现在我面前，但它并非我的私人物品。相反，它更像是一个公共物品，其他人也可以观察和使用。当然，这也是我最初考虑购买它的原因。即使闹钟只向我展现了它的一部分，其他人也能同时感知到它目前无法感知到的方面。

This brings me to the last point I want to extract from this example. When the alarm clock appears, it appears to me, but it does not appear to me as my private object. Rather, it is very much given to me as a public object, as one that others can also observe and utilise. Which, of course, is also why I would consider buying it in the first place. Even if the alarm clock only presents part of itself to me, others can simultaneously perceive aspects of it that are currently unavailable to me.

外观和现实

APPEARANCE AND REALITY

但人们可能会问，这一切究竟有何意义？现象学关注的是各种事物的表象，它仅仅告诉我们一些关于现象的知识，即事物的表面本质，以及事物表面上是什么。这无疑与科学的目标形成了鲜明对比，科学的目标是把握事物的本质。

But what is the relevance of all of this, one might ask. By focusing on how various objects appear, phenomenology only tells us something about the phenomena, i.e., about the apparent nature of objects, about what objects apparently are. And surely this must be contrasted with the goal of science, which is to grasp the objects as they truly are.

在很多哲学传统中，现象确实被定义为对象呈现给我们的方式，即我们用眼睛看到的方式（以及用我们的范畴思考的方式），并与对象本身形成对比。当时的假设是，如果人们希望发现并确定对象的真实面目，那么就必须超越纯粹的现象。如果现象学采用的是这种现象概念，那么现象学就只是研究主观的、表面的或肤浅的东西。但事实并非如此。正如海德格尔在《存在与时间》第七节中指出的那样，现象学正在借鉴和运用一种非常不同且更为古典的现象概念，根据这一概念，现象就是自我展示、自我揭示的东西。3因此，现象学并不是关于仅仅是表象的理论，正如海德格尔在《存在与时间》出版前几年的一门讲座中指出的那样：

In much of the philosophical tradition, the phenomenon has indeed been defined as the way the object appears to us, as seen with our eyes (and thought of with our categories), and has been contrasted with the object as it is in itself. The assumption has then been that if one wishes to discover and determine what the object really is like, then one has to go beyond the merely phenomenal. Had it been this concept of the phenomenon that phenomenology was employing, phenomenology would have been the study of the merely subjective, apparent, or superficial. But this is not the case. As Heidegger points out in section 7 of Being and Time, phenomenology is drawing on and employing a very different and more classical conception of the phenomenon, according to which the phenomenon is that which shows itself, that which reveals itself.3 Phenomenology is, consequently, not a theory about the merely apparent, as Heidegger also pointed out in a lecture course given a few years before Being and Time:

从现象学的角度来说，将现象说成是某种东西，在其背后可能存在着其他东西，而这种其他东西，就其表象而言，是一种现象，这种表象代表并表达了[这种其他东西]。现象并非其背后可能存在其他东西的东西。更准确地说，人们根本无法要求现象背后存在某种东西，因为现象所提供的正是自在之物。4

It is phenomenologically absurd to speak of the phenomenon as if it were something behind which there would be something else of which it would be a phenomenon in the sense of the appearance which represents and expresses [this something else]. a phenomenon is nothing behind which there would be something else. more accurately stated, one cannot ask for something behind the phenomenon at all, since what the phenomenon gives is precisely that something in itself.4

尽管有些人可能声称这种现象只是主观的东西，是掩盖客观存在的现实的面纱或烟幕，但现象学家拒绝接受所谓的二-世界学说，即我们必须在呈现给我们并能被我们理解的世界与世界本身之间做出原则性区分。这当然不是要否认表象与现实之间的区别——毕竟，有些表象具有误导性——但对于现象学家而言，这种区别并非两个独立领域（分别属于现象学和科学的范畴）之间的区别，而是两种表现方式之间的区别。这种区别在于，对象乍一看可能是什么样子，以及它们在最佳情况下（例如，经过彻底的科学研究）可能是什么样子。事实上，现象学家通常会声称，我们感知到的世界，无论是在日常使用中，还是在科学分析中，都具备所有必要的现实性和客观性。声称此外还存在一个幕后世界，一个超越一切既定事实、一切证据的隐秘世界，并且这就是真正的现实，这种说法被现象学家们视为一种空洞的思辨性主张。事实上，他们会坚持认为，这种说法本身就包含着范畴错误，是对现实概念本身的误用和滥用。与其用“客观现实”来定义客观现实，不如用“对于一个不可接近和不可把握的彼岸，现象学家认为，客观性的正确定位点是在出现的世界之中，而不是在出现的世界之外。

Whereas some might claim that the phenomenon is something merely subjective, a veil or smoke screen, that conceals the objectively existing reality, phenomenologists reject what might be called a two-world doctrine, i.e., the proposal that we have to make a principled distinction between the world that presents itself to and can be understood by us and the world as it is in itself. This is certainly not to deny the distinction between mere appearance and reality – after all, some appearances are misleading – but, for phenomenologists, this distinction is not a distinction between two separate realms (falling in the provinces of phenomenology and science, respectively), but a distinction between two modes of manifestation. It is a distinction between how the objects might appear at a superficial glance, and how they might appear in the best of circumstances, for instance as a result of a thorough scientific investigation. Indeed, phenomenologists will typically claim that the world that appears to us, be it perceptually, in our daily use, or in scientific analysis, has all the required reality and objectivity. To claim that there exists, in addition, a behind-the-scenes world, a hidden world that transcends every type of givenness, every type of evidence, and that this is the really real reality, is rejected as an empty speculative claim by the phenomenologists. In fact, they would insist that the very proposal involves a category-mistake, a misapplication and abuse of the very concept of reality. Rather than defining objective reality in terms of an inaccessible and ungraspable beyond, phenomenologists would argue that the right place to locate objectivity is in, rather than beyond, the appearing world.

综上所述，关于现象学研究的范围和领域，我们该得出什么结论？现象学分析的最终利害关系是什么？它们主要应该被理解为对意识的细致探究吗？现在应该清楚的是，现象学并非主要（甚至并非唯一）关注心灵的结构。相反，现象学分析的真正焦点是心灵-世界二元组（或者，正如我们最终将看到的，自我-他者-世界三元组）。当我们思考意向性这一核心概念时，这一点将会更加清晰。

Given what has been said so far, what should one conclude regarding the very scope and domain of the phenomenological investigation? What is ultimately at stake in phenomenological analyses? Are they primarily to be understood as careful investigations of consciousness? As should be clear by now, phenomenology is not primarily (or even exclusively) focused on the structure of the mind. Rather, the proper focus of phenomenological analysis is the mind– world dyad (or, as we shall eventually see, the self–other–world triad). This will become clearer the moment we consider the central concept of intentionality.

笔记

NOTES

  1. Beauvoir, S. de (1965). 《人生的盛年》，P. Green 译。哈蒙兹沃思：企鹅出版社，135 页。

  3. 胡塞尔， E.（2001c）。《关于被动与主动综合的分析：先验逻辑讲座》，A. Steinbock译。多德雷赫特：克鲁维尔学术出版社：41。
  4. Husserl, E. (2001c). Analyses Concerning Passive and Active Synthesis: Lectures on Transcendental Logic, trans. A. Steinbock. Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers: 41.
  5. Heidegger, M. (1996). 《存在与时间》，J. Stambaugh 译。纽约州奥尔巴尼：纽约州立大学：25。
  6. Heidegger, M. (1996). Being and Time, trans. J. Stambaugh. Albany, NY: SUNY: 25.
