  44. Husserl, E. (1989). Ideas Pertaining to a Pure Phenomenology and to a Phenomenological Philosophy. Second Book. Studies in the Phenomenology of Constitution, trans. R. Rojcewicz and A. Schuwer. Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers: 152–153.
  45. 胡塞尔， E.（1973a）。Zur Phänomenologie der Intersubjektivität II。文本 aus dem Nachlass。茨韦特·泰尔. 1921–1928，编辑。作者：I.克恩。 Husserliana 14。海牙：Martinus Nijhoff：75。
  46. Husserl, E. (1973a). Zur Phänomenologie der Intersubjektivität II. Texte aus dem Nachlass. Zweiter Teil. 1921–1928, ed. by I. Kern. Husserliana 14. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 75.
  47. Leder, D. (1990). 《失踪的尸体》。伊利诺伊州芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社。
  48. Leder, D. (1990). The Absent Body. Chicago, IL: University of Chicago Press.
  49. 梅洛-庞蒂， M.（2012）。《知觉现象学》，DA Landes 译。伦敦：劳特利奇：144。
  50. Merleau-Ponty, M. (2012). Phenomenology of Perception, trans. D.A. Landes. London: Routledge: 144.
  51. 胡塞尔， E. (1977)。《现象学心理学：1925年夏季学期讲座》，J. Scanlon译。海牙：Martinus Nijhoff：151。
  52. Husserl, E. (1977). Phenomenological Psychology: Lectures, Summer Semester, 1925, trans. J. Scanlon. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 151.
  53. 梅洛-庞蒂， M. (2012). 《知觉现象学》，DA Landes 译。伦敦：劳特利奇：204–205。
  54. Merleau-Ponty, M. (2012). Phenomenology of Perception, trans. D.A. Landes. London: Routledge: 204–205.
  55. Heinämaa, S. (2003)。《迈向性别差异现象学：胡塞尔、梅洛-庞蒂、波伏娃》。马里兰州兰纳姆：Rowman & Littlefield。
  56. Heinämaa, S. (2003). Toward a Phenomenology of Sexual Difference: Husserl, Merleau-Ponty, Beauvoir. Lanham, MD: Rowman & Littlefield.

进一步阅读的建议

SUGGESTIONS FOR FURTHER READING

  • 露娜·多尔扎尔（Luna Dolezal），《身体与羞耻：现象学、女权主义与社会塑造的身体》。马里兰州兰纳姆：列克星敦图书，2015年。
  • Luna Dolezal, The Body and Shame: Phenomenology, Feminism, and the Socially Shaped Body. Lanham, MD: Lexington Books, 2015.
  • Sara Heinämaa，《性别差异现象学：胡塞尔、梅洛-庞蒂、波伏娃》。马里兰州兰纳姆：Rowman & Littlefield出版社，2003年。
  • Sara Heinämaa, Toward a Phenomenology of Sexual Difference: Husserl, Merleau-Ponty, Beauvoir. Lanham, MD: Rowman & Littlefield, 2003.
  • 德鲁·莱德，《消失的尸体》。芝加哥：芝加哥大学出版社，1990年。
  • Drew Leder, The Absent Body. Chicago: Chicago University Press, 1990.
  • Joona Taipale，《现象学与具身化：胡塞尔与主体性构成》。伊利诺伊州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社，2014年。
  • Joona Taipale, Phenomenology and Embodiment: Husserl and the Constitution of Subjectivity. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press, 2014.

8 主体间性与社会性

8 INTERSUBJECTIVITY AND SOCIALITY

DOI：10.4324/9781003350682-11

DOI: 10.4324/9781003350682-11

现象学在主体间性这个话题上有什么有趣的观点吗？正如一种常见的批评所说，由于现象学过于关注主体性，它不仅未能认识到主体间性的真正意义，而且从根本上也无法令人满意地解决这个问题。1然而，仔细研究舍勒、斯坦因、胡塞尔、海德格尔、古尔维奇、萨特、梅洛-庞蒂和列维纳斯等人的著作就会发现，这种批评是完全错误的。事实上，主体间性被现象学家赋予了绝对的核心地位。第一个对主体间性（Intersubjektivität ）概念进行系统而广泛的讨论的哲学家正是胡塞尔，这绝非巧合。

Has phenomenology anything of interest to say on the topic of intersubjectivity? As one frequently stated criticism has it, due to its preoccupation with subjectivity, phenomenology did not only fail to realise the true significance of intersubjectivity, but was also fundamentally incapable of addressing the issue in a satisfactory manner.1 As a closer scrutiny of the writings of such figures as Scheler, Stein, Husserl, Heidegger, Gurwitsch, Sartre, Merleau-Ponty, and Levinas is bound to reveal, however, this criticism is quite misplaced. The truth of the matter is that intersubjectivity is ascribed an absolutely central role by phenomenologists. It is no coincidence that the first philosopher ever to subject the very notion of intersubjectivity (Intersubjektivität) to a systematic and extensive discussion was none other than Husserl.

远非忽视主体间性和社会性问题，现象学传统包含丰富多样、甚至偶尔相互竞争的论述。尽管存在诸多差异，我们仍然可以指出大多数不同方法中都存在一些显著特征：

Far from ignoring the issues of intersubjectivity and sociality, the phenomenological tradition contains rich but quite diverse and even occasionally competing accounts. Despite their diversity, it is still possible to point to certain distinctive features that can be found in most of the different approaches:

  • 现象学家从未否认语言的显著的主体间性特征，但他们经常努力发掘前语言或超语言形式的主体间性，无论是在感知、工具使用、情感还是身体意识方面。
  • Without ever denying the eminently intersubjective character of language, phenomenologists have often endeavoured to unearth pre- or extra-linguistic forms of intersubjectivity, be it in perception, in tool use, in emotions, or body awareness.
  • 现象学家从未将主体间性视为世界上客观存在的结构，可以从一个角度进行全面描述和分析。第三人称视角。相反，主体间性是主体之间的关系，其完整分析必须包括对主体的参考和调查。第一人称视角。
  • Phenomenologists never conceive of intersubjectivity as an objectively existing structure in the world that can be comprehensively described and analysed from a third-person perspective. On the contrary, intersubjectivity is a relation between subjects and its full analysis must include a reference to and an investigation of the first-person perspective.
  • 许多现象学家的核心观点之一是，对主体间性的阐释需要同时分析主体性与世界之间的关系。也就是说，仅仅将主体间性插入到既定框架的某个地方是不够的；相反，这三个维度““自我”、“他者”和“世界”相互阐释，只有在它们相互关联中才能被充分理解。正如梅洛-庞蒂所言，如果主体间性真的可能存在，那么主体就必须被视为一种嵌入的、具身的存在，而世界则必须被视为一个共同的经验场域。
  • One of the crucial ideas found in many phenomenologists is that an account of intersubjectivity requires a simultaneous analysis of the relationship between subjectivity and world. That is, it is not satisfactory simply to insert intersubjectivity somewhere within an already established framework; rather, the three dimensions “self”, “other”, and “world” reciprocally illuminate one another and can only be fully understood in their interconnection. As Merleau-Ponty would put it, the subject must be seen as an embedded and embodied existence, and the world as a common field of experience, if intersubjectivity is at all to be possible.

本章不可能涵盖这一丰富讨论的所有方面，但让我先从一个大家普遍关注的点开始：对“类比论证”。

It will be impossible to cover all facets of this rich discussion in the present chapter, but let me start with a point of common concern: The critical appraisal of the “argument from analogy”.

其他思想的问题

THE PROBLEM OF OTHER MINDS

在某些解读中，主体间性问题实际上是他人心灵问题的另一个名称。为什么会存在这个问题？因为据称我唯一能直接接触的心灵是我自己的。相比之下，我对他人心灵的接触总是通过他或她的身体行为来实现的。但是，对他人身体的感知怎么能为我提供有关其心灵的信息呢？解决这个问题的经典尝试之一被称为类比论证。就我自己而言，我可以观察到，当我的身体受到因果影响时，我会有经验，而且这些经验经常会带来某些行为。我观察到其他身体受到影响并以类似的方式行动，因此我通过类比推断，外来物体的行为可能与我类似的经验有关我自己。就我而言，被热水烫伤会让我产生强烈的疼痛，这种体验随后引发了尖叫这种截然不同的行为。当我观察到其他人被热水烫伤并尖叫时，我假设他们很可能也感受到了疼痛。因此，类比论证可以被解读为一种最佳解释的推论，它将我们从观察到的公共行为引向隐藏的精神原因。虽然这种推论并不能让我获得关于他人的不容置疑的知识，也无法让我真正体验到他人的思想，但至少它给了我更多的理由去相信他们的存在，而不是否认他们的存在。

On some readings, the problem of intersubjectivity is really another name for the problem of other minds. Why should there be a problem? Because the only mind I allegedly have direct access to is my own. My access to the mind of another is, by contrast, always mediated by his or her bodily behaviour. But how could the perception of another person’s body provide me with information about his mind? One of the classical attempts to come to grips with this problem is known as the argument from analogy. In my own case, I can observe that I have experiences when my body is causally influenced and that these experiences frequently bring about certain actions. I observe that other bodies are influenced and act in similar manners and I therefore infer through analogy that the behaviour of foreign bodies is probably associated with experiences similar to those I have myself. In my own case, being scalded by hot water is associated with the feeling of intense pain, this experience then gives rise to the quite distinct behaviour of screaming. When I observe other bodies being scalded by hot water and screaming, I assume that it is likely that they are also feeling pain. Thus, the argument from analogy can be interpreted as an inference to the best explanation, one that brings us from observed public behaviour to a hidden mental cause. Although this inference does not provide me with indubitable knowledge about others, and although it does not allow me to actually experience other minds, at least it gives me more reason to believe in their existence than in denying it.

这种解释我们对他人理解的方式并没有受到现象学家的热烈欢迎。他们都对此提出了批评。批评是多方面的，但在马克斯·舍勒的著作《同情的本质》和梅洛-庞蒂的论文《儿童与他人的关系》中，我们发现了一些核心的反对意见。

This way of accounting for our understanding of others has not exactly been met with much enthusiasm by phenomenologists. They have all criticised it. The criticism has been multifaceted, but in Max Scheler’s work The Nature of Sympathy and in Merleau-Ponty’s essay “The Child’s Relations with Others”, we find some of the core objections.

正如舍勒和梅洛-庞蒂指出的那样，类比论证认为我们对他人的理解本质上是推理性的，因此选择了一种在认知上要求过高的解释。婴儿（更不用说非人类动物）从很小的时候就对面部表情、姿势和语调敏感且有反应。但认为婴儿会将他人的微笑等视觉呈现与自己高兴时做出的面部动作进行比较，然后将自己感受到的快乐投射到他人身体的无形内在，这在心理学上是站不住脚的。2

As Scheler and Merleau-Ponty point out, by arguing that our understanding of others is inferential in nature, the argument from analogy opts for a cognitively far-too-demanding account. Infants (not to speak of non-human animals) are already from early on sensitive and responsive to facial expressions, posture, and intonation. But to suggest that the child compares the visual presentation of, say, the other’s smile with the facial movements it itself makes when happy and that the infant then projects its own felt happiness into the invisible interiority of the other’s body is psychologically implausible.2

他们两人都提出的另一个担忧如下。为了使类比论证能够成立，它必须依赖于我身体被赋予的方式与他人身体被赋予的方式之间的相似性。然而，我自身身体的内部感受和本体感受，并不与他人身体在视觉上呈现给我时一一对应。事实上，如果我要察觉到，比如说，我的笑声或尖叫声与他人的笑声或尖叫声之间的相似性，我需要采取更全面的视角。我需要将身体姿势理解为表达性现象，理解为喜悦或痛苦的表现，而不仅仅是身体动作。但如果类比论证的成功需要这样的理解，该论证预设了它所要建立的前提。换句话说，只有当我们已经确信我们面对的是具有思维的生物，但仍然不确定该如何解释所讨论的表达现象时，我们才会运用类比推理。3

Another concern that they also both raise is the following. In order for the argument from analogy to succeed, it has to rely on a similarity between the way in which my own body is given to me, and the way in which the body of the other is given to me. However, my own body as it is intero- and proprioceptively felt by me does not correspond point by point to the other’s body as it is visually presented to me. Indeed, if I am to detect a similarity between, say, my laughing or screaming and the laughing or screaming of somebody else, I need to adopt a more global perspective. I need to understand the bodily gestures as expressive phenomena, as manifestations of joy or pain, and not simply as physical movements. But if such an understanding is required for the argument of analogy to succeed, the argument presupposes what it is supposed to establish. To put it differently, we only employ analogical lines of reasoning when we are already convinced that we are facing minded creatures, but simply remain unsure about precisely how we are to interpret the expressive phenomena in question.3

在这些初步思考之后，舍勒和梅洛-庞蒂对他们的批评进行了更深入的探讨。舍勒则质疑了类比论证中的两个关键预设。首先，该论证假设我的出发点是我自身的意识。意识以一种非常直接且未经中介的方式被赋予，正是这种纯粹的精神自我体验，才被认为先于并使得对他人的认知成为可能。一个人在自身中安居，然后将自己在自身中发现的东西投射到他不认识的他人身上。顺便说一句，这意味着一个人只能理解那些自己已经在自身中体验过的他人的心理状态。其次，该论证假设我们永远无法直接接触他人的心灵。我们永远无法体验她的思想或感受；我们只能根据实际呈现在我们面前的事物，即她的身体行为，推断它们必然存在。尽管这两个假设看似显而易见，但舍勒却对它们都予以了否定。正如他所指出的，我们应该关注实际给定的东西，而不是让某种理论决定可以给定什么。4在舍勒看来，类比论证高估了他人经验所涉及的困难，而低估了自我经验所涉及的困难。5我们不应该忽视对他人的直接感知，也不应该忽视我们自身经验的具体化和嵌入性。因此，舍勒否认我们最初的自我认识具有纯粹的精神性质，这种性质先于我们对自身表达性动作和行动的体验，并且是在与他人隔绝的情况下发生的。他还否认我们对他人的基本认识本质上是推理性的。正如他所论证的，声称主体间理解是一个两阶段过程，其中第一阶段是对无意义行为的感知，第二阶段是基于智力的对心理意义的归因，这种说法有很大问题。这种说法不仅给我们呈现了行为的扭曲画面，也给我们呈现了心理。我们用心理学术语来描述行为，而我们很难用纯粹的动作来描述后者，这并非巧合。在大多数情况下，将一个现象清晰地划分为心理层面和行为层面是相当困难的（而且很不自然的）——想想痛苦的呻吟、握手、拥抱。相反，在面对面的相遇，我们面对的并非仅仅是一具身体，也不是一个隐藏的心灵，而是一个统一的整体。舍勒偶尔会提到一种“表达性统一”。只有随后，通过一个抽象的过程，这种统一才能被分割，我们的兴趣才能“向内”或“向外”发展。6

After these initial considerations, Scheler and Merleau-Ponty dig deeper in their criticism. Scheler, for his part, questions two crucial presuppositions in the argument from analogy. First, the argument assumes that my starting point is my own consciousness. This is what is given to me in a quite direct and unmediated fashion, and it is this purely mental self-experience that is then taken to precede and make possible the recognition of others. One is at home in oneself and one then projects onto the other, whom one does not know, what one already finds in oneself. Incidentally, this implies that one is only able to understand those psychological states in others that one has already experienced in oneself. Second, the argument assumes that we never have direct access to another person’s mind. We can never experience her thoughts or feelings; we can only infer that they must exist based on what is actually presented to us, namely her bodily behaviour. Although these two assumptions may seem perfectly obvious, Scheler rejects both. As he points out, we should pay attention to what is actually given, rather than letting some theory dictate what can be given.4 In Scheler’s view, the argument from analogy overestimates the difficulties involved in the experience of others and underestimates the difficulties involved in self-experience.5 We should not ignore what can be directly perceived about others, nor should we fail to acknowledge the embodied and embedded character of our own self-experience. Scheler consequently denies that our initial self-acquaintance is of a purely mental nature that precedes our experience of our own expressive movements and actions and that takes place in isolation from others. He also denies that our basic acquaintance with others is inferential in nature. As he argues, there is something highly problematic about claiming that intersubjective understanding is a two-stage process, of which the first stage is the perception of meaningless behaviour and the second an intellectually based attribution of psychological meaning. Such an account presents us with a distorted picture, not only of behaviour but also of the mind. It is no coincidence that we use psychological terms to describe behaviour and that we would be hard-pressed to describe the latter in terms of bare movements. In the majority of cases, it is quite difficult (and artificial) to divide a phenomenon neatly into a psychological and a behavioural aspect – think merely of a groan of pain, a handshake, an embrace. On the contrary, in the face-to-face encounter, we are not confronted with a mere body, or with a hidden psyche, but with a unified whole. Scheler occasionally speaks of an “expressive unity”. It is only, subsequently, through a process of abstraction, that this unity can be divided, and our interest can then proceed “inwards” or “outwards”.6

我们在梅洛-庞蒂的著作中也发现了类似的思考，他不仅认为愤怒、羞耻、仇恨和爱并非隐藏于他人意识深处的心理事实，而是可以从外部看到的行为类型或行为方式。这些正如梅洛-庞蒂所说，情绪存在于面部表情或姿势中，而不是隐藏在它们背后。7简而言之，它们通过身体姿势和动作表达出来，从而为他人所见。梅洛-庞蒂进一步声称，古典心理学无法对我们如何与他人相处的问题提供令人满意的解决方案，是因为它的整个方法都建立在某些不容置疑且毫无根据的哲学偏见之上。其中最重要的是这样一个基本假设：体验生活只能由一个人，即拥有它的人直接获得，而一个人对另一个人心灵的唯一接触是间接的，并且通过他或她的身体外表来中介。8但梅洛-庞蒂拒绝接受这样的观点：我的体验生活是一系列除了我之外任何人都无法接触的内部状态。相反，在他看来，我们的体验生活首先是一种与世界的关系，正是在这种对待世界的态度中，我才能发现他人的意识。正如他所写，“从我将他和我自己定义为在世界上运作的‘行为’的那一刻起，对他人的视角就向我敞开了”。9因此，梅洛-庞蒂认为，如果我们想要理解我们如何与他人建立联系并理解他人，就需要重新定义我们的“心灵”概念。

We find similar considerations in Merleau-Ponty, who not only argues that anger, shame, hate, and love, rather than being psychic facts which are hidden at the bottom of another’s consciousness, are types of behaviour or styles of conduct that are visible from the outside. Such emotions exist, as Merleau-Ponty puts it, in the face or in those gestures, and not hidden behind them.7 They are, in short, expressed in bodily gestures and actions and are thereby visible to others. Merleau-Ponty furthermore claims that the incapacity of classical psychology to provide a satisfactory solution to the problem of how we relate to others is due to the fact that it bases its entire approach on certain unquestioned and unwarranted philosophical prejudices. First and foremost among these is the fundamental assumption that experiential life is directly accessible to one person only, namely the individual who owns it, and that the only access one has to the psyche of another is indirect and mediated by his or her bodily appearance.8 But Merleau-Ponty rejects the idea that my experiential life is a sequence of internal states that are inaccessible to anyone but me. Rather, in his view, our experiential life is, above all, a relation to the world, and it is in this comportment toward the world that I will also be able to discover the consciousness of the other. As he writes, the “perspective on the other is opened to me from the moment I define him and myself as ‘conducts’ at work in the world”.9 Merleau-Ponty consequently argues that we need to redefine our notion of psyche if we are to make it comprehensible how we can relate to and comprehend others.

现象学家一般采取具身感知的方法来理解他人和主体间性问题。我们首先认识到，我们对他人身体在场的感知不同于我们对物理事物的感知。他人的身体在场，是作为一个活生生的身体，一个积极参与世界的身体而存在的。事实上，正如萨特也指出的那样，认为我与他人身体的日常接触就是与生理学所描述的那种身体的接触，是一个决定性的错误。他人的身体总是在某种情境或有意义的语境中呈现给我，这种情境或语境由行动和行为共同决定。身体本身的表现力。10

Phenomenologists have, in general, taken an embodied perceptual approach to the questions of understanding others and the problem of intersubjectivity. We begin from the recognition that our perception of the other’s bodily presence is unlike our perception of physical things. The other is given in his or her bodily presence as a lived body, a body that is actively engaged in the world. It is, indeed, as Sartre also points out, a decisive mistake to think that my ordinary encounter with the body of another is an encounter with the kind of body described by physiology. The body of another is always given to me in a situation or meaningful context, which is co-determined by the action and expressivity of that very body.10

共情

EMPATHY

对类比论证的批判构成了众多现象学家共识的焦点。其中一些人，包括胡塞尔和斯坦，也认为我们对他人的理解依赖于一种独特的意向性，他们称之为同理心（Einfühlung）。11

The criticism of the argument from analogy constitutes a focal point of agreement among various phenomenologists. Some of them, including Husserl and Stein, also suggest that our understanding of others draws on a distinct type of intentionality, which they call empathy (Einfühlung).11

对于现象学家来说，同理心不应与情绪感染、富有想象力的视角，同情或怜悯。相反，他们认为同理心是一种基本的、基于感知的理解他人的形式，其他更复杂、更间接的人际理解形式都以同理心为前提并依赖于此。

For phenomenologists, empathy is not to be conflated with emotional contagion, imaginative perspective-taking, sympathy, or compassion. Rather, they consider empathy a basic, perceptually-based form of other-understanding, one that other more complex and indirect forms of interpersonal understanding presuppose and rely on.

因此，他们经常将同理心与“他者体验”或“他者知觉”等术语互换使用。12在他们看来，一个人可以在面对面的共情交流中了解他人的体验生活，这种交流具有直接性和即时性，而无论你在他人不在场时对他人持有什么信念，都没有这种直接性和即时性。正如胡塞尔所写，他人的思想、感受和欲望都直观地呈现在手势、语调和面部表情中。他人的表现力从一开始就充满了心理意义，正是同理心使我们能够理解和掌握这种心理意义。13

They consequently often used the term empathy interchangeably with terms such as other-experience or other-perception.12 In their view, one can obtain an acquaintance with the other’s experiential life in the empathic face-to-face encounter that has a directness and immediacy to it that is not shared by whatever beliefs you might have about the other in his or her absence. As Husserl writes, the mind of the other, his thinking, feeling, desiring, is intuitively present in the gestures, the intonation, and in the facial expressions. The expressivity of the other is imbued with psychological meaning from the start, and it is empathy that allows us to understand and grasp this psychological meaning.13

但他人的体验生活真的像我们自己的一样直接赋予我们吗？正如梅洛-庞蒂和斯坦因所坚持的那样，虽然我能从他人的感受中感知到他的悲伤或愤怒，但她的行为，在他脸上或手上，对方的悲伤和愤怒对我来说永远不会像对他那样具有同等重要的意义。对我来说，这些情况是展现出来的，对他来说，它们是经历出来的。14尽管 共情以最直接的方式宣告了对方体验的实际存在，但在我共情对方时所意识到的与对方正在经历的之间，总是必然存在着差异。也就是说，共情地体验对方的情感，与你体验自己情感的方式是不同的。15

But is the experiential life of the other really given as directly to us as our own? As both Merleau-Ponty and Stein would insist, although I can perceive the grief or the anger of the other in his or her conduct, in his face or hands, the grief and the anger of the other will never quite have the same significance for me as they have for him. For me these situations are displayed, for him they are lived through.14 Although empathy announces in the most direct manner possible, the actual presence of the other’s experience, there will always, and by necessity, remain a difference between that which I am aware of when I empathise with the other, and that which the other is experiencing. To experience, say, the emotion of the other empathically consequently differs from the way you would experience the emotion if it were your own.15

这也是斯坦因拒绝接受共情仅仅意味着将他人的经验传递到自身心灵中的观点的原因。共情的独特之处恰恰在于，被共情的经验存在于他人而非自身。16共情瞄准的是外来经验，但不会消除这些经验。异质性。与其模糊自我与他者之间的不对称性，并非导致某种融合或某种融合的个人身份感，而是自我体验与他者体验之间的不对称性，在这种解释中，对共情至关重要。胡塞尔偶尔会谈到共情，认为它使我们能够与真实的超越，并写道，我们的意识在同理心的驱使下超越了自身，并面临着一种全新的他性。17

This is also why Stein rejects the proposal that empathy literally involves the transmission of the other’s experience into one’s own mind. What is distinctive about empathy is precisely that the empathised experience is located in the other and not in oneself.16 Empathy targets foreign experiences without eliminating their alterity. Rather than blurring the distinction between self and other, rather than leading to some kind of fusion or some sense of merged personal identities, the asymmetry between self-experience and other-experience is in this account crucial for empathy. Husserl occasionally talks of empathy as that which permits us to encounter true transcendence and writes that our consciousness in empathy transcends itself and is confronted with otherness of a completely new kind.17

当我们声称我们能够体验他人，因此不必完全依赖和运用推理、模仿或投射时，这并不意味着我们能够以与她本人完全相同的方式体验他人，也不意味着我们能够以与自身完全相同的方式感知他人的意识。但当我体验他人的面部表情或有意义的行为时，我仍然在体验着外来的主观性，而不仅仅是想象、模拟或理论化它。我可能犯错和受骗的事实，并不能否定这种感知的体验性。此外，我对他人心灵的体验性与我对自身心灵的体验性有所不同，这未必是一种缺陷或不足。相反，正是由于这种差异，正是由于这种不对称性，我们才可以声称我们所体验的心灵是他人的心灵。正如胡塞尔所指出的，如果别人的意识像我自己的意识一样被赋予我，别人就不再是别人，而是成为我自己的一部分。18事实上，一种更精确的方式来捕捉其中的利害关系可能是这样说：当我们在经验中遇到其他主体时，我们总是将别人视为超出我们理解范围的主体。因此，别人的被给予性是一种非常特殊的类型。别人的他性恰恰体现在他或她的难以捉摸中。正如列维纳斯所观察到的，别人的缺席恰恰是他作为别人的在场。19可以说，别人的思想比我们所掌握的更多，但这并不意味着我们的理解是非经验性的。

When claiming that we are able to experience others, and as a consequence do not exclusively have to rely on and employ inferences, imitations, or projections, this is not meant to entail that we can experience the other in precisely the same way as she herself does, nor that the other’s consciousness is accessible to us in precisely the same way as our own is. But when I experience the facial expressions or meaningful actions of another, I am still experiencing foreign subjectivity, and not merely imagining it, simulating it, or theorising about it. The fact that I can be mistaken and deceived is no argument against the experiential character of the access. Moreover, the fact that my experiential access to the minds of others differs from my experiential access to my own mind need not be an imperfection or shortcoming. On the contrary, it is precisely because of this difference, precisely because of this asymmetry, that we can claim that the minds we experience are other minds. As Husserl points out, had the consciousness of the other been given to me in the same way as my own, the other would cease being an other and would instead become a part of myself.18 Indeed, a more precise way of capturing what is at stake might be by saying that when we experientially encounter other subjects, we always encounter others as subjects who surpass our grasp. Thus, the givenness of the other is of a most peculiar kind. The otherness of the other is precisely manifest in his or her elusiveness. As Levinas observed, the absence of the other is exactly his presence as other.19 There is, so to speak, more to the mind of the other than what we are grasping, but this does not make our understanding non-experiential.

通过允许与他人的具体和嵌入体验进行体验性接触的可能性，现象学家反对所谓的心智理论之争，即心智理论与心智模拟理论。后两种观点都否认体验他人心智的可能性。正是因为缺乏体验他人心智的途径，我们才需要依赖并运用理论推论或内部模拟。相比之下，现象学家则恰恰坚持认为，我们可以直接体验他人，将他者视为一个有心智的存在，一个其身体姿态和行为能够表达其体验或心智状态的存在。20

By allowing for the possibility of an experiential encounter with another’s embodied and embedded experiences, phenomenologists stand opposed to dominant positions within the so-called theory of mind debate, i.e., the theory-theory of mind and the simulation theory of mind. Both of the latter positions deny that it is possible to experience the minds of others. It is precisely because of the absence of an experiential access to other minds that we need to rely on and employ either theoretical inferences or internal simulations. By contrast, phenomenologists would precisely insist that we can experience the other directly as a minded being, as a being whose bodily gestures and actions are expressive of his or her experiences or states of mind.20

在一起

BEING-WITH

尽管许多现象学家都认为共情至关重要，但并非所有人都如此。海德格尔是一位对其重要性持怀疑态度的现象学家。对海德格尔而言，共情概念的引入是为了解释一个（孤立的）主体如何能够遇到并理解另一个（孤立的）主体。21在他看来，这种方法从根本上误解了共情的本质主体间性，因为它首先是个体之间的主题相遇，人们试图把握他人的情感或经历（这种内涵在德语中表示同情的单词“Einfühlung ”中尤为明显）。但正如海德格尔指出的那样，试图从主题上把握他人的经历本身就是一种例外，而不是常态。通常，我们不会将他人作为认知的主题对象来对待。相反，我们会在日常生活的世界中遇到他们，或者更准确地说，我们会在世俗的情境中遇到他们，而我们相处和相互理解的方式，其意义也由当时的情境共同决定。事实上，在我们日常的实际生活中，我们始终与他人相处。我们生活在一个公共的世界里，我们所做的工作、我们使用的工具、我们追求的目标，都包含对他人的指涉，无论他们是否真实存在：“我行走的这片贫瘠的田地代表着它的主人或佃户。停泊的帆船代表着某个特定的人，那个在帆船上航行的人。” 22的确，正如此在并非首先是一个无世界的主体，之后才被赋予一个世界。此在并非孤独，直到另一个世界偶然出现。认为必须在两个最初独立的自我——“我”与“你”之间建立桥梁或联系，本身就是一种根本性的误解。不存在任何可以通过共情来弥合的鸿沟，因为此在存在于世的基本构成要素就是其与世共存：

Whereas many phenomenologists assigned crucial importance to empathy, not everybody did. One phenomenologist who was sceptical about its significance was Heidegger. For Heidegger, the notion of empathy was introduced in order to explain how one (isolated) subject could encounter and understand another (isolated) subject.21 In his view, this approach fundamentally misconceived the nature of intersubjectivity, in that it took it to be first and foremost a thematic encounter between individuals, where one is trying to grasp the emotions or experiences of the other (this connotation is particularly obvious in the German word for empathy: Einfühlung). But as Heidegger points out, the very attempt to thematically grasp the experiences of others is the exception rather than the rule. Ordinarily, we do not encounter others as thematic objects of cognition. Rather, we encounter them in the world in which our daily life occurs, or, to be more precise, we encounter others in a worldly situation, and our way of being together and understanding each other is co-determined in its meaning by the situation at hand. In fact, in our daily life of practical concerns we are constantly with others. We are living in a public world, and the work we do, the tools we use, the goals we pursue, all contain references to others, regardless of whether or not they are factually present: “The poorly cultivated field along which I am walking appresents its owner or tenant. The sailboat at anchor appresents someone in particular, the one who takes his trips in it”.22 Indeed, just as Dasein is not first a worldless subject to whom a world is then subsequently added, Dasein is not alone until another happens to turn up. The very suggestion that a bridge or connection has to be established between two initially independent selves, an I and a Thou, is altogether a fundamental misunderstanding. There is no gap to be bridged by empathy, since a basic constituent of Dasein’s being-in-the-world is its being-with:

人们假设一个主体被封装于自身之中，现在承担着与另一个主体产生共情的任务。这种提法荒谬至极，因为从来就不存在此处所假设的那种主体。相反，如果将此在的构成视为在无预设的日常直接性中的存在与共存，那么显而易见，共情问题与外部世界实在性问题一样荒谬。23

It is assumed that a subject is encapsulated within itself and now has the task of empathizing with another subject. this way of formulating the question is absurd, since there never is such a subject in the sense it is assumed here. If the constitution of what is Dasein is instead regarded without presuppositions as in-being and being-with in the presuppositionless immediacy of everydayness, it then becomes clear that the problem of empathy is just as absurd as the question of the reality of the external world.23

海德格尔的批评突出了三个重要问题：1. 它清楚地表明，对主体间性的现象学研究不能仅仅关注面对面的相遇。2. 它提出了一个问题：什么是最根本的：是具体的面对面相遇，还是共享世界中的生活？3. 它促使我们思考，一个令人满意的主体间性解释是否需要强调自我与他者之间的差异，或者更确切地说，需要消除自我与他者之间的差异。

Heidegger’s criticism highlights three important issues: 1. It clearly shows that a phenomenological investigation of intersubjectivity cannot merely focus on the face-to-face encounter. 2. It raises the question of what is most fundamental, the concrete face-to-face encounter or life in a shared world. 3. It asks us to consider whether a satisfying account of intersubjectivity requires an emphasis on or rather an elimination of the difference between self and other.

至于第一个问题，海德格尔当然不是唯一提出这一主张的现象学家。正如萨特所解释的，器皿无可争辩地，它们指代的是众多身体上的他者，它们是由他们制造并被他们使用的。24从这个意义上讲，与他人的共存已经隐含在我们处理事务和利用事物的活动中。作为存在于世间的存在，我们始终依赖于他人：

As for the first issue, Heidegger was certainly not the only phenomenologist to make this claim. As Sartre explains, utensils incontestably refer to a plurality of bodily others by whom they have been manufactured and by whom they are used.24 To that extent, the coexistence of others is already co-implied in our activities of taking care of matters and utilising things. As existing in-the-world, we constantly depend upon others:

生活在一个被邻居困扰的世界里，不仅意味着能够在道路的每个拐弯处遇到其他人；也意味着我发现自己身处一个工具情结可以发挥作用的世界。我的自由计划并没有首先赋予它们意义。这也意味着，在这个已经赋予意义的世界中，我遇见了一种属于我自己的意义，它并非我赋予自己的，而是我“早已拥有”的。25

to live in a world haunted by my neighbor is not only to be able to encounter the other at every turn of the road; it is also to find myself engaged in a world in which instrumental-complexes can have a meaning which my free project has not first given to them. It means also that in the midst of this world already provided with meaning I meet with a meaning which is mine and which I have not given to myself, which I discover that I “possess already”.25

因此，世界上存在着有用的物品，表明我们属于一个主体共同体。在我使用设备或工具时，我最直接的目标是任何人的目标：我把自己理解为可以与我的任何邻居互换，并且不将自己与他们区分开来。最终，每当我使用别人为匿名消费者（即纯粹的“某人”）制造的工具时，我就丧失了自己的个体性。每当我试穿一双鞋，或打开一瓶酒，或踏入电梯，或在剧院里大笑，正如萨特所写，我都在把自己变成“任何人”。26到目前为止一切都很好，但正如萨特接下来所言，我们不应忘记，一个物体只有在我具体遇到的其他人教会我如此使用的情况下，才会在我看来是“某人”以如此方式使用的一件设备。27胡塞尔的著作中也存在类似的思想，他早在《观念二》中就指出，除了源自他人的倾向之外，还存在着由习俗和传统：“一个人”如此评判，“一个人”如此这般地拿叉子，等等。28我从他人那里学习什么是正常的——事实上，最初和大部分时候，都是从我最亲近的人那里学习，因此，从我一起长大的人、我的老师以及我生活中最亲密的人那里学习。正是通过这种方式，我参与到了一种共同体传统中。胡塞尔将正常生活称为生成性生活，并指出每个（正常）人都是历史性的，因为他们被构成为一个历史性地延续下来的共同体。29最终，每一代新人都会继承前几代人辛勤劳动所构建的一切，并通过重塑这一遗产，为构建传统的共同体统一性做出自己的贡献。共同体和共同体化本身就指向代际链条的开放无尽性，而这反过来又指向人类存在本身的历史性。

Hence, the existence of objects of use in the world indicates our membership in a community of subjects. In my use of equipment or instruments, my most immediate goals are those of anybody: I grasp myself as interchangeable with any of my neighbours, and do not distinguish myself from them. Ultimately, whenever I make use of an instrument that was manufactured by others for an anonymous consumer, i.e., for a sheer “someone”, I forfeit my own individuality. Whenever I try on a pair of shoes, or uncork a bottle, or step into an elevator, or laugh in a theatre, I am, as Sartre writes, making myself into “anyone”.26 So far so good, but as Sartre then continues, we shouldn’t forget that an object can only appear to me as a piece of equipment that “one” uses in such and such a manner, if I have been taught so by others that I have encountered concretely.27 Related ideas can also be found in Husserl, who already in Ideas II pointed to the fact that, next to the tendencies originating from other persons, there also exist indeterminate general demands made by custom and tradition: “One” judges thus, “one” holds the fork in such and such a way, etc.28 I learn what counts as normal from others – and, indeed, initially and for the most part from those closest to me, hence from those I grow up with, those who teach me, and those belonging to the most intimate sphere of my life. And it is in this way that I participate in a communal tradition. Husserl refers to normal life as generative life, and states that every (normal) human being is historical in virtue of being constituted as a member of a historically enduring community.29 In the end, each new generation inherits what was constituted through the labour of previous generations, and by reshaping this heritage it then makes its own contribution to the constitution of the communal unity of the tradition. Community and communalisation inherently point beyond themselves to the open endlessness of the chain of generations, and this in turn points to the historicity of human existence itself.

至于第二个问题，舒茨向我们提出了一个平衡的观点。舒茨认为直接面对面的相遇是最基本的，因为所有其他形式的人际理解都源于这种相遇。30但正如他不断强调的那样，人际理解有多种形式和形态，如果我们想要公正地对待这种多样性和复杂性，就必须超越狭隘地关注同理心可以传递信息。我们对他人的理解从来不会凭空产生；它并不像快照那样。通常，我们总是带着一定的知识去与他人接触，这既包括更普遍的知识，也常常包括关于特定人的知识，比如他的习惯、兴趣等等。31即使在直接的社会互动中，这些知识也能成为一种解释方案。因此，人们可以接受海德格尔的批判观点，同时仍然认为同理心的概念是有用的。我们应该承认，我们对他人的典型理解是情境化的，并且应该意识到，正确理解的同理心不是将自己情感投射到他人身上的问题，而是一种将行为体验为心灵表达的能力，即一种在他人富有表现力的行为和有意义的行动中洞察其心灵生活的能力。

As for the second issue, Schutz presents us with a balanced view. Schutz considers the direct face-to-face encounter basic in the sense that all other forms of interpersonal understanding derive their validity from this kind of encounter.30 But as he keeps emphasising, interpersonal understanding comes in many forms and shapes, and if we wish to do justice to this variety and complexity we must go beyond what a narrow focus on empathy can deliver. Our understanding of others never takes place in a vacuum; it does not have the format of a snapshot. Ordinarily, we always bring a stock of knowledge to the encounter with the other, both knowledge of a more general sort, but frequently also knowledge regarding the particular person in question, knowledge of his habits, interests, etc.31 This knowledge comes to serve as an interpretive scheme even in the case of direct social interaction. One can consequently accept the critical point made by Heidegger and still consider the notion of empathy to be useful. One should simply acknowledge that our typical understanding of others is contextual and realise that empathy, properly understood, is not a question of feelingly projecting oneself into the other, but rather an ability to experience behaviour as expressive of mind, i.e., an ability to access the life of the mind of others in their expressive behaviour and meaningful action.

至于最后一个问题，萨特最终对海德格尔的方法提出了严厉的批评。在萨特看来，淡化或忽视面对面的相遇，并强调我们日常的彼此存在在很大程度上具有匿名性和可替代性——正如海德格尔所说，他人就是我身在其中的人，但“我大多无法将自己与他人区分开来” 32——就等于忽略了真正关键的所在。主体间性：与激进的他者的相遇和对抗。萨特强调他性与后来，列维纳斯将超越他者的概念激进化，他也攻击海德格尔提出了一个总体化的解释，未能尊重和欣赏他者的他性和差异性。33列维纳斯在其著作中继续论证，我与他者的相遇是与某种无法概念化或分类的事物的相遇：“如果一个人能够拥有、掌握和了解他者，那就不再是他者了”。34与他者的相遇是与一种不可言喻的他性的相遇。这种相遇不受我所能控制的任何事物的制约，但却具有造访、顿悟或启示的特征。列维纳斯随后以他者为代表的论证方式指出，与他者的真正相遇，而非感知或认识的相遇，其本质是伦理的。35 对列维纳斯和萨特而言，如果试图消除主体间性与主体间性之间的差异，那么这种解释将会失败。自我与他者。对其他现象学家来说，过分强调自我与他者之间不可化约的差异，只会使它们之间的关系和联系变得难以理解。正如这一僵局所示，现象学对主体间性的阐释所面临的决定性挑战之一，就是在自我与他者的相似性与差异性之间找到适当的平衡。

As for the final issue, Sartre eventually voiced a harsh criticism of Heidegger’s approach. To downplay or ignore the face-to-face encounter and to emphasise the extent to which our everyday being-with-one-another is characterised by anonymity and substitutability – as Heidegger puts it, the others are those among whom one is, but from whom “one mostly does not distinguish oneself”32 – is, according to Sartre, to miss out on what is actually at stake in intersubjectivity: The encounter and confrontation with radical otherness. Sartre’s highlighting of the alterity and transcendence of the other was subsequently radicalised by Levinas, who also attacked Heidegger for offering a totalising account that failed to respect and appreciate the alterity and difference of the other.33 In his own work, Levinas went on to argue that my encounter with the other is an encounter with something that cannot be conceptualised or categorised: “If one could possess, grasp, and know the other, it would not be other”.34 The encounter with the other is an encounter with an ineffable alterity. It is an encounter that is not conditioned by anything in my power, but which has the character of a visitation, an epiphany, or a revelation. In a characteristic move, Levinas then argued that the authentic encounter with the other, rather than being perceptual or epistemic, is ethical in nature.35 For both Levinas and Sartre, an account of intersubjectivity will fail if it tries to eliminate the difference between self and other. For other phenomenologists, too much emphasis on the irreducible difference between self and other simply makes their relation and connection incomprehensible. As this impasse indicates, one of the decisive challenges facing a phenomenological account of intersubjectivity is to find the proper balance between the similarity and difference of self and other.

社区

COMMUNITY

我们在现象学的社会性研究中发现，不仅仅是关于我们如何相互理解的讨论。这项初步研究逐渐引发了关于更大群体形态的丰富讨论，并最终发展成为对社群生活的有针对性的探索。有趣的是，考虑到刚才提出的不同观点，我们或许并不意外地发现，这里也存在两种截然不同的现象学路径。一种路径坚持认为，社群经验和我们关系根植于并依赖于特定形式的人际理解，因此，对不同群体形态进行恰当的现象学阐释，需要探索个体在经验上的相互关联。另一方则认为，任何对二元面对面关系的偏爱都必然会错失社区生活的真正独特之处。

What we find in phenomenological work on sociality is not merely a discussion of how we come to understand each other. This initial work gradually gave rise to a rich discussion of larger group formations and eventually resulted in a targeted exploration of communal life. Interestingly, and perhaps not surprisingly given the different views just presented, it is also possible here to trace out two divergent phenomenological approaches. One insists that communal experiences and we-relationships are rooted in and dependent upon specific forms of interpersonal understanding, and that a proper phenomenological account of different group formations consequently requires an exploration of how individuals are experientially interrelated. The other argues that any privileging of the dyadic face-toface relationship is bound to miss out on what is truly distinctive about communal life.

接下来，让我来介绍和讨论这两种相互竞争的观点。正如我们已经看到的，舍勒区分了我们直接理解他人的精神生活，因为它在他们身体上被感知地表现出来表达能力来自我们偶尔也会使用的更间接的类比推理形式。在他的著作《自然》中，同情，舍勒继续提供了不同类型的情感关系的细粒度分类，并强调了以下内容的区别：

Let me, in turn, present and discuss these two competing views. As we have already seen, Scheler distinguishes our ability to directly grasp the minded life of others as it is perceptually manifest in their bodily expressivity from more indirect forms of analogical reasoning that we also occasionally employ. In his work, The Nature of Sympathy, Scheler goes on to offer a fine-grained taxonomy of different types of emotional relatedness, and highlights the distinctions between the following:

  • 情绪感染，即一个人受到他人情绪状态的影响（或感染），例如他们的喜悦或恐惧。
  • Emotional contagion, where one is affected (or infected) by the emotional state of others, say, their joy or fear.
  • 同情，是对他人情绪状态的情感反应。
  • Sympathy, which is an emotional response to the other’s emotional state.
  • 情感分享，即与他人共同体验某种情感。36
  • Emotional sharing, which involves experiencing an emotion together with a co-subject as ours.36

在《伦理学中的形式主义和价值的非形式伦理学》一书中，舍勒重新讨论了这些区别，但补充说，它们在不同的社会单位中也有效，哲学家的任务社会学的目标是发展一套理论来解释这些不同的群体形态是如何相互关联的。举例来说，舍勒区分了人群、协会和社区，他认为人群受情绪感染的支配，协会是由使用类比推理的相互不信任的个人通过工具性联系而形成的人工统一体，社区的特点是情感分享、信任和互惠。37因此，仔细研究和分析不同形式的人际关系和理解被认为是迈向社会形态现象学的重要基石。舍勒对社区和社会的区分也可以在格尔达·瓦尔特的著作中找到。瓦尔特将协会定义为出于纯粹的战略或工具性考虑而决定联合起来的个人的集合。相比之下，社区是由将自己和他人视为“我们”的成员并通过团结纽带联系在一起的个人组成的。更具体地说，瓦尔特探讨了对社群进行现象学研究时，必须考量“我们”体验的本质和结构，以及后者如何涉及成员之间的内在联系、归属感或相互统一。正如瓦尔特所写：“只有凭借他们内在的联系，凭借那种团结感——即使是松散和有限的——也是一种转变为社区的社会形态” 。38

In the work Formalism in Ethics and Non-Formal Ethics of Values, Scheler returned to these distinctions, but added that they are also operative in different social units, and that the task of a philosophical sociology is to develop a theory of how these different group formations are interrelated. To exemplify, Scheler distinguishes the crowd, which he takes to be ruled by emotional contagion, the association, which he considers an artificial unity of instrumentally interrelated distrustful individuals who employ analogical reasoning, and the community, which is characterised by emotional sharing, trust, and reciprocity.37 A careful investigation and analysis of different forms of interpersonal relation and understanding is, consequently, considered an important stepping stone towards a phenomenology of social formations. Scheler’s distinction between community and society can also be found in the work of Gerda Walther. Walther defines an association as an aggregation of individuals who decide to join forces out of purely strategic or instrumental considerations. A community, by contrast, is formed by individuals who understand themselves and the others as members of a we, and who are tied together by bonds of solidarity. More specifically, Walther talks about how a phenomenological investigation of the community must consider the nature and structure of we-experiences, and how the latter involve an inner bond, a feeling of togetherness, or a reciprocal unification between its members. As Walther writes: “Only with their inner bond, with that feeling of togetherness – even if loose and limited – is a social formation transformed into a community”.38

但这种内在的联系或统一是如何产生的呢？瓦尔特在此明确承认，她自己的研究在很大程度上预设并建立在对……的分析之上。先前的现象学家所提供的同理心。39更具体地说，她讨论了我们的体验如何不再被感受为我的或你的，而是我们的，这是相互同情行为相互交织的过程的结果。40

But how is this inner bond or unification brought about? It is revealing here that Walther explicitly acknowledges the extent to which her own investigation presupposes and builds upon the analyses of empathy offered by previous phenomenologists.39 More specifically, she discusses how we-experiences come to be felt not as mine or yours, but as ours, as a result of a process of interlocking acts of reciprocal empathy.40

胡塞尔也提出这样一种观点，即特殊的相互同情可能在我们视角的发展中发挥关键作用。

The idea that a special kind of reciprocal empathy might play a crucial role in the development of a we-perspective is also to be found in Husserl.

在二十世纪二十年代和三十年代早期的手稿中，胡塞尔认为，我对他人的共情体验——反过来，他人也经验性地指向我自己——构成了“我们”行为的可能性条件。41 胡塞尔探讨了当我与他人对话，以及当他人意识到自己被对话，并回应我时会发生什么。当我们双方都意识到自己正在被他人体验和理解时，我们就在进行着沟通行为，通过这种沟通行为，一个更高层次的人际统一体——一个“我们”——得以建立。42因此，胡塞尔强调了对话对于“我们”构成的核心地位，并谈到沟通作为一种社区创建行为。43

In manuscripts from the early twenties and thirties, Husserl argues that my empathic experience of another, who is, in turn, experientially directed at myself, such that my experience of the other involves a co-experience of myself, is a condition of possibility for we-acts.41 Husserl explores what happens when I address the other and when the other is aware that he is being addressed and when he reciprocates. When both of us become aware that we are being experienced and understood by the other, we are dealing with communicative acts through which a higher interpersonal unity – a we – can be established.42 Husserl consequently emphasises the centrality of dialogue for the constitution of the we, and speaks of communication as a community-creating act.43

然而，并非所有人都认同这种强调具身二元关系对于共同体体验的重要性的观点。在海德格尔和古尔维奇的著作中，我们发现了各种各样的批评。鉴于此前对海德格尔立场的论述，他的批评也就不足为奇了。海德格尔不仅否认共情具有任何本体论或认识论的首要性，他还明确指出：“‘彼此相伴’不能用‘我-你’关系来解释。” 44

Not everybody, however, would agree with this insistence on the importance of embodied dyadic relations for communal experiences. In the work of Heidegger and Gurwitsch, we find various criticisms. Given what has earlier been said about Heidegger’s position, his criticisms should not come as a surprise. Not only does Heidegger deny that empathy has any ontological or epistemic primacy, he explicitly argues that: “The with-one-another cannot be explained through the I-Thou relation”.44

海德格尔承认，人们聚集在一起的方式有很多，从无名且令人反感的群体，到保龄球队，再到一伙强盗。但只要我们仅仅把“我们”看作多元体，看作“个体人类的集合”，45或“众多分离的‘我’”，46在他看来，我们就无法理解真正的共同体是什么。47在一次讲座中1934年，海德格尔进一步指出，我们，人民，Volk，并非由几个独立的主体同意建立一个共同体而产生。相反，它总是基于共同的历史和血统。48

Heidegger acknowledges that there are many ways in which people can come together, from a nameless and revolting mass, to a bowling team, or a band of robbers. But as long as we think simply of the we as a plurality, as an “assembly of individual human beings”,45 or as a “multitude of separate Is”,46 we will, in his view, not have grasped what a genuine community is.47 In a lecture from 1934, Heidegger goes on to argue that the we, the people, the Volk, doesn’t come about because several independent subjects agree to establish a community. Rather, it is always already decided, based on shared history and descent.48

在古尔维奇（Gurwitsch）的著作中也发现了类似的批评。古尔维奇对瓦尔特（Walther）提到的“归属感”提出质疑，并指出，人们不仅应该认识到，战略性联系有时会伴随着积极的情感而产生，而且应该认识到，即使冲突或争执取代了积极的情绪，社群也未必会受到威胁或破坏。因此，即使在负面的人际关系中，社群成员身份仍然可以持续存在。情感是存在的。但如果团结感并非构成社区的要素，那么什么才是决定性的呢？对古尔维奇来说，关键因素是共同的传统。虽然战略伙伴关系可以自愿建立和终止，但一个人生于社群，长于社群，这种社群成员身份并非可以自愿脱离的。49事实上，它完全超出了个人意志和决定的范畴。一个人与之结成社群的成员并非基于个人品质的自由选择，而是基于共同的传统。因此，社群化本质上是历史性的。我们在一个社群中的成员身份深深地影响着我们理解世界和自身的方式，因为它将我们植根于一个被视为理所当然的语境中。50

A somewhat comparable criticism can also be found in the work of Gurwitsch. Gurwitsch takes issue with Walther’s reference to a feeling of togetherness and argues that one should recognise not only that strategic associations can sometimes occur accompanied by positive feelings, but also that a community is not necessarily threatened or undermined in cases where conflicts or feuds take the place of positive sentiments. Membership of a community can consequently persist even when negative interpersonal emotions are present. But if a feeling of togetherness is not what constitutes a community qua community, what is then decisive? For Gurwitsch, the essential factor is the presence of a shared tradition. Whereas strategic partnerships can be voluntarily initiated and discontinued, one is born into and brought up within a community, and this communal membership is not something from which one can voluntarily dissociate oneself.49 In fact, it is quite beyond the domain of personal will and decision. Those with whom one is communally joined have not been selected by free choice based on their personal qualities, but rather based on a shared heritage. Communalisation is, consequently, essentially historical. Our membership in a community deeply influences the way we understand both the world and ourselves by rooting us in a context that is taken for granted.50

关于社会性基础的现象学争论并没有随着海德格尔和古尔维奇的贡献而结束。关于二元性是否面对面的接触，或者更匿名、更群体性的相处方式，至今仍是人们优先选择的方式。51

The phenomenological debate about the foundations of sociality did not end with the contributions of Heidegger and Gurwitsch. The discussion of whether dyadic face-to-face encounters or more anonymous and communal forms of being-with-one-another have priority continues to this day.51

笔记

  67. 列维纳斯， E. (1987)。《时间与他者》，RA Cohen 译。宾夕法尼亚州匹兹堡：杜肯大学出版社：90。
  68. Levinas, E. (1987). Time and the Other, trans. R.A. Cohen. Pittsburgh, PA: Duquesne University Press: 90.
  69. 列维纳斯， E. (1969)。《整体与无限：论外部性》，A. Lingis 译。宾夕法尼亚州匹兹堡：杜肯大学出版社：43。
  70. Levinas, E. (1969). Totality and Infinity: An Essay on Exteriority, trans. A. Lingis. Pittsburgh, PA: Duquesne University Press: 43.
  71. Scheler, M. (2008). 《同情的本质》，P. Heath 译。伦敦：交易：8，12–13，15。
  72. Scheler, M. (2008). The Nature of Sympathy, trans. P. Heath. London: Transaction: 8, 12–13, 15.
  73. Scheler, M. (1973). 《伦理学中的形式主义与价值的非形式伦理学：构建伦理人格主义基础的新尝试》，MS Frings 和 RL Funk 译。伊利诺伊州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社：525–529。
  74. Scheler, M. (1973). Formalism in Ethics and Non-Formal Ethics of Values: A New Attempt Toward a Foundation of an Ethical Personalism, trans. M.S. Frings and R.L. Funk. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press: 525–529.
  75. 沃尔特， G.（1923）。 Zur Ontologie der sozialen Gemeinschaften。在 E. Husserl（编辑），哲学与现象学研究年鉴，卷。六（第 1-158 页）。哈莉：马克斯·尼迈耶：33。
  76. Walther, G. (1923). Zur Ontologie der sozialen Gemeinschaften. In E. Husserl (ed.), Jahrbuch für Philosophie und Phänomenologische Forschung, Vol. VI (pp. 1–158). Halle: Max Niemeyer: 33.
  77. 沃尔特， G.（1923）。 Zur Ontologie der sozialen Gemeinschaften。在 E. Husserl（编辑），哲学与现象学研究年鉴，卷。六（第 1-158 页）。哈莉：马克斯·尼迈耶：17。
  78. Walther, G. (1923). Zur Ontologie der sozialen Gemeinschaften. In E. Husserl (ed.), Jahrbuch für Philosophie und Phänomenologische Forschung, Vol. VI (pp. 1–158). Halle: Max Niemeyer: 17.
  79. 沃尔特， G.（1923）。 Zur Ontologie der sozialen Gemeinschaften。在 E. Husserl（编辑），哲学与现象学研究年鉴，卷。六（第 1-158 页）。哈雷：马克斯·尼迈耶：85。
  80. Walther, G. (1923). Zur Ontologie der sozialen Gemeinschaften. In E. Husserl (ed.), Jahrbuch für Philosophie und Phänomenologische Forschung, Vol. VI (pp. 1–158). Halle: Max Niemeyer: 85.
  81. 胡塞尔， E.（1959）。第一哲学（1923/24）。茨韦特·泰尔.现象学还原理论，编辑。作者：R.伯姆。胡塞尔 8。海牙：马丁努斯·尼霍夫：136-137。
  82. Husserl, E. (1959). Erste Philosophie (1923/24). Zweiter Teil. Theorie der Phänomenologischen Reduktion, ed. by R. Boehm. Husserliana 8. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 136–137.
  83. 胡塞尔， E.（1989）。《关于纯粹现象学和现象学哲学的理念》。第二卷。《构成现象学研究》，R. Rojcewicz、A. Schuwer译。多德雷赫特：克鲁维尔学术出版社：202–204，254。
  84. Husserl, E. (1989). Ideas Pertaining to a Pure Phenomenology and to a Phenomenological Philosophy. Second Book. Studies in the Phenomenology of Constitution, trans. R. Rojcewicz and A. Schuwer. Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers: 202–204, 254.
  85. 胡塞尔， E.（1973b）。Zur Phänomenologie der Intersubjektivität III。文本 aus dem Nachlass。德瑞特尔·泰尔. 1929–1935，编辑。作者：I.克恩。 Husserliana 15。海牙：Martinus Nijhoff：473。另见 Meindl, P. 和 Zahavi, D. (2023)。从交流到社区化：胡塞尔的叙述。大陆哲学评论56(3): 361–377。
  86. Husserl, E. (1973b). Zur Phänomenologie der Intersubjektivität III. Texte aus dem Nachlass. Dritter Teil. 1929–1935, ed. by I. Kern. Husserliana 15. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 473. See also Meindl, P. and Zahavi, D. (2023). From communication to communalization: A Husserlian account. Continental Philosophy Review 56(3): 361–377.
  87. 海德格尔， M.（2001）。哲学中的Einleitung。 Gesamtausgabe Band 27。法兰克福：Vittorio Klostermann：145–146。
  88. Heidegger, M. (2001). Einleitung in die Philosophie. Gesamtausgabe Band 27. Frankfurt am Main: Vittorio Klostermann: 145–146.
  89. Heidegger, M. (2009). 《逻辑作为语言本质的问题》，WT Gregory 和 Y. Unna 译。纽约州奥尔巴尼：纽约州立大学：55。
  90. Heidegger, M. (2009). Logic as the Question Concerning the Essence of Language, trans. W.T. Gregory and Y. Unna. Albany, NY: SUNY: 55.
  91. Heidegger, M. (2009). 《逻辑作为语言本质的问题》，WT Gregory 和 Y. Unna 译。纽约州奥尔巴尼：纽约州立大学：34。
  92. Heidegger, M. (2009). Logic as the Question Concerning the Essence of Language, trans. W.T. Gregory and Y. Unna. Albany, NY: SUNY: 34.
  93. Heidegger, M. (2009). 《逻辑作为语言本质的问题》，WT Gregory 和 Y. Unna 译。纽约州奥尔巴尼：纽约州立大学：45。
  94. Heidegger, M. (2009). Logic as the Question Concerning the Essence of Language, trans. W.T. Gregory and Y. Unna. Albany, NY: SUNY: 45.
  95. Heidegger, M. (2009). 《逻辑作为关于语言本质的问题》，WT Gregory 和 Y. Unna 译。纽约州奥尔巴尼：纽约州立大学：50，72。
  96. Heidegger, M. (2009). Logic as the Question Concerning the Essence of Language, trans. W.T. Gregory and Y. Unna. Albany, NY: SUNY: 50, 72.
  97. Gurwitsch, A. (1979).社会世界中的人类遭遇. 宾夕法尼亚州匹兹堡：杜肯大学出版社：122–124。
  98. Gurwitsch, A. (1979). Human Encounters in the Social World. Pittsburgh, PA: Duquesne University Press: 122–124.
  99. Gurwitsch, A. (1979).社交世界中的人类遭遇。宾夕法尼亚州匹兹堡：杜肯大学出版社：132。
  100. Gurwitsch, A. (1979). Human Encounters in the Social World. Pittsburgh, PA: Duquesne University Press: 132.
  101. Schmid, HB (2009 )。多元行动。哲学与社会科学论文集。多德雷赫特：Springer；Zahavi, D. (2019)。第二人称介入、自我异化与群体认同。Topoi 38：251–260。
  102. Schmid, H.B. (2009). Plural Action. Essays in Philosophy and Social Science. Dordrecht: Springer; Zahavi, D. (2019). Second-person engagement, selfalienation, and group-identification. Topoi 38: 251–260.

进一步阅读的建议

SUGGESTIONS FOR FURTHER READING

  • Anna Bortolan 和 Elisa Magrì 编，《同理心、主体间性与社会世界》。柏林：De Gruyter，2022 年。
  • Anna Bortolan and Elisa Magrì (eds.), Empathy, Intersubjectivity, and the Social World. Berlin: De Gruyter, 2022.
  • 迈克尔·图尼森，《他者：胡塞尔、海德格尔、萨特和布伯的社会本体论研究》， C. Macann 译。马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社，1986 年。
  • Michael Theunissen, The Other: Studies in the Social Ontology of Husserl, Heidegger, Sartre and Buber, trans. C. Macann. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 1986.
  • 丹·扎哈维，《成为我们：现象学对社会本体论的贡献》。牛津：牛津大学出版社，2025年。
  • Dan Zahavi, Being We: Phenomenological Contributions to Social Ontology. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2025.

9关键和政治现象学

9 CRITICAL AND POLITICAL PHENOMENOLOGY

DOI：10.4324/9781003350682-12

DOI: 10.4324/9781003350682-12

近年来，出现了一种被称为批判现象学。尽管这一发展无疑引发了人们对现象学的新兴趣，但批判现象学究竟是什么以及它与古典现象学有何不同仍然存在争议。

Recent years have seen the emergence of what has become known as critical phenomenology. Although this development has undeniably led to a renewed interest in phenomenology, it continues to remain contentious what precisely critical phenomenology is and how it differs from classical phenomenology.

“批判性转向”的一个决定性动机是对社会和政治变革的渴望。现象学不应仅仅局限于描述，而应致力于构建一个更加公正、包容的社会秩序。现象学可以提供一种独特的哲学方法，社会批判，应该用来阐明、分析并最终反对社会不公、边缘化、种族主义、殖民主义、残疾歧视、恐同等等。批判现象学是一种批判理论试图挑战导致压迫、排斥和统治的条件和心态，但批判现象学是否也批判古典现象学？

One decisive motivation for the “critical turn” has been a desire for social and political transformation. Phenomenology shouldn’t merely be descriptive but rather aim for a more just and inclusive social order. Phenomenology can offer a philosophically distinctive approach to social critique and should be used to illuminate, analyse, and ultimately oppose social injustice, marginalisation, racism, colonialism, ableism, homophobia, etc. Critical phenomenology is a form of critical theory that seeks to challenge conditions and mindsets that result in oppression, exclusion, and domination, but is critical phenomenology also critical of classical phenomenology?

下面，我将概述围绕该术语的一些主要争议，然后举例说明批判性视角如何丰富了对具体化的现象学分析。

Let me in the following outline some of the main controversies surrounding the term and then exemplify how the critical perspective has enriched phenomenological analyses of embodiment.

尽管人们可以找到该术语的早期出现，但最近对批判现象学的引用可以追溯到 2013 年的一篇文章Lisa Guenther 在其著作中指出，批判现象学延续了“现象学传统中以第一人称经验作为哲学反思的起点”，同时抵制古典现象学家“优先考虑先验主观性而非先验主体间性”。1在她自己的作品中，冈瑟明确地借鉴了梅洛-庞蒂和列维纳斯的观点，在后来的文本中，很明显，当她谈论古典现象学时，她首先想到的人物是胡塞尔，她声称胡塞尔所捍卫的观点“对批判现象学的项目毫无帮助”。2她的主要反对意见涉及胡塞尔对个人主体性的偏爱，他对个体行为过程的片面描述，以及他对个体行为的描述。宪法，其中“意识构成了没有互惠性的世界”，3他未能认识到历史和社会结构在多大程度上偶然地塑造了我们经验的意义和方式，并且他不愿参与任何形式的规范性批判。4

Although one can find earlier occurrences of the term, recent references to critical phenomenology can be traced back to a 2013 text by Lisa Guenther, where she argued that critical phenomenology continues “the phenomenological tradition of taking first-person experience as the starting point for philosophical reflection” while at the same time resisting the tendency of classical phenomenologists “to privilege transcendental subjectivity over transcendental intersubjectivity”.1 In her own work, Guenther has drawn explicitly on Merleau-Ponty and Levinas, and in later texts it has become evident that the one figure she primarily has in mind when talking of classical phenomenology is Husserl, who she claims has defended views that are “rather unhelpful [. . .] for the project of critical phe-nomenology”.2 Her main objections concern Husserl’s privileging of individual subjectivity, his one-sided account of the process of constitution, where “consciousness constitutes the world without reciprocity”,3 his failure to recognise how profoundly contingent historical and social structures can shape the meaning and manner of our experience, and his reluctance to engage in any kind of normative critique.4

冈瑟的批判性言论，部分反映了海德格尔学派和梅洛-庞蒂学派过去试图在胡塞尔现象学和后胡塞尔现象学之间寻找明确分野的做法，反过来，也引发了一场关于她批判的价值以及古典现象学和批判现象学之间区别的合理性的激烈争论。让我们先从古典现象学说起。

Guenther’s critical remarks, which partially mirror how Heideggerians and Merleau-Pontians have in the past sought to locate a clear break between Husserlian and post-Husserlian phenomenology, have in turn given rise to a heated debate about the merits of her criticism and about the pertinence of the very distinction between classical phenomenology and critical phenomenology. Let us start with the former.

即使胡塞尔确实赋予了个体主体性一定的独立性——他绝不会声称它完全是由社会建构或决定的——胡塞尔也不是在捍卫“第一人称单数绝对先于主体间性”的观点。5相反，胡塞尔反复强调的一个核心观点是，个体主体性的某些维度只有在社会互动中才会出现，因此它们依赖于主体间性。例如，正如胡塞尔所写，我之所以成为一个“个人主体，是为了获得个人的”自我意识”，存在于“我-你”关系中”。6同时，胡塞尔认为，主体间性对于世俗的建构至关重要，这也是他的先验现象学最显著的特征之一。客观性。7远未提供解释宪法将绝对权力赋予一个独立的主体，胡塞尔也反复强调了事实性和被动性，并将主观性视为必要而非充分的构成原则。8事实上，胡塞尔的发生现象学概念，以及他关于意向性结构具有时间生成性的观点，以及积累和过去经验的沉积塑造并形成了我们意向性生活的结构，这是冈瑟声称其现象学中缺失的互惠反馈的一个例子。胡塞尔后期思想的一个特征是，他开始重视诸如生成性、传统、历史性和文化性常态。举个例子，以书面语言为例。正如胡塞尔在《危机》一书著名的附录中所论证的那样，最高层次的客观性，即科学的客观性，只有在书面意义能够代代相传，并由此融入知识体系，供一代又一代的科学家汲取和补充时，才能得以构成。因此，作为知识的宝库，文字具有重要的构成性影响；如果没有文字在历史上偶然的发明，那些在许多方面影响我们日常生活的复杂科学理论就不可能存在。9至于胡塞尔缺乏规范性批判的最后一个问题，他据称对参与和改变社会规范缺乏兴趣。生活世界，10胡塞尔不仅广泛地论述了社会伦理，但也深切关注文化复兴的可能性，正如詹森所说，“这种复兴将能够‘修复’他所目睹的、正在主宰欧洲社会、特别是德国社会的日益‘ menschenverachtende ’（即非人道的态度）”。 11

Even if Husserl did assign a certain independence to individual subjectivity – he would never claim that it is socially constructed or determined through and through – Husserl was not defending the view that the “first-person singular is absolutely prior to inter-subjectivity”.5 On the contrary, a central and repeated claim of Husserl is that there are dimensions of individual subjectivity that only emerge in and through social interaction and which therefore depend upon intersubjectivity. As Husserl, for instance, writes, I only come to be a “personal subject, come to attain personal ‘self-consciousness’, in the I-you relation”.6 At the same time, and this is one of the most distinct features of his transcendental phenomenology, Husserl considered intersubjectivity crucial for the constitution of worldly objectivity.7 Far from offering an account of constitution that ascribes absolute power to a free-standing subject, Husserl also repeatedly emphasised the role of facticity and passivity and viewed subjectivity as a necessary rather than sufficient constitutive principle.8 Indeed, Husserl’s very conception of genetic phenomenology, his view that intentional structures have a temporal becoming, and that the accumulation and sedimentation of past experiences shape and form the structure of our intentional life, is one exemplification of the reciprocal feedback that Guenther claims is missing in his phenomenology. A characteristic feature of Husserl’s later thinking is that he came to appreciate the constitutive significance of factors such as generativity, tradition, historicity, and cultural normality. For one example among many, consider written language. As Husserl argued in a famous appendix to Crisis, the highest level of objectivity, scientific objectivity, can only be constituted the moment written meaning can be handed down from one generation to the next and thereby become incorporated into the body of knowledge, which generations of scientists draw on and add to. By serving as a reservoir of knowledge, writing consequently has a major constitutive impact, and complex scientific theories that in many ways influence our daily life would never have been possible were it not for the historically contingent invention of writing.9 As for the final issue about Husserl’s lack of normative critique, his alleged lack of interest in engaging with and transforming the norms of the lifeworld,10 Husserl did not only write extensively on social ethics, but was also deeply concerned with the possibility of a cultural renewal that, as Jansen puts it, “would be able to ‘repair’ the increasingly ‘menschenverachtende'”, i.e., inhumane, “attitude that he witnessed coming to dominate European and specifically German society”.11

然而，此时此刻，人们或许会合理地问：“那又怎样？”如果冈瑟对胡塞尔的评价有缺陷，这又有什么关系呢？好吧，如果像胡塞尔这样一位古典现象学家也持有这种观点，那么在古典现象学和批判现象学之间划出一条清晰的界限又有什么意义呢？此外，用“批判现象学”一词作为对比术语，或许会暗示古典现象学在某种程度上缺乏批判性。但胡塞尔、海德格尔和梅洛-庞蒂难道不都持有一个共同的核心思想吗？正是这种观点，即现象学哲学必须包含对不容置疑的思维方式的批判性反思，无论自然主义，客观主义，还是其他传统的形而上学思维模式？梅洛-庞蒂甚至将现象学描述为一种永恒的批判性（自我）反思，它不应该将任何事物视为理所当然，尤其是它本身。对此观点的自然回应是，我们需要区分不同的批评风格，即使古典现象学可能对特定的思维风格有所批判，但它在政治上参与度不够，对特定的社会问题也不够批判。政治实践。这个具体回答的问题在于它误解了历史。正如最近出版的《劳特利奇政治现象学手册》所记载的那样，第一次世界大战及其后果导致了所谓的早期现象学的政治化。我们不仅发现胡塞尔、舍勒和海德格尔等人探讨民族主义、自由主义和资本主义等主题，还发现了大量现象学分析……社区、国家和法律。胡塞尔的助手之一阿诺德·梅茨格（Arnold Metzger）甚至撰写了一篇题为《革命现象学》的论文。

At this point, however, one might reasonably ask “so what?” Why should it matter if Guenther’s assessment of Husserl is flawed? Well, if even as classical a phenomenologist as Husserl held the views in question, what is then the merit of drawing a sharp distinction between classical and critical phenomenology? Moreover, to use the term critical phenomenology as a contrast term might suggest that classical phenomenology was somehow uncritical. But wasn’t a central idea common to Husserl, Heidegger, and Merleau-Ponty precisely the idea that phenomenological philosophising must involve a critical reflection on unquestioned styles of thought, be it naturalism, objectivism, or other traditional metaphysical mindsets? Merleau-Ponty even characterised phenomenology as a perpetual critical (self-)reflection, that shouldn’t take anything for granted, least of all itself. A natural reply to this point would then be to say that we need to distinguish different styles of criticism, and that even if classical phenomenology might have been critical towards specific styles of thinking, it wasn’t sufficiently politically engaged, it wasn’t sufficiently critical of specific socio-political practices. The problem with this specific reply is that it gets history wrong. As the recent Routledge Handbook of Political Phenomenology documents, the events of the First World War and its aftermaths led to what has been described as a politicisation of early phenomenology. Not only do we find figures like Husserl, Scheler, and Heidegger engaging with topics such as nationalism, liberalism, and capitalism, we also find extensive phenomenological analyses of community, state, and law. One of Husserl’s assistants, Arnold Metzger, even wrote a treatise entitled Phenomenology of Revolution.

诚然，我们能够找到各种各样的立场。许多早期现象学家批判资本主义-消费主义的现代性，并渴望社会重生和转型，但胡塞尔在一种解读中倾向于某种乌托邦式的无政府主义，而其他12位则选择了社会主义、天主教保守主义，甚至国家社会主义，正如海德格尔、奥斯卡·贝克尔和埃尔斯·福伦德臭名昭著的案例一样。但事实上，早期德国现象学家的哲学著作确实涉及社会和政治主题。13

Admittedly, it is possible to find a diversity of positions represented. Many of the early phenomenologists were critical of capitalist-consumerist modernity and longed for a social rebirth and transformation, but whereas Husserl in one interpretation was drawn to a form of utopian anarchism,12 others opted for socialism, Catholic conservatism, or even National Socialism, as was infamously the case for Heidegger, Oskar Becker, and Else Voigtländer. But the fact remains that the philosophical work of the early German phenomenologists does contain an engagement with social and political topics.13

如果说有什么不同的话，这种倾向在战后的法国现象学中变得更加明显，但它也以一种明确的社会批判。第二次世界大战、德国占领以及随之而来的冷战加剧了萨特、梅洛-庞蒂和波伏娃的政治承诺。1946年，萨特发表了一篇题为《反犹主义与犹太人》的文章。14这篇文章探讨了反犹太主义，也是最早探讨大屠杀的哲学著作之一。1949年，西蒙娜·德·波伏娃出版了她的主要作品《第二性》，15其中包含了对性别身体的现象学描述，而 1952 年精神病学家弗朗茨·法农出版了他著名的《黑皮肤，白面具》，批评了法国殖民主义和种族主义，并对种族化的身体进行了现象学分析。16

If anything, this orientation only became even more pronounced in post-war French phenomenology, but there it also takes the form of an explicit social critique. The Second World War, the German occupation, and the ensuing emergence of the Cold War, intensified the political commitments of Sartre, Merleau-Ponty, and Beauvoir. In 1946 Sartre published an essay entitled Anti-Semite and Jew.14 The text was a discussion of anti-Semitism and one of the first philosophical treatments of the Holocaust. In 1949, Simone de Beauvoir published her major work The Second Sex,15 which contained a phenomenological account of the gendered body, and in 1952 the psychiatrist Frantz Fanon published his renowned Black Skin, White Masks which criticised French colonialism and racism and offered a phenomenological analysis of the racialised body.16

胡塞尔的现象学分析最初非常笼统。对胡塞尔而言，问题在于探究意识本身的特征。在胡塞尔思想的后期，他越来越关注文化、历史和发展条件如何影响我们的意向性生活。这种从非历史到历史情境的转变，在萨特和梅洛-庞蒂的思想中得到了延续，并随后被波伏娃和法农等思想家进一步激进化。

Husserl’s phenomenological analyses were initially very generic. For Husserl, it was a matter of investigating what characterises consciousness as such. In later phases of his thinking, Husserl became increasingly interested in the question of how cultural, historical, and developmental conditions affect our intentional life. It is this movement from the ahistorical to the historically situated that is continued in both Sartre and Merleau-Ponty and subsequently radicalised by thinkers such as Beauvoir and Fanon.

考虑到这些因素，人们不禁要问，在古典和现代之间做出严格区分是否值得。批判现象学。萨拉蒙曾写道：“批判现象学的批判性其实一直都存在。”或许她的观点完全正确。17与其区分两种现象学，不如说现象学在不断发展，古典现象学家和近代现象学作家的著作可以用于不同的目的，包括社会批判。这种观点似乎也越来越受到关注。在最近的出版物中，拉内·罗德迈耶和约翰娜·奥克萨拉都认为，胡塞尔应该与波伏娃和法农一起被视为批判现象学的核心思想家。18而在最近一篇关于批判现象学的优秀导论中，埃莉萨·马格里和帕迪·麦昆非常明确地指出，批判方法论在古典现象学中已经存在到何种程度。19

Given considerations like these, one must wonder about the merits of a sharp distinction between classical and critical phenomenology. Perhaps Salamon was precisely right when she at one point wrote that “what is critical about critical phenomenology turns out to have been there all along”.17 Rather than distinguishing two types of phenomenology, it probably makes more sense to say that phenomenology is constantly evolving and that the work of both classical phenomenologists as well as more recent phenomenological authors can be used for different purposes including the purpose of social critique. This also seems to be the view that is gaining traction. In recent publications, Lanei Rodemeyer and Johanna Oksala both argue that Husserl along with Beauvoir and Fanon should be considered central thinkers for critical phenomenology.18 And in a recent excellent introduction to critical phenomenology, Elisa Magrí and Paddy McQueen are very explicit about the extent to which critical methodological approaches can already be found in classical phenomenology.19

边缘化的经历

MARGINALISED EXPERIENCES

在《批判现象学的 50 个概念》的导言中，Weiss、Murphy 和 Salamon 写道，批判现象学是一种寻求“鼓励对我们生活经历的多样性抱有慷慨、尊重和同情”的现象学。20这种关注点在于需要对多元化的现象提供更全面的描述。生活经历确实是批判现象学近期研究的标志之一。

In their introduction to 50 Concepts for a Critical Phenomenology, Weiss, Murphy, and Salamon write that a critical phenomenology is a phenomenology that seeks to “encourage generosity, respect, and compassion for the diversity of our lived experiences”.20 This focus on the need for offering a more comprehensive account of diverse life experiences has indeed been one of the hallmarks of recent work in critical phenomenology.

当我们审视一些关于“我们具身存在于世”的经典讨论时，它们往往处于相当高的抽象层次，不涉及主体的年龄、性别、社会地位。但这不仅忽略了生活经验的关键方面，也忽略了那些被呈现为对……的一般性描述。事实证明，体现只不过是一种非常特殊的观点的普遍化，即男性、白人和健全主体的观点。

When looking at some of the classical discussions of, say, our embodied being-in-the-world, they often occurred at a fairly high level of abstraction, with no reference to the age, sex, gender, or social position of the subject. But not only does this miss out on crucial aspects of lived experience, what was presented as a general account of embodiment often turned out to be nothing but, or so the argument goes, a universalisation of a very particular perspective, namely that of a male, white, and able-bodied subject.

对具身化的全面现象学解释应该认识到身体的意向性受性别、种族、性取向和阶级的影响，并探讨各种社会和文化实践如何影响一个人的身体立场。当胡塞尔、梅洛-庞蒂和萨特讨论身体作为主体和身体作为客体之间的差异时，当他们强调身体“我能”的重要性时，当他们论证身体作为一种体验而存在时第一人称视角通常保持在背景中，作为非客观化的，这种分析可能确实捕捉到一些重要的东西，但它也可能无法解释一些非常突出的身体体验。

A comprehensive phenomenological account of embodiment should recognise the extent to which bodily intentionality is influenced by gender, race, sexuality, and class and thematise how various societal and cultural practices influence one’s bodily stance. When Husserl, Merleau-Ponty, and Sartre discussed the difference between the body as subject and the body as object, when they highlighted the importance of the bodily “I can”, and when they argued that the body as lived through from a first-person perspective normally remains in the background, as non-objectified, this analysis might indeed capture something important, but it arguably also fails to account for some very salient bodily experiences.

伊丽莎白·安德森在她的著作《融合的必要性》中讲述了她亲身经历的一件事。深夜时分，她在底特律开车，突然油灯亮了。她把车开到最近的加油站想进一步查看，这时一位年轻的黑人男子走上前来，想帮她修车。但他并没有直接说“别担心，我不是来抢劫你的”，而是举起双手，掌心平放在脸部。21 正如安德森所解释的那样，这次互动显然受到了种族刻板印象的影响，污名化，但正如人们所说，这位年轻人的身体意向性也同样如此。他不能随意自发地提供帮助，而是必须注意自己在别人眼中的形象，尤其要评估白人女性会如何解读他的举动。

In her book The Imperative of Integration, Elizabeth Anderson recounts a personal episode of hers. She was driving late at night in Detroit, when her oil light came on. She pulled into the nearest gas station to investigate further, and was then approached by a young black man, who wanted to offer to help her with her car. But rather than simply saying so, he said “Don’t worry, I’m not here to rob you”, while holding up his hands, palms flat at face level.21 As Anderson explains, this interaction was clearly framed and influenced by racial stereotypes and stigmatisation, but as one might add, so was the bodily intentionality of the young man. Rather than being able to offer his help carefree and spontaneously, he had to be aware of how he appeared to others and in particular had to appraise how his movements might be interpreted by a white woman.

种族压迫的经典现象学分析，关于白人凝视和白人规范的内化如何改变一个人在世的存在，并限制、抑制和客观化人的身体存在，正如前文所述，可以在法农的《黑皮肤，白面具》中找到。正如萨拉·艾哈迈德后来简洁地总结的那样：

The classical phenomenological analysis of racial oppression, of how the internalisation of a white gaze and white norms transforms one’s being-in-the-world and restricts, inhibits, and objectifies one’s bodily existence, can, as already mentioned, be found in Fanon’s Black Skin, White Masks. As Sara Ahmed was later to summarise succinctly:

如果古典现象学探讨的是“运动性”，并通过“我能”这句话的希望来表达，那么法农的黑体现象学则更适合用限制、不确定性和阻塞的身体和社会体验来描述，甚至可能用“我不能”这句话的绝望来描述。[...]在“白色世界”中成为黑色意味着回归自身，成为一个客体，这不仅意味着不被世界的轮廓所延伸，而且由于他人身体延伸的影响而缩小。22

If classical phenomenology is about “motility”, expressed in the hopefulness of the utterance “I can”, Fanon’s phenomenology of the black body would be better described in terms of the bodily and social experience of restriction, uncertainty and blockage, or perhaps even in terms of the despair of the utterance “I cannot”. [ . . . ] to be black in “the white world” is to turn back towards itself, to become an object, which means not only not being extended by the contours of the world, but being diminished as an effect of the bodily extensions of others.22

但种族主义并非对我们身体存在进行全面现象学分析时应该考虑历史、文化和社会背景的唯一原因。艾丽丝·玛丽安·杨在1980年的经典论文《像女孩一样投掷》中，与埃尔温·施特劳斯、梅洛-庞蒂和波伏娃的早期文本相呼应，指出父权社会中的女性通常被定义和视为仅仅是身体，是其他主体意图和操纵的潜在对象。这种普遍态度的内化会影响女性自身的身体存在，而女性的身体存在将越来越多地包含自我客体化的成分。23此外，尽管（一些）男性可能行动自如，但历史上的社会化和文化适应形式也为女性应该如何行动和投掷设定了特定的规范和实践，这削弱了她们的自主权，并破坏了她们对自身能力的信任。结果，女性在很多情况下都变得胆怯犹豫，这就是为什么她们在这种情境下的身体意向性更多地以“我不能”或“我不应该”而不是“我能”为特征。24正如杨不遗余力地指出的那样，她所描述的女性身体行为的独特模式并非源于女性解剖学或生理学的特殊性，更不是源于某种神秘的女性本质，而是受文化影响的行为方式。25

But racism is not the only reason why a comprehensive phenomenological analysis of our bodily existence should also consider the historical, cultural, and social context. In a classical essay from 1980 “Throwing like a girl”, which in turn engages with earlier texts by Erwin Straus, Merleau-Ponty, and Beauvoir, Iris Marion Young argued that women in patriarchal societies are often defined and regarded as mere bodies, as potential objects for other subjects’ intentions and manipulations. The internalisation of this generalised attitude can come to affect women’s own bodily existence, which will increasingly come to include components of self-objectification.23 In addition, whereas (some) men might move and act with ease, historical forms of socialisation and enculturation have also installed specific norms and practices for how women are supposed to move and act that have diminished their agency and undermined their trust in their own capacities. As a result, women have come to approach many situations with timidity and hesitancy which is why their bodily intentionality in such contexts is more characterised by an “I cannot” or “I shouldn’t” than by an “I can”.24 As Young is at pains to point out, the distinct modalities of feminine bodily comportment that she describes are not due to particularities of female anatomy or physiology, let alone rooted in some mysterious feminine essence, but are culturally informed styles of behaviour.25

批判现象学家最近的研究扩大了范围，并分析了许多其他形式的被压迫和边缘化存在模式。但值得强调的是，这部值得称赞的作品，其影响了批判性残疾研究、跨性别和酷儿研究以及后殖民研究等领域的讨论，与其说是对古典现象学的明显背离，不如说是对 20 世纪 40 年代末和 50 年代初已开始的研究的延续和扩展。

Recent work by critical phenomenologists has extended the scope and analysed many other forms of oppressed and marginalised modes of existence. But it is worth emphasising that this laudable work, which has gone on to influence discussions in, for instance, critical disability studies, trans and queer studies, and postcolonial studies, is better seen as a continuation and expansion of work already starting in the late forties and early fifties rather than as constituting a marked departure from classical phenomenology.

方法问题

THE PROBLEM OF METHOD

目前正在讨论的问题之一是，对现象学的批判性运用在多大程度上需要对其基本工具、概念和方法进行根本性的反思。冈瑟就坚持认为批判现象学必须重新思考本质论和先验论方法的目的和实践，并最终超越古典现象学所提供的内容，如果它想批判地参与历史与权力。26

One of the questions currently being discussed is the extent to which a critical use of phenomenology necessitates a fundamental rethinking of its basic tools, concepts, and methods. Guenther, for one, has insisted that critical phenomenology must rethink the purpose and practice of the eidetic and transcendental methods and in the end go beyond what classical phenomenology has to offer if it wants to engage critically with history and power.26

例如，坚持将社会文化背景的特殊性纳入考量，引发了各种方法论问题。例如，对种族化或性别化身体的分析，与更笼统的关于……的讨论如何相符？我们在胡塞尔、萨特和梅洛-庞蒂的著作中发现了什么具身性？前者的分析是取代了后者，还是补充了后者？是否有可能对具身性进行某种本质分析，任何分析都能捕捉到普遍适用于具身存在的东西？或者，归根结底，身体只是特定的，以至于现象学分析最多只能希望完成对“女人的身体、拉丁裔女性的身体、母亲的身体、女儿的身体、朋友的身体、迷人的身体、年迈的身体、犹太人的身体”的解释？27最终，如果任何对普遍和不变结构的引用都被禁止，我们很难理解具身性如何还能接受哲学分析。同样难以理解的是，为什么像活体与客体化身体之间，或反思性与前反思性身体意识之间的区别，不再能够针对人类身体的基本结构，即使这些区别可以通过更面向情境的研究得到进一步说明，或者为什么对感知、运动和行动之间关系或身体角色的一般性思考，表达力对于人际理解来说，不应该继续具有价值。毕竟，认为不考虑年龄、性别、种族等因素的具身分析是不完整的，是一回事；而认为这种分析充其量毫无价值，甚至可能具有危险的误导性，则完全是另一回事。杨显然希望自己的分析能够具体化和补充梅洛-庞蒂的理论，而非取代它：

The insistence on factoring in the specificities of the sociocultural context, for instance, raises various methodological questions. How do the analyses of, say, the racialised or gendered body stand to the more generic discussions of embodiment that we find in Husserl, Sartre, and Merleau-Ponty? Do the former analyses replace or rather supplement the latter? Is it at all possible to offer any kind of eidetic analysis of embodiment, any analysis that captures something that holds true for embodied existence in general or are there in the end only particular bodies such that what a phenomenological analysis can at most hope to accomplish is to offer an account of “a woman’s body, a Latina’s body, a mother’s body, a daughter’s body, a friend’s body, an attractive body, an aging body, a Jewish body”?27 Ultimately, it is hard to see how embodiment could still be susceptible to philosophical analysis if any reference to universal and invariant structures was prohibited. It is also hard to see why formal distinctions like the ones between the lived body and the objectified body or between reflective and pre-reflective body-awareness should no longer be able to target basic structures of human embodiment even if they might be further specified by more context-oriented investigations, or why general reflections on, say, the relation between perception, movement, and action or the role of bodily expressivity for interpersonal understanding, shouldn’t continue to be of value. It is after all one thing to argue that an analysis of embodiment that doesn’t factor in the role of age, gender, race, etc. is incomplete, and something completely different to argue that such an analysis is at best worthless and at worst dangerously misleading. Young clearly took her own analysis to concretise and supplement, rather than replace, what could be found in Merleau-Ponty:

我认为，在最基本的描述层面上，梅洛-庞蒂在《知觉现象学》中对生命体与其世界关系的论述，普遍适用于任何人类存在。然而，在更具体的层面上，存在着一种典型的女性存在的身体举止风格，这种风格由身体在世界上存在的结构和条件的特定模式组成。28

I assume that at the most basic descriptive level, merleau-ponty’s account of the relation of the lived body to its world, as developed in the Phenomenology of Perception, applies to any human existence in a general way. at a more specific level, however, there is a particular style of bodily comportment which is typical of feminine existence, and this style consists of particular modalities of the structures and conditions of the body’s existence in the world.28

对偶然的历史和社会结构的关注和兴趣也引发了人们对现象学的先验地位的质疑，并导致一些人质疑现象学还原。相反，约翰娜·奥克萨拉则坚持认为，现象学如果想要提供一种基本形式的社会批判必须运用现象学还原，揭示我们生活的世界并非自然而然的既定事实，而是一个过程的结果。宪法。毕竟，哲学批判的目标之一，就是质疑那些根深蒂固的社会实践和信仰，它们常常被当作不容置疑的真理、当作本体论事实来接受，而不是被承认其本质，即根深蒂固的偏见。29

The focus on and interest in contingent historical and social structures has also raised questions about the transcendental status of phenomenology and led some to question the relevance of the phenomenological reduction. Johanna Oksala, by contrast, has been adamant that a phenomenology that wants to offer a fundamental form of social critique must employ the phenomenological reduction and lay bare how the world we live in rather than simply being a natural given is in fact the outcome of a process of constitution. After all, one of the aims of philosophical critique is to question social practices and beliefs that have become so sedimented that they are often accepted as unquestioned truths, as ontological facts, rather than being recognised for what they are, namely deeply rooted prejudices.29

对于冈瑟来说，批判现象学不是一门科学，而是一种开放式的实践，一种接近政治行动主义，30并且考虑到这一愿望，它还必须借鉴“后殖民理论、女权主义、批判种族理论、马克思主义、法兰克福学派、精神分析、酷儿理论、福柯谱系学、解构主义、批判性残疾研究或其他批判性话语”。31支持方法论和理论多元化可能有充分的理由，但如果批判现象学家最终远离先验还原和本质还原，如果他们转而寻求灵感从其他各种学科的视角来看，到某个时候，明确批判现象学究竟应该如何成为现象学的，将变得刻不容缓。仅仅诉诸生活经验并对其感兴趣就足够了吗？正如我们将在下一章中看到的，应用现象学领域也正在进行相关的讨论。

For Guenther, critical phenomenology is not a science, but an open-ended practice, a way of approaching political activism,30 and given this aspiration, it must also draw on methods coming from “postcolonial theory, feminism, critical race theory, Marxism, the Frankfurt school, psychoanalysis, queer theory, Foucaultian genealogy, deconstruction, critical disability studies, or some other critical discourse”.31 There might be good reasons for favouring methodological and theoretical pluralism, but if critical phenomenologists end up distancing themselves from both the transcendental reduction and the eidetic reduction, and if they instead seek inspiration from a variety of other disciplinary perspectives, it will at some point become urgent to specify exactly what it is that is supposed to make critical phenomenology phenomenological. Is a simple appeal to and interest in lived experience supposed to be sufficient? As we shall see in the next chapters, related discussions have also been taking place within the field of applied phenomenology.

笔记
