The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 224; Husserl, E. (1970). The Crisis of European Sciences and Transcendental Phenomenology: An Introduction to Phenomenological Philosophy, trans. D. Carr. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press: 358–362.
  19. Guenther, L. (2021). 批判现象学的六种批判意义。Puncta : 《批判现象学杂志》 4(2): 7。
  20. Guenther, L. (2021). Six senses of critique for critical phenomenology. Puncta: Journal of Critical Phenomenology 4(2): 7.
  21. Jansen, J. (2022). 现象学与批判：论“单纯”描述及其规范维度。载于 AS Aldea、D. Carr 和 S. Heinämaa 编，《现象学作为批判：方法为何重要》（第 44-55 页）。伦敦：劳特利奇：51。
  22. Jansen, J. (2022). Phenomenology and critique: On “mere” description and its normative dimensions. In A.S. Aldea, D. Carr, and S. Heinämaa (eds.), Phenomenology as Critique: Why Method Matters (pp. 44–55). London: Routledge: 51.
  23. Hart, J. (1992).人与共同生活：胡塞尔社会伦理学研究。多德雷赫特：克鲁维尔学术出版社。
  24. Hart, J. (1992). The Person and the Common Life: Studies in a Husserlian Social Ethics. Dordrecht: Kluwer Academic Publishers.
  25. Loidolt, S. (2024). 多元的开端，矛盾的传承。载于S. Herrmann、G. Thonhauser、S. Loidolt、T. Matzner和N. Baratella编，《劳特利奇政治现象学手册》（第11-17页），伦敦：劳特利奇出版社。
  26. Loidolt, S. (2024). Plural beginnings, ambivalent heritage. In S. Herrmann, G. Thonhauser, S. Loidolt, T. Matzner, and N. Baratella (eds.), The Routledge Handbook of Political Phenomenology (pp. 11–17), London: Routledge.
  27. 萨特， J.-P. (1995)。《反犹主义者与犹太人》，GJ Becker 译。纽约，纽约州：Shocken Books。
  28. Sartre, J.-P. (1995). Anti-Semite and Jew, trans. G.J. Becker. New York, NY: Shocken Books.
  29. Beauvoir, S. de (1953). 《第二性》，HM Parshley 译。伦敦：Jonathan Cape。
  30. Beauvoir, S. de (1953). The Second Sex, trans. H.M. Parshley. London: Jonathan Cape.
  31. Fanon, F. (2008). 《黑皮肤，白面具》，CL Markmann 译。伦敦：冥王星出版社。
  32. Fanon, F. (2008). Black Skin, White Masks, trans. C.L. Markmann. London: Pluto Press.
  33. Salamon, G. (2018). 批判现象学的批判性是什么？Puncta: 《批判现象学杂志》 1: 13。
  34. Salamon, G. (2018). What is critical about critical phenomenology? Puncta: Journal of Critical Phenomenology 1: 13.
  35. Rodemeyer, LM (2022)。对批判现象学的现象学批判。载 AS Aldea、D. Carr 和 S. Heinämaa 编，《作为批判的现象学：方法为何重要》（第 95-112 页）。伦敦：劳特利奇：110 页；Oksala, J. (2023)。批判现象学的方法：作为现象学家的西蒙娜·德·波伏娃。《欧洲哲学杂志》 31(1): 146。
  36. Rodemeyer, L.M. (2022). A phenomenological critique of critical phenomenology. In A.S. Aldea, D. Carr, and S. Heinämaa (eds.), Phenomenology as Critique: Why Method Matters (pp. 95–112). London: Routledge: 110; Oksala, J. (2023). The method of critical phenomenology: Simone de Beau-voir as a phenomenologist. European Journal of Philosophy 31(1): 146.
  37. Magrì, E. 和 McQueen, P. (2023)。《批判现象学：导论》。剑桥： Polity Press。
  38. Magrì, E. and McQueen, P. (2023). Critical Phenomenology: An Introduction. Cambridge: Polity Press.
  39. Weiss, G.、Murphy AV 和 Salamon, G. (2020)。批判现象学的 50 个概念。伊利诺伊州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社：xiv。
  40. Weiss, G., Murphy A. V., and Salamon, G. (2020). 50 Concepts for a Critical Phenomenology. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press: xiv.
  41. Anderson, E. (2010).整合的必要性。新泽西州普林斯顿：普林斯顿大学出版社：53。
  42. Anderson, E. (2010). The Imperative of Integration. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press: 53.
  43. Ahmed, S. (2007). 白人现象学。《女性主义理论》 8(2): 161。
  44. Ahmed, S. (2007). A phenomenology of whiteness. Feminist Theory 8(2): 161.
  45. Young, IM (1980)。像女孩一样投掷：女性身体行为、运动和空间性的现象学。《人类研究》 3: 154。
  46. Young, I.M. (1980). Throwing like a girl: A phenomenology of feminine body comportment, motility and spatiality. Human Studies 3: 154.
  47. Young, IM (1980). 像女孩一样投掷：女性身体姿态、运动与空间的现象学。《人类研究》 3: 146。
  48. Young, I.M. (1980). Throwing like a girl: A phenomenology of feminine body comportment, motility and spatiality. Human Studies 3: 146.
  49. Young, IM (1980). 像女孩一样投掷：女性身体姿态、运动与空间的现象学。《人类研究》 3: 152。
  50. Young, I.M. (1980). Throwing like a girl: A phenomenology of feminine body comportment, motility and spatiality. Human Studies 3: 152.
  51. Guenther, L. (2021). 批判现象学的六种批判意义。Puncta: 《批判现象学杂志》 4(2): 8。
  52. Guenther, L. (2021). Six senses of critique for critical phenomenology. Puncta: Journal of Critical Phenomenology 4(2): 8.
  53. Weiss, G. (1999 ) 身体意象：作为跨肉体性的具身化。伦敦和纽约：劳特利奇出版社：1。
  54. Weiss, G. (1999) Body Images: Embodiment as Intercorporeality. London and New York, NY: Routledge: 1.
  55. Young, IM (1980). 像女孩一样投掷：女性身体姿态、运动与空间的现象学。《人类研究》 3: 141。
  56. Young, I.M. (1980). Throwing like a girl: A phenomenology of feminine body comportment, motility and spatiality. Human Studies 3: 141.

进一步阅读的建议

SUGGESTION FOR FURTHER READING

  • Steffen Herrmann、Gerhard Thonhauser、Sophie Loidolt、Tobias Matzner、Nils Baratella编，《劳特利奇政治现象学手册》 。伦敦：劳特利奇，2024年。
  • Steffen Herrmann, Gerhard Thonhauser, Sophie Loidolt, Tobias Matzner, and Nils Baratella (eds.), The Routledge Handbook of Political Phenomenology. London: Routledge, 2024.
  • Elisa Magrì 和 Paddy McQueen，《批判现象学：导论》。剑桥：Polity Press，2023 年。
  • Elisa Magrì and Paddy McQueen, Critical Phenomenology: An Introduction. Cambridge: Polity Press, 2023.
  • 约翰娜·奥萨拉，“批判现象学的方法：作为现象学家的西蒙娜·德·波伏娃”。《欧洲哲学杂志》 31(1)，2023，137–150。
  • Johanna Oksala, “The method of critical phenomenology: Simone de Beauvoir as a phenomenologist.” European Journal of Philosophy 31(1), 2023, 137–150.
  • 盖尔·韦斯、安·V·墨菲、盖尔·萨拉蒙编，《批判现象学的50个概念》 。伊利诺伊州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社，2020年。
  • Gail Weiss, Ann V. Murphy, and Gayle Salamon (eds.), 50 Concepts for a Critical Phenomenology. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press, 2020.

第三部分 应用现象学

PART III APPLIED PHENOMENOLOGY

DOI：10.4324/9781003350682-13

DOI: 10.4324/9781003350682-13

现象学的核心在于其哲学探索。它的任务并非拓展我们经验知识的范围，而是退一步探究任何此类经验探究所预设的基本结构、关系和能力。正如海德格尔所言：“进行哲学思考意味着全然地、持续地被常识所认为不言而喻、不容置疑的事物的神秘性所困扰，并对其保持敏锐的洞察力。” 1事实上，一种解读认为，现象学所探究的正是这种被忽视的显而易见性的领域，而它之所以能够探究这些领域，其前提是它采取了一种特定的哲学态度。

At its core, phenomenology is a philosophical endeavour. Its task is not to expand the scope of our empirical knowledge, but rather to step back and investigate the fundamental structures, relations and capacities that are presupposed by any such empirical investigation. As Heidegger once remarked, “to philosophize means to be entirely and constantly troubled by and immediately sensitive to the complete enigma of things that common sense considers self-evident and unquestionable”.1 Indeed, according to one reading it is precisely this domain of ignored obviousness that phenomenology seeks to investigate, and its ability to do so is premised on its adoption of a specific philosophical attitude.

鉴于这一探索本身就带有明显的哲学性质，人们或许会质疑现象学能否为经验科学提供任何有价值的东西。它究竟能为经验研究提供信息吗？正如我将在接下来的章节中阐述的那样，这些问题的答案是肯定的。

Given the distinctly philosophical nature of this venture, one might wonder whether phenomenology can offer anything of value to empirical science. Can it at all inform empirical work? As I will show in the following chapters, the answer to these questions is very much in the affirmative.

笔记

NOTE

  1. 海德格尔，M.（2010）。《逻辑：真理问题》，T. Sheehan译。印第安纳州布卢明顿：印第安纳大学出版社：18。
  2. Heidegger, M. (2010). Logic: The Question of Truth, trans. T. Sheehan. Bloomington, IN: Indiana University Press: 18.

10经典应用

10 CLASSICAL APPLICATIONS

心理学、精神病学、社会学

Psychology, psychiatry, sociology

DOI：10.4324/9781003350682-14

DOI: 10.4324/9781003350682-14

现象学从一开始就是经验科学以及学院哲学之外世界的灵感源泉。通过对人类存在的阐释，将主体理解为一种具身的、社会和文化根植于世的存在，现象学不仅能够分析和阐释一个在科学实践中运作的框架，还能为众多学科提供重要的参考。心理学和精神病学是最早从胡塞尔关注现象的号召中汲取灵感的学科之一，1但此后，包括社会学在内的许多其他学科和实践，人类学、比较文学、建筑学、护理，甚至量子力学，与现象学的思想相联系并借鉴了现象学的思想。最近，现象学也被证明是理论辩论的重要灵感来源。定性研究、具身认知科学以及残疾研究和批判性种族理论。

Phenomenology has been a source of inspiration for the empirical sciences and the world beyond academic philosophy from the very start. By offering an account of human existence, where the subject is understood as an embodied and socially and culturally embedded being-in-the-world, phenomenology has not only been able to analyse and illuminate a framework that is operative in scientific practice, it has also been able to offer crucial inputs to a variety of disciplines. Psychology and psychiatry were among the first to take inspiration from Husserl’s call to attend to the phenomena,1 but since then, many other disciplines and practices, including sociology, anthropology, comparative literature, architecture, nursing, and even quantum mechanics, have engaged with and drawn on ideas from phenomenology. More recently, phenomenology has also proven an important source of inspiration for theoretical debates in qualitative research, for embodied cognitive sciences, and for disciplines such as disability studies and critical race theory.

现象学的适用性一直是其持久吸引力的一部分，但如何应用现象学与非应用现象学或纯现象学有何不同？在非哲学语境中，如何才能最好地实践和运用现象学？应用现象学的概念本身确实有些模糊。并且可以理解为不同的含义。下文中，我将应用现象学的概念理解为指非哲学学科或实践采用或融入哲学现象学思想的案例。在某些情况下，这种影响如此广泛而持久，以至于该学科被冠以“现象学”的称号。如此理解，应用现象学的典型案例包括：现象学心理学，现象学精神病学和现象学社会学。

The applicability of phenomenology has been part of its enduring appeal, but how does applied phenomenology differ from non-applied or pure phenomenology, and what is the best way to practice and use phenomenology in a non-philosophical context? The very notion of applied phenomenology is admittedly somewhat ambiguous and can be understood to mean different things. In the following, I will understand the notion of applied phenomenology to refer to cases where a non-philosophical discipline or practice adopts or incorporates ideas from philosophical phenomenology. In some cases, this impact has been so extensive and enduring that the discipline in question has received the designation “phenomenological”. On this reading, exemplary cases of applied phenomenology would include, for instance, phenomenological psychology, phenomenological psychiatry, and phenomenological sociology.

然而，一个反复出现的挑战是，确定一门学科或实践应该在多大程度上根植于现象学哲学，才能被认定为现象学。它必须接受现象学的多少核心主张？这种影响主要体现在方法论层面，还是更确切地说，体现在所使用的理论框架中？回顾过去一百年的讨论，我们很难找到明确的共识。

However, one of the recurrent challenges has been to determine how deeply rooted in phenomenological philosophy a discipline or practice should be in order to qualify as phenomenological. How many of the core commitments of phenomenology would it have to accept? And is the influence primarily of a methodological nature, or rather to be found in the theoretical framework being employed? When looking back at discussions from the last 100 years, one will look in vain for a clear consensus.

在本章中，我将提供一些颇为不同的现象学经典应用的例子。在接下来的章节中，我将探讨应用现象学概念所引发的一些更为原则性的问题，并简要讨论一些当前的争议。

In this chapter, I will provide a few examples of rather different classical applications of phenomenology. In the next chapters, I will then touch upon some of the more principled questions that the notion of applied phenomenology has given rise to, and briefly discuss some current controversies.

现象学心理学

PHENOMENOLOGICAL PSYCHOLOGY

现象学与心理学有着密切的联系，这并不令人意外。它们的历史渊源是什么？一个明显的起点是 19 世纪 80 年代的维也纳。毕竟，胡塞尔正是在那里听取了著名心理学家和哲学家弗朗茨·布伦塔诺 (1838-1917) 的讲座。布伦塔诺曾撰写过关于意向性的著作，并坚持认为科学心理学必须包含对意识的细致描述。在胡塞尔的一些早期著作中，我们甚至发现胡塞尔将自己的作品描述为一种描述性心理学——然而，他很快就后悔了这种描述，因为它没有认识到他自己研究的独特哲学特征。2后来，胡塞尔进一步区分了两种不同的现象学意识研究方法。一方面，我们有先验现象学；另一方面，我们有有他所谓的现象学心理学。3后者与前者有何不同？两者都与意识有关，但它们的议程却截然不同。对胡塞尔来说，现象学心理学的任务是以非还原的方式研究意向意识，即以尊重其独特性和独特特征的方式。现象学心理学是一种将第一人称视角，但与先验现象学相反，它仍然在自然态度。对于胡塞尔来说，现象学心理学家不是哲学家，而是没有提出某些基本问题的科学家。

That phenomenology has close links to psychology should not come as a surprise. What are the historical origins? One obvious starting point would be Vienna in the 1880s. After all, that is where Husserl attended lectures by Franz Brentano (1838–1917), the prominent psychologist and philosopher, who had written on intentionality and insisted that a scientific psychology had to include careful descriptions of consciousness. In some of Husserl’s earliest works, we even find Husserl characterising his own work as a form of descriptive psychology – a characterisation he was soon to regret, however, since it failed to recognise the distinct philosophical character of his own endeavour.2 Later on, Husserl went on to distinguish two different phenomenological approaches to consciousness. On the one hand, we have transcendental phenomenology, and on the other, we have what he calls phenomenological psychology.3 How does the latter differ from the former? Both deal with consciousness, but they do so with rather different agendas in mind. For Husserl, the task of phenomenological psychology is to investigate intentional consciousness in a non-reductive manner, i.e., in a manner that respects its peculiarity and distinctive features. Phenomenological psychology is a psychology that takes the first-person perspective seriously, but which – in contrast to transcendental phenomenology – remains within the natural attitude. The phenomenological psychologist is, for Husserl, not a philosopher, but a scientist that leaves certain fundamental questions unasked.

这种区分的意义何在？尽管胡塞尔主要关注的是哲学现象学的发展，但他并非无视他的分析可能对心理学的意识研究产生影响并具有相关性。事实上，正如他在1928年的阿姆斯特丹讲座中指出的那样，如果心理学要以科学严谨的方式发展，就需要对体验生活有正确的理解和概念，而这正是现象学所能提供的。现象学让我们回归体验现象本身，而不是仅仅停留在对其本质的推测和理论层面。此外，现象学可以为心理学提供对其基本概念（注意力、意图、知觉、内容等）的根本性阐释。正如胡塞尔所言，现象学心理学家应该抛开源自其他科学学科的理论偏见，专注于既定事实，并力求洞悉……行为与客体之间的关联。4

What is the relevance of this distinction? Although Husserl was primarily interested in the development of philosophical phenomenology, he was not blind to the fact that his analyses might have ramifications for and be of pertinence to the psychological study of consciousness. Indeed, as he points out in his Amsterdam Lectures from 1928, if psychology is to develop in a scientifically rigorous manner, it needs a proper understanding and conception of experiential life, and this is precisely what phenomenology can offer. Phenomenology returns us to the experiential phenomena themselves, rather than making do with mere speculations and theories about their nature. In addition, phenomenology can supply psychology with a fundamental clarification of its basic concepts (attention, intention, perception, content, etc.). As Husserl writes, the phenomenological psychologist should suspend theoretical prejudices originating from other scientific disciplines in order to focus on what is given and with the aim of obtaining insights into the correlation between act and object.4

尽管胡塞尔撰写了关于现象学心理学的文章，但对他来说，现象学心理学本身并非目的，而始终是通向某种其他事物——即哲学现象学——的手段。正如他在《危机》中所写，“一定存在一种途径，使一种具体实施的心理学能够通向一种先验哲学”。5胡塞尔有时甚至强调通过现象学心理学来研究哲学现象学的入门优势。正如他所说，人们可能一开始对先验哲学毫无兴趣，只关心建立一种严格科学的心理学。如果以某种方式来追求这一任务，激进的方式，如果对意识结构进行足够精确和细致的研究，最终就需要迈出完整的一步，进行先验的转变，从而达到哲学现象学。6

Although Husserl wrote about phenomenological psychology, it was for him never an end in itself, but rather always a means to something else, namely philosophical phenomenology. As he writes in Crisis, “there must be a way whereby a concretely executed psychology could lead to a transcendental philosophy”.5 On occasions, Husserl even emphasises the propaedeutic advantages of approaching philosophical phenomenology through phenomenological psychology. As he puts it, one might start out with no interest whatsoever in transcendental philosophy, and merely be concerned with establishing a strictly scientific psychology. If this task is pursued in a radical manner, and if the structures of consciousness are investigated with sufficient precision and care, it will eventually be necessary to take the full step, to make a transcendental turn, and thereby reach philosophical phenomenology.6

因此，在评价胡塞尔的现象学心理学著作时，重要的是要记住，胡塞尔的主要兴趣在于如何促进进入正确的哲学思考，而不是提供如何进行实验或进行访谈。然而，胡塞尔的著作很早就成为经验主义心理学家的灵感源泉。其中一位值得关注的人物是大卫·卡茨（David Katz，1884-1953），他明确承认自己从胡塞尔那里受益匪浅。卡茨曾在哥廷根参加过胡塞尔的讲座和研讨会，并因其在触觉和色彩现象学方面的重大贡献而闻名。

When assessing Husserl’s work on phenomenological psychology, it is consequently important to bear in mind that Husserl’s primary interest was in the question of how to facilitate the entry into proper philosophical thinking, and not in providing concrete instructions of how to do experiments or conduct interviews. Already early on, however, Husserl’s work became a source of inspiration for empirically oriented psychologists. One noteworthy figure is David Katz (1884–1953) who explicitly acknowledged his debt to Husserl. Katz attended Husserl’s lectures and seminars in Göttingen and is primarily known for his major contributions to the phenomenology of touch and colour.

卡茨作品的一个独特而统一的特征是他对人类经验和现象世界的持久兴趣。正如麦克劳德在讣告中所写，对卡茨而言，任何心理学家“都应该首先刻意地‘排除’其物理、生理和哲学偏见，并尝试观察现象的真实呈现”。7卡茨本人将自己的方法描述为“对现象不带偏见的描述” ， 8他在《色彩世界》的导言中写道：

A distinctive and unifying feature of Katz’s work was his enduring interest in human experience and the world of the phenomena. As MacLeod wrote in his obituary, for Katz any psychologist “should begin by deliberately ‘bracketing’ his physical, physiological, and philosophical biases and attempt to observe phenomena as they are actually presented”.7 Katz himself described his own method as that of an “unprejudiced description of the phenomena”8, and as he put it in his introduction to The World of Colour:

如果不同时忽略所有其他可用于研究颜色的视角，就不可能描述所有颜色现象。如果要完成这项任务，就必须严格且完全地遵循描述性现象学的视角[...]。色彩在空间中的呈现方式和照明现象是本书所报告研究的核心。直到受过现象学训练的人们将照明视为一种独立现象，照明才得以在任何意义上被视为一个独立的心理问题。9

it is impossible to describe the totality of colour-phenomena without at the same time neglecting all other points of view from which colours might be studied. if one is to accomplish such a task one has to adhere rigorously and exclusively to the descriptive phenomenological point of view [. . .]. The modes of appearance of colour in space and the phenomena of illumination stand central in the studies reported in this book. The fact that illumination could in any sense at all be considered an independent psychological problem was not recognized until a phenomenologically trained eye was directed toward illumination as an independent phenomenon.9

重要的是，卡茨并不反对或对量化研究和主流心理学理论不感兴趣。事实上，对卡茨来说，现象学心理学并非只是简单地看待事物表面价值，逃避实验和理论构建的严谨性。相反，它需要精心的训练和训练，才能带来更好的实验和更完善的理论构建。通过尝试对现象进行不带任何扭曲的描述，卡茨成功揭示了普通人类体验中微妙的细微差别，而这些细微差别此前一直被其他实验心理学家忽视。在他关于例如，在触觉方面，他细致地区分了表面触觉、浸入式触觉和体积触觉，10从而指出了感知二维表面结构、将手浸入不同类型的液体中并体验没有明确形状或图案的触觉现象，以及通过触诊皮肤表面来感受底层骨折之间的区别。卡茨还在运动与触觉之间联系的研究方面做出了重要贡献，他认为运动对于触觉而言，就像光对于视觉而言一样不可或缺。11

Importantly, Katz was not opposed to or disinterested in quantitative research and mainstream psychological theory. Indeed, for Katz, phenomenological psychology was not about simply taking things at face value and avoiding the rigors of experimentation and theory construction. On the contrary, it was something that required careful training and discipline, and which could then lead to better experiments and better theorising. Through his attempt to provide undistorted descriptions of the phenomena as they appeared, Katz managed to disclose subtle nuances of ordinary human experience, that until then had been overlooked by other experimental psychologists. In his work on touch, for instance, he meticulously distinguished surface touch, immersed touch, and volume touch,10 thereby pointing to the difference between sensing a two-dimensional surface structure, immersing your hand in different types of liquids and experiencing a tactual phenomenon with no definite shape or pattern, and feeling an underlying bone fracture by palpating the skin surface. Katz also made important contributions to the study of the link between movement and touch and argued that movement is as indispensable to touch as light is to vision.11

卡茨只是众多受现象学影响的杰出心理学家中的首批代表之一，他们对人类经验的各个领域提供了重要且富有启发性的分析。最初，他们中的大多数人活跃于德国，但许多人在20世纪30年代被迫移民。战后，他们的影响力不断扩大，在瑞士、法国、荷兰、丹麦、瑞典和美国等地都出现了活跃的氛围。12其中的重要人物包括埃尔温·施特劳斯（1891-1975）、约翰内斯·林斯霍滕（1925-1964）和弗朗茨·弗洛姆（1914-1998），他们反过来也为我们对空间性、睡眠和人际理解的理解做出了贡献。13

Katz was only one of the first in an illustrious line of phenomenologically influenced psychologists who offered important and illuminating analyses of various domains of human experience. Initially, most were active in Germany, but many were forced to emigrate in the thirties, and after the war the influence spread and there were active environments in, for instance, Switzerland, France, the Netherlands, Denmark, Sweden, and the US.12 Important figures included Erwin Straus (1891–1975), Johannes Linschoten (1925–1964), and Franz From (1914–1998), who in turn contributed to our comprehension of spatiality, sleep, and interpersonal understanding.13

现象学精神病学

PHENOMENOLOGICAL PSYCHIATRY

现象学也很快影响了精神病学领域。例如，卡尔·雅斯贝斯（Karl Jaspers，1883-1969）的早期贡献，他在成为一位颇具影响力的存在主义哲学家之前，曾是一名精神病学家。早在1912年，雅斯贝斯就发表了一篇短文，概述了精神病学如何从胡塞尔的思想中获益。14在接下来的几十年里，路德维希·宾斯旺格（ Ludwig Binswanger，1881-1966）、欧仁·闵可夫斯基（Eugène Minkowski，1885-1972）和梅达尔·博斯（Medard Boss，1903-1990）等杰出的精神病学家都在其研究和实践中运用了现象学。

Phenomenology also soon came to influence the field of psychiatry. Consider, for example, the early contributions of Karl Jaspers (1883–1969), who, before his career as an influential existential philosopher, worked as a psychiatrist. Already in 1912, Jaspers published a short article where he outlined how psychiatry could profit from Husserlian ideas.14 In the following decades prominent psychiatrists such as Ludwig Binswanger (1881–1966), Eugène Minkowski (1885–1972), and Medard Boss (1903–1990) all engaged with phenomenology in their research and practice.

鉴于其主题，这种发展在某种程度上是相当自然的。如果我们考虑一些在不同精神病理条件下受到影响的核心经验范畴，例如时间和空间体验的特征、意向性的结构、自身身体的体验、个体的统一性和同一性，鉴于自我和社会参与的特征，现象学资源的相关性显而易见。正如我们已经看到的，现象学对这些主题进行了广泛的分析，这些分析对于任何有兴趣了解患者体验的精神科医生来说都包含宝贵的素材。早期现象学精神科医生坚信，这种理解是必要的，并且只有认真对待患者的体验诉求和担忧，精神学才能取得进步。这种以人为中心的方法与另一种精神学方法形成鲜明对比，后者在很大程度上忽略了对患者体验生活的兴趣和关注，转而求助于神经病学和神经生物学，试图确定精神障碍的“真正”潜在原因。在最极端的情况下，这种以大脑为中心的方法会将患者报告的症状视为潜在原因的不可靠指标，并认为如果人们真的想研究和理解相关疾病，就应该研究大脑，而不是与患者交谈。

Given its subject matter, this development was to some extent quite natural. If we consider some of the central experiential categories that are afflicted in different psychopathological conditions, such as the character of temporal and spatial experience, the structure of intentionality, the experience of one’s own body, the unity and identity of self, and the character of social engagement, the relevance of the phenomenological resources should be obvious. As we have already seen, phenomenology offers extensive analyses of these topics, and such analyses contain valuable material for any psychiatrist who is interested in understanding the experience of the patient. That such an understanding is needed, and that psychiatry can only make progress if it takes the experiential claims and concerns of the patients seriously, was precisely a conviction shared by the early phenomenological psychiatrists. Such a person-centred approach can be contrasted with another approach in psychiatry, one that largely sidelined the interest in and concern for the experiential life of the patients and instead turned to neurology and neurobiology in an attempt to determine the “real” underlying causes of the mental disorders. At its most extreme, such a brain-centred approach would consider symptoms reported by the patients as unreliable indicators of the underlying causes and argue that one should investigate the brain rather than speak with the patient, if one really wished to study and understand the disorders in question.

在此，我想重点谈谈欧仁·闵可夫斯基（Eugène Minkowski）的贡献。RD·莱恩（RD Laing）后来称他为“精神病学领域第一位清晰阐明现象学研究本质的人物”。15 1909年获得医学学位后，闵可夫斯基学习了哲学，并听取了胡塞尔两位学生普凡德（Pfänder）和盖革（Geiger）的讲座。他最终成为巴黎顶尖精神病院圣安妮医院的首席精神病学家。

Let me here focus on the contribution of Eugène Minkowski, whom R.D. Laing would later describe as “the first figure in psychiatry to bring the nature of phenomenological investigation clearly into view”.15 After obtaining his medical degree in 1909, Minkowski studied philosophy and attended lectures by Pfänder and Geiger, two of Husserl’s former students. He eventually became chief psychiatrist at the Sainte-Anne hospital, a leading psychiatric hospital in Paris.

在闵可夫斯基1933年出版的著作《活生生的时间：现象学和精神病理学研究》中，我们发现了对是否以及如何在临床实践和研究中运用哲学现象学这一问题的清晰思考。正如闵可夫斯基所观察到的，“哲学”一词对有些人来说带有贬义。然而，就他本人而言，现象学的洞见对他的临床实践至关重要，并帮助他拓展了精神病学知识。通过运用现象学的框架和方法，使得我们能够进入病人那原本深不可测的世界。16

In Minkowski’s work, Lived Time: Phenomenological and Psychopathological Studies, published in 1933, we find explicit reflections on the question of whether and how one ought to make use of philosophical phenomenology in clinical practice and research. As Minkowski observed, there are those for whom the term “philosophical” has pejorative connotations. In his own case, however, insights from phenomenology had been of crucial value for his clinical practice and allowed him to expand his psychiatric knowledge. By employing a phenomenological framework and approach, it had been possible to gain some access to the otherwise unfathomable world of the patient.16

闵可夫斯基的核心观点之一是，精神科医生为了做出正确的诊断，不应该仅仅观察和描述症状的频率和规律。这些症状，比如，浮夸妄想或在他看来，幻觉只能展现出疾病的表面。它们因人而异，最终是对疾病更根本核心的次要和补偿性反应。精神科医生的任务是超越这些零散的表面症状，将它们与患者自身存在感的改变联系起来。17

One of Minkowski’s central claims was that the psychiatrist in order to offer a proper diagnosis should not merely observe and describe the frequency and regularity of the symptoms. Such symptoms, say, florid delusions or hallucinations, would in his view only present us with the surface of the disorder. They vary from individual to individual and are ultimately secondary and compensatory reactions to what must be considered the more fundamental core of the disorder. The task of the psychiatrist is to go beyond these scattered surface symptoms and relate them to the existential alterations of the patient’s very being-in-the-world.17

为了举例说明，明可夫斯基指出了患有精神分裂症患者和麻痹性痴呆患者在理解“此时此刻的我”方面存在显著差异。后者可能对自己的生平、职业、婚姻状况等一无所知，通常也不知道客观上自己身在何处、日期和时间，但他们却能轻松地用手指着自己或用脚敲地来表明自己此时此刻。相比之下，精神分裂症患者可能对客观事实、自身历史、职业以及确切的地点和时间有着详尽的了解，但却无法在主观上感受到与此时此刻的联系。正如闵可夫斯基所说，“我存在”这个词对他们来说不再具有任何精确的含义。因此，闵可夫斯基探讨了精神分裂症患者如何严重影响“此时此刻的我”。

As an illustration, Minkowski points to the difference between patients with schizophrenia and patients with paralytic dementia when it comes to their grasp of the “me-here-now”. Whereas the latter might no longer know anything about their own autobiography, profession, civil status, etc., and typically lack knowledge of where they are and what date and time it is objectively speaking, they have no problem indicating that they are here right now by pointing to themselves or by tapping their feet at the ground. Patients with schizophrenia by contrast, might have detailed knowledge about the objective facts, about their history, profession, and the exact place and time, but do not feel subjectively connected to the here and now. As Minkowski puts it, the words “I exist” no longer have any precise sense for them. Minkowski consequently talks of how the fundamental framework of “me-here-now” is morbidly affected in schizophrenia.

更具体地说，闵可夫斯基认为精神分裂症涉及他所谓的与现实至关重要的联系的根本丧失。18失去这种能力就意味着失去“与世界产生共鸣”的能力。这意味着失去自动且毫不费力地理解物体、情境、事件和他人意义的能力。由于这种丧失，精神分裂症患者可能会对大多数人认为显而易见的事情感到困惑，并因此陷入普遍的困惑状态。一切都变成了沉思和深思熟虑。

More specifically, Minkowski took schizophrenia to involve what he called a fundamental loss of vital contact with reality.18 To lose this ability is to lose the ability to “resonate with the world”. It is to lose the ability to grasp the significance of objects, situations, events, and other people automatically and effortlessly. Because of this loss, individuals with schizophrenia might be puzzled by matters that seem obvious to most people and as a result find themselves in pervasive states of perplexity. Everything becomes a matter of rumination and deliberation.

闵可夫斯基对现象学感兴趣的原因之一，正是因为他认为现象学能够揭示和分析这种改变的结构。然而与此同时，闵可夫斯基还强调了哲学现象学如何从其与精神病学的互动中学习。通过始终以患者体验生活的具体性为导向，精神病学可以帮助哲学摆脱空洞的抽象和推测。精神病学研究甚至可能促使现象学分析的改进，因为它能够唤起人们对迄今为止被忽视的特定方面或维度的关注。通过揭示各种体验异常，精神病学家不仅可以帮助哲学家区分偶然的规律与真正的本质特征，还能将那些被视为理所当然、被忽视的正常存在状态，无论是在意向性层面，通过研究其病理扭曲，我们可以清楚地看到主体间性或自我体验。

One of the reasons Minkowski became interested in phenomenology was precisely because he thought it capable of uncovering and analysing such altered structures. At the same time, however, Minkowski also emphasised how philosophical phenomenology might learn from its engagement with psychiatry. By constantly being oriented toward the concreteness of the patient’s experiential life, psychiatry could help steer philosophy away from empty abstractions and speculations. Psychiatric research might even lead to a refinement of the phenomenological analyses, insofar as it called attention to specific aspects or dimensions that had hitherto been ignored. By disclosing various experiential anomalies, the psychiatrist could not only help the philosopher distinguish accidental regularities from truly essential features but also bring the taken-forgranted, unnoticed conditions of normal existence, be it at the level of intentionality, intersubjectivity, or self-experience, into sharp relief through a study of their pathological distortions.

闵可夫斯基对现象学和精神病学之间关系的讨论，是后来被称为相互启发或相互启迪。19在最好的情况下，应用现象学不仅仅是把现成的想法从一方移植到另一方的问题；不仅仅是从哲学到精神病学或心理学，而是一种双向交流，双方都可以从互动中获益并因此而成长。

Minkowski’s discussion of the relation between phenomenology and psychiatry is an early illustration of what would later be called a relationship of mutual illumination or mutual enlightenment.19 In a best-case scenario, to apply phenomenology is not simply a question of importing readymade ideas from one side to the other; is not simply a one-way street from philosophy to psychiatry or psychology, but a two-way exchange, where both sides might profit from the interaction and grow as a result.

然而，与此同时，闵可夫斯基当然也没有忽视哲学与精神病学之间的差异，并明确警告不要对两者的兼容性抱有过于天真的看法。正如他曾写道：

At the same time, however, Minkowski was certainly not overlooking the difference between philosophy and psychiatry and was explicitly warning against any overly naive take on their compatibility. As he wrote at one point:

这绝不是简单地将某位哲学家使用的数据和方法转移到精神病理学事实领域的问题。那样做必然会导致对精神病理学，这是我小心翼翼避免的一种危险，并且我警告过那些追随我道路的年轻同事们，这可能会彻底扭曲精神病理学。20

it was never a question of transposing purely and simply the data and methods used by a given philosopher into the realm of psychopathological facts. That would have led inevitably to a “hyperphilosophizing” of psychopathology, a danger i carefully avoided and against which i warned my young colleagues who were following in my path; it would have risked deforming psychopathology entirely.20

现象学社会学

PHENOMENOLOGICAL SOCIOLOGY

正如第八章所指出的，现象学家们投入了大量的时间来分析主体间性和社会性的主题，胡塞尔甚至一度认为，对社会性的正确发展现象学的研究将导致一种哲学社会学。21一般而言，人们很容易将现象学视为元社会学或原社会学的一种形式。通过对人类社会存在进行根本性描述，现象学阐明了社会科学运作的框架。或者，换句话说，一个令人信服的社会现实理论需要对人类（间）主体性的解释，而这正是现象学可以提供的。然而，事实证明，在社会学中也可以发现一种独特的传统，在主题和概念方面借鉴了古典现象学。

As was pointed out in Chapter 8, phenomenologists have devoted a lot of time to the analysis of the topics of intersubjectivity and sociality, and at one point Husserl even argued that a proper development of phenomenology would lead to a kind of philosophical sociology.21 Generally speaking, one can easily see phenomenology as a form of meta- or proto-sociology. By offering a fundamental account of human social existence, phenomenology is offering an elucidation of the framework within which the social sciences operate. Or, to put it differently, and even more concisely, a convincing theory of social reality requires an account of human (inter)subjectivity, which is something phenomenology can offer. As it turns out, however, one can also find a distinct tradition within sociology that draws from classical phenomenology when it comes to its themes and concepts.

我们首先来看一下一位关键人物，即阿尔弗雷德·舒茨（Alfred Schutz，1899-1959），他通常被认为是现象学社会学的创始人。舒茨最初学习法律，并于1921年在维也纳获得博士学位。之后，他在一家银行找到工作，直到1943年移民美国后，舒茨才在一所大学——纽约社会研究新学院——获得了一份兼职职位。1952年，他成为该学院的教授。

Let us first look at a key figure, namely Alfred Schutz (1899–1959), who is often considered the founder of phenomenological sociology. Schutz originally studied law and obtained his doctorate in Vienna in 1921. Subsequently, he found work in a bank, and it was not until 1943, after his emigration to the USA, that Schutz obtained a part-time position at a university, namely at the New School for Social Research in New York. In 1952 he became a professor at the same institution.

舒茨最初受到马克斯·韦伯社会学的启发，但尽管韦伯认为有意义的行动是社会科学的中心议题，但韦伯并没有探究关于社会意义的构成，舒茨试图通过用胡塞尔现象学的思想来丰富和扩展韦伯的理论来填补这个空白。

Schutz was initially inspired by Max Weber’s sociology, but although Weber regarded meaningful action as the central topic of the social sciences, Weber did not pursue more fundamental questions regarding the constitution of social meaning, and it was this lacuna that Schutz attempted to fill by enriching and expanding Weber’s theory with ideas drawn from Husserl’s phenomenology.

由于它是生活世界而不是舒茨认为，社会学家应该从科学世界出发，因为科学世界构成了社会关系和行动的框架和阶段。当时所需要的正是对日常生活的系统研究，而对舒茨来说，这需要一种新型的社会学理论。更具体地说，舒茨的具体贡献，在他最著名的著作《社会世界现象学》（1932年）中已经有所体现。这一贡献一方面在于描述和分析生活世界的本质结构，另一方面在于阐释主观性如何参与社会意义的建构。借鉴胡塞尔对意向性的分析，舒茨认为，社会世界在各种意向性体验中揭示和展现自身。它的意义在于社会是由主体构成的，为了理解和科学地处理社会世界，就必须考察社会主体。如果没有个体主体，在一个没有思维的宇宙中就不会有社会现实。对舒茨来说，社会学的主要对象因此不是制度、市场形势、社会阶级或权力结构，而是人，即行动和经历的个体，我们不仅要考虑他们之间的各种关系，还要关注他们自己的、构成意义的主观生活。当然，舒茨的观点并不是说社会学不应该对制度、权力结构、阶级等有任何兴趣。但他警告不要将这些社会结构具体化和绝对化。人的主观性不仅仅是由社会力量塑造和决定的。在与他人的互动中，主观性也塑造着社会现实。现象学社会学的任务是理解这一构成过程的运作，并阐明社会主体如何理解他们所生活的世界。22

Since it is the lifeworld rather than the world of science that constitutes the frame and stage of social relations and actions, the sociologist, Schutz argued, should take her point of departure from the former. What was needed is precisely a systematic study of everyday life, and for Schutz this called for a new type of sociological theory. More specifically, Schutz’s concrete contribution, which can already be found in his most well-known work The Phenomenology of the Social World from 1932, was on the one hand to describe and analyse the essential structures of the lifeworld and on the other to offer an account of the way in which subjectivity is involved in the construction of social meaning. Drawing on Husserl’s analyses of intentionality, Schutz claimed that the social world reveals and manifests itself in various intentional experiences. Its meaningfulness is constituted by subjects, and in order to understand and scientifically address the social world, it is therefore necessary to examine the social agents for whom it exists. Absent individual subjects, in a mindless universe, there would be no social reality. For Schutz, the primary object of sociology is consequently not institutions, market conjunctures, social classes, or structures of power, but human beings, i.e., acting and experiencing individuals, considered in their myriad relations to each other, but also with an eye to their own, meaning-constituting subjective lives. Schutz’s point, of course, is not that sociology should have no interest whatsoever in institutions, power structures, classes, and the like. But he warned against reifying and absolutising such societal structures. Human subjectivity is not merely moulded and determined by social forces. In interaction with others, subjectivity also shapes social reality. The task of a phenomenological sociology is to understand the workings of this constitutive process, and to clarify how social agents make sense of the world in which they live.22

那么，舒茨是如何描述和刻画我们日常生活的呢？他的一个核心概念是典型化。成年人在生活世界中游走时，会运用一系列的格言、规则和方法，来应对各种情况，并理解世界。这并非理论理性的问题，而是一种实践“诀窍”，它规定了“一个人”在特定情况下的行为，并让我们感觉到我们可以依赖社会现实，其他人也会以类似的方式经历它。这种知识的主要来源是先前的经验——既有我们自己的经验，也有他人传递给我们的经验。正如舒茨曾经指出的那样，我们谁也无法选择自己的处境。出生、母语、父母家庭的社会和经济地位，或是我们所处的社会群体所视之为理所当然的世界观。我们都发现自己身处一个预先设定的类型化、角色和地位体系之中，这些并非我们自身创造，而是我们社会遗产的一部分。23

How, then, does Schutz describe and characterise our daily life in the social world? One central notion of his is that of typification. When adults navigate the lifeworld, they operate with a repertoire of maxims, rules, and recipes for how to handle various situations and for how the world should be understood. This is not a matter of theoretical rationality, but rather of a form of practical “know-how” that specifies what “one” does in a given situation and provides us with the sense that we can rely on social reality and that others also experience it in a similar manner. The primary source of this knowledge is previous experiences – both experiences we have had ourselves, and experiences transmitted to us by others. As Schutz remarks at one point, none of us choose our place of birth, our mother tongue, the social and economic status of our parental family, or the conception of the world that is taken for granted by the group within which we are socialised. We all find ourselves situated within a preconstituted system of typifications, roles, and positions that are not of our own making, but part of our social heritage.23

类型化不仅影响我们如何理解世界，也在我们如何理解他人方面发挥着关键作用。要理解其中的原因，首先必须认识到社会世界是异质的，人际理解也是如此。后者有所不同，取决于我们试图理解的事物是实体性的，还是在时空中被移除的。这取决于其他事物是否属于我们的同伴、同时代人、前辈或后辈的世界，或者用舒茨的原话来说，取决于其他事物是否属于我们的环境世界Mitwelt（中间世界）、Vorwelt（前方世界）或Folgewelt（后面世界）。24社会世界是多层次的，现象学社会学的重要任务之一就是对这些不同层面进行仔细的分析。

Typifications do not merely affect how we understand the world but also play a key role in how we understand others. To see why, it is first important to realise that the social world is heterogeneous and that the same holds true for interpersonal understanding. The latter differs, depending on whether the ones we seek to understand are bodily present, or, rather, removed in space and time. It depends on whether the others belong to the world of our associates, contemporaries, predecessors, or successors, or to use Schutz’s original terms, whether the others belong to our Umwelt, Mitwelt, Vorwelt, or Folgewelt.24 The social world is multilayered, and one of the important tasks of a phenomenological sociology is to conduct a careful analysis of these different strata.

让我们仔细审视我们与同代人交往的方式——即那些我们与之共存于时间中，但由于他们不存在于我们身边，我们无法直接体验的人。面对面的交往需要直接体验他人，即使这种体验可能非常偶然——比如在火车上与陌生人偶然相遇——而我们对同代人的理解，从定义上来说却是间接的，并且总是依赖于我们对社会世界的普遍认知，并受到典型性结构的塑造和框定。25正如舒茨所写：

Let us take a closer look at the way we engage with our contemporaries – that is, those with whom we co-exist in time, but who we do not experience directly since they are not present in our immediate surroundings. Whereas face-to-face relationships involve a direct experience of the other, even if it can be very casual – say, a chance meeting with a stranger on the train – our understanding of our contemporaries is by definition indirect and will always draw on our general knowledge of the social world and be shaped and framed by structures of typicality.25 As Schutz writes:

当我把信放进邮箱时，我期望那些被称为邮递员的陌生人会以一种我不太理解的典型方式行事，这样我的信就能在通常合理的时间内送达收件人。我从未见过法国人或德国人，却能理解“为什么法国害怕德国重新武装”。为了遵循英语语法规则，我遵循了当代英语同胞的一种社会认可的行为模式，我必须调整自己的行为才能让自己被理解。最后，任何制品或器具都指制造它的匿名同胞，供其他匿名同胞使用，以通过典型的手段实现典型的目标。26

putting a letter in the mailbox, i expect that unknown people, called postmen, will act in a typical way, not quite intelligible to me, with the result that my letter will reach the addressee within typically reasonable time. Without ever having met a Frenchman or a German, i understand “Why France fears the rearmament of Germany.” complying with a rule of english grammar, i follow a socially approved behavior pattern of contemporary english-speaking fellow-men to which i have to adjust my own behavior in order to make myself understandable. And, finally, any artifact or utensil refers to the anonymous fellow-man who produced it to be used by other anonymous fellow-men for attaining typical goals by typical means.26

正如引文所言，许多社会过程不仅仅涉及对他人的典型化。它们常常也迫使我将自己的行为典型化。寄信时，我会尽量使普通邮递员能够辨认我的笔迹，我会在信封上典型的位置写上地址，等等。简而言之，我努力让自己成为典型的“寄信人”。27通过这种方式，社会典型化和（自我）分类促进了日常的可预测性，也使我更容易在社交世界中游刃有余。

As the quote makes clear, many social processes do not merely involve typifications of others. They often also force me to typify my own actions. When posting a letter, I try to write in such a way that a typical postal worker will be able to decipher my handwriting, I write the address in a typical place on the envelope, etc. Briefly put, I try to make myself the typical “sender of a letter”.27 In this way, social typification and (self-)categorisation facilitates everyday predictability and makes it easier to navigate the social world.

我们日常的意义建构也体现了知识的社会分布性。我们所有人都对某些事情略知一二，但对其他事情却知之甚少。一个人可能是芬兰-乌戈尔语专家，却不知道如果汽车发动不了该怎么办。幸运的是，其他人（比如机械师）知道如何处理这类事情。而且，我们大多数人都拥有足够的知识，即使在专业领域之外，也能应付日常生活。我们知道如何加油，也大致知道如何找到能够填补我们知识储备空白的人。28

Our everyday sense-making is also marked by the fact that knowledge is socially distributed. All of us know something about certain things, but very little about other things. A person can be an expert in Finno-Ugric languages and have no idea what to do if he cannot start his car. Fortunately, others (mechanics) do know how to deal with this sort of thing. And most of us have sufficient knowledge, even outside our fields of expertise, to get by in everyday life. We know how to fill up the tank and we have some rough knowledge of how to find someone who can fill the gaps in our own stock of knowledge.28

舒茨经常强调知识的社会分配是一个尚未得到充分研究的课题，它也可能被称为“知识社会学”。29最初，知识社会学是一门主要研究认识论问题的学科，例如如何获得真正的知识、通过哪些方法等等。它关注的是理论思想和“精英”的知识。然而，舒茨强调，机械师和超市收银员也拥有他们自己的知识，这些知识与科学和文化精英的知识一样，都是真正的知识社会学的合法研究对象。30

Schutz often stressed that the social distribution of knowledge was a topic that had been insufficiently studied and that it might also be labelled a “sociology of knowledge”.29 Originally, sociology of knowledge was a discipline that primarily addressed epistemological issues, such as how true knowledge is acquired, by which methods, etc. Its focus was on theoretical ideas and the knowledge of the “elite”. Schutz, however, emphasised that also the mechanic and the supermarket check-out assistant have their own kind of knowledge and that such knowledge is just as legitimate an object for a genuine sociology of knowledge as is the knowledge of the scientific and cultural elite.30

在《现实的社会建构：知识社会学论》中，舒茨的两位前学生彼得·L·伯杰和托马斯·卢克曼认为，知识社会学的任务是分析各种知识（包括科学知识和日常知识）形成和维持的社会条件。他们认同舒茨的基本直觉。简而言之，知识社会学关注的是知识是如何被生产、传播和内化的；它考察任何形式的知识——无论是西藏僧侣、美国女商人还是荷兰犯罪学家——的有效性是如何被社会确立的。31但正如伯杰和卢克曼也强调的那样：

In The Social Construction of Reality: A Treatise in the Sociology of Knowledge, two former students of Schutz, Peter L. Berger and Thomas Luckmann, argued that it is the task of a sociology of knowledge to analyse the societal conditions for the formation and maintenance of various types of knowledge, scientific as well as quotidian. They shared Schutz’s basic intuitions. The sociology of knowledge is, briefly put, interested in how knowledge is produced, distributed, and internalised; it examines how the validity of any form of knowledge – be it that of the Tibetan monk, the American businesswoman, or the Dutch criminologist – is socially established.31 But as Berger and Luckmann also stressed:

知识社会学首先必须关注人们在日常生活中，在非理论或前理论的生活中“知道”的“现实”。换句话说，常识性“知识”而非“观念”必须成为知识社会学的核心关注点。正是这种“知识”构成了意义的结构，没有它，任何社会都无法存在。32

[T]he sociology of knowledge must first of all concern itself with what people “know” as “reality” in their everyday, non- or pre-theoretical lives. in other words, common-sense “knowledge” rather than “ideas” must be the central focus for the sociology of knowledge. it is precisely this “knowledge” that constitutes the fabric of meanings without which no society could exist.32

伯格和卢克曼拒绝任何将社会现实视为独立自然实体、非人类或超人类事物的尝试。33正如他们所写，社会秩序是人类活动的产物；它既不是由生物学决定的，也不是以任何其他方式由自然事实决定的：“社会秩序不是‘事物的本质’的一部分，也不能从‘自然法则’中推导出来。社会秩序只作为人类活动的产物而存在。” 34社会理论的任务是解释人类如何通过多种形式的互动，创造和塑造社会结构和制度，这些结构和制度最初可能具有共同的、主体间现实的特征，但最终会“外化”并实现客观地位。正如舒茨所说，这主要是通过制度化的典型化。35通过制度化，人类活动受到社会控制。建构的社会结构定义了什么是正常的，并引入制裁来维护社会秩序，避免偏差。随着时间的推移，制度逐渐显得不可避免且客观。然而：

Berger and Luckmann rejected any attempt to view social reality as a self-standing natural entity, as a non-human or supra-human thing.33 As they write, the social order is a product of human activity; it is neither biologically determined, nor in any other way determined by facts of nature: “Social order is not part of the ‘nature of things’, and it cannot be derived from the ‘laws of nature’. Social order exists only as a product of human activity”.34 The task of social theory is to provide an account of how human beings, through manifold forms of interaction, create and shape social structures and institutions, which may first have the character of a common, intersubjective reality, but eventually become “externalised” and achieve objective status. As Schutz would also say, this happens largely through institutionalised typifications.35 Through institution-alisation, human activity is subjected to social control. The constructed social structures define what is normal, and sanctions are introduced to maintain the social order and avoid deviation. With time, institutions come to appear inevitable and objective. Yet:

重要的是要记住制度世界的客观性，无论在个体看来有多么庞大，都是一种人为生产、建构的客观性[……]。制度世界是客体化的人类活动，每一个机构亦是如此。[……]人类能够生产一个世界，而这个世界随后被他体验为某种不同于人类产品的东西，这一悖论将在后面探讨。目前，重要的是要强调，人（生产者）与社会世界（其产品）之间的关系是、并且将始终是一种辩证关系。也就是说，人（当然不是孤立的，而是集体的）与其社会世界相互作用。产品反过来又作用于生产者。36

it is important to keep in mind that the objectivity of the institutional world, however massive it may appear to the individual, is a humanly produced, constructed objectivity [. . .]. The institutional world is objectivated human activity, and so is every single institution. [. . .] The paradox that man is capable of producing a world that he then experiences as something other than a human product will concern us later on. At the moment, it is important to emphasize that the relationship between man, the producer, and the social world, his product, is and remains a dialectical one. That is, man (not, of course, in isolation but in his collectivities) and his social world interact with each other. The product acts back upon the producer.36

因此，社会现实不仅是外化和客体化的人类产物，它还会反作用于人类。这不仅体现在我们可能将其视为一种无法抗拒的压迫性外力，也体现在社会现实是个体人类“内化”的东西。我们并非在社会之外成长，而是在社会中成长。随着我们成长和成熟，我们会从他人那里习得角色、态度和规范。37因此，伯格和卢克曼强调，人类社会必须“以一种外化、客体化和内化三个时刻的持续辩证法” 。38

Thus, social reality is not only an externalised and objectified human product, it also acts back upon human beings. Not only in the sense that we may feel it as an oppressive external force that we cannot resist, but also in the sense that social reality is something individual human beings “internalise”. We are not raised outside society, but grow up within it. And as we grow up and mature, we adopt roles, attitudes, and norms from others.37 Human society, Berger and Luckmann emphasise, must therefore be “understood in terms of an ongoing dialectic of the three moments of externalization, objectivation and internalization”.38

如果我们在简要回顾之后，简要思考一下心理学家、精神病学家和社会学家早期在研究中运用现象学思想的方式，就会发现他们经常从胡塞尔早期描述现象学的思想中汲取灵感。这些思想包括胡塞尔对意向性体验的兴趣，以及他坚持认真关注现象的全部具体性的重要性，目的是避免施皮格尔伯格后来所说的“先入为主的理论对现象的过早束缚”。39坚持以开放的心态进行研究，并以既定内容（即手头的研究对象）为指导，而不是以我们根据先前的理论承诺所期望发现的内容为指导，这当然可以看作是一种方法论建议。在某种程度上，正是这些建议帮助相关学科挑战了行为主义、实证主义和各种形式的还原论等主流理论。此外，许多人还从具体的现象学概念（例如具身性、共情或生活世界）中汲取灵感。在大多数情况下，现象学思想的采纳是基于实用性和相关性的标准，而非出于对方法论纯粹性或严格正统性的考量。舒茨或许是最突出的例子。正如他反复明确指出的那样，他对社会世界的研究并不遵循或运用严格的现象学方法。舒茨对从自然态度，即在一种非先验现象学中，现象学还原。40

If we after this quick survey briefly consider the way in which psychologists, psychiatrists, and sociologists early on employed ideas from phenomenology in their research, it is significant that they often took inspiration from ideas found in Husserl’s early descriptive phenomenology. These included Husserl’s interest in intentional experience and his insistence on the importance of carefully attending to the phenomena in their full concreteness with the aim of avoiding what Spiegelberg would later call the “premature straitjacketing of the phenomena by preconceived theories”.39 To insist that the investigation should be conducted in an open-minded manner and be guided by what is given, i.e., by the subject matter at hand, rather than by what we expect to find given our prior theoretical commitments, can certainly be seen as a methodological recommendation. It was in part such recommendations that helped the disciplines in question challenge dominant theories such as behaviourism, positivism, and various forms of reductionism. In addition, many also took inspiration from specific phenomenological concepts such as embodiment, empathy, or the lifeworld. In most cases, the adoption of phenomenological ideas happened in accordance with criteria of usefulness and relevance, rather than by a concern for methodological purity or strict orthodoxy. Schutz is perhaps the most pronounced example of this. As he repeatedly makes clear, his study of the social world doesn’t adhere to or employ the strict phenomenological method. Schutz is explicitly interested in a phenomenology conducted from within the natural attitude, i.e., in a non-transcendental phenomenology that can manage without the phenomenological reduction.40

笔记

NOTES

  2. For a comprehensive discussion of this development, see Spiegelberg, H. (1972). Phenomenology in Psychology and Psychiatry. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press.

  16. Quoted in Spiegelberg, H. (1972). Phenomenology in Psychology and Psychiatry. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press: 43.
  17. Katz, D. (1999). 《色彩世界》，RB MacLeod 和 CW Fox 译。阿宾登：劳特利奇：5。
  18. Katz, D. (1999). The World of Colour, trans. R.B. MacLeod and C.W. Fox. Abingdon: Routledge: 5.
  19. Katz, D. (1989). 《触觉的世界》，LE Krueger 译。新泽西州希尔斯代尔：劳伦斯·埃尔鲍姆联合出版社：50–53。
  20. Katz, D. (1989). The World of Touch, trans. L.E. Krueger. Hillsdale, NJ: Lawrence Erlbaum Associates: 50–53.
  21. Katz, D. (1989). 《触觉的世界》，LE Krueger 译。新泽西州希尔斯代尔：劳伦斯·埃尔鲍姆联合出版社：76。
  22. Katz, D. (1989). The World of Touch, trans. L.E. Krueger. Hillsdale, NJ: Lawrence Erlbaum Associates: 76.
  23. 随后，人们习惯性地谈论现象学心理学中的荷兰学派（以Buytendijk、Berg和Linschoten等人为主导）和现象学哥本哈根学派（以Rubin、From和Tranekjær Rasmussen为代表）（参见Kockelmans, JJ (ed.) (1987)。现象学心理学：荷兰学派。多德雷赫特：施普林格和Hansen, CR 和 Karpatschof, B.（编）（2001 年）。
  24. It has subsequently become customary to speak of the Dutch school in phenomenological psychology (dominated by people such as Buytendijk, Berg, and Linschoten) and the Copenhagen school of phenomenology (represented by Rubin, From, and Tranekjær Rasmussen) (see Kockelmans, J.J. (ed.) (1987). Phenomenological Psychology: The Dutch School. Dordrecht: Springer and Hansen, C.R. and Karpatschof, B. (eds.) (2001). Københavner-fænomenologien, Bisat eller Genfødt? København: Danmarks Pædagogiske Universitet).
  25. 斯特劳斯， E.（1963）。感官的主要世界：感官体验的辩护，跨。 J.尼德曼。纽约州纽约：格伦科自由新闻社；林斯霍滕，J. (1987)。入睡时。见 JJ Kockelmans（主编），现象学心理学：荷兰学派（第 79-117 页）。多德雷赫特：施普林格；来自 F. (1953)。Om Oplevelsen af Andres Adfærd：Et Bidrag til den Menneskelige Adfærds Fænomenologi。哥本哈根：Nyt Nordisk Forlag。
  26. Straus, E. (1963). The Primary World of Senses: A Vindication of Sensory Experience, trans. J. Needleman. New York, NY: The Free Press of Glencoe; Linschoten, J. (1987). On falling asleep. In J.J. Kockelmans (ed.), Phenomenological Psychology: The Dutch School (pp. 79–117). Dordrecht: Springer; From, F. (1953). Om Oplevelsen af Andres Adfærd: Et Bidrag til den Menneskelige Adfærds Fænomenologi. København: Nyt Nordisk Forlag.
  27. 雅斯贝尔斯， K. (1912)。精神病理学中的现象学研究。《神经病学与精神病学全集》杂志9：391-408。
  28. Jaspers, K. (1912). Die phänomenologische forschungsrichtung in der psychopathologie. Zeitschrift für die gesamte Neurologie und Psychiatrie 9: 391–408.
  29. Laing, RD (1963). 闵可夫斯基与精神分裂症。《存在主义心理学与精神病学评论》3(3): 207。
  30. Laing, R.D. (1963). Minkowski and schizophrenia. Review of Existential Psychology and Psychiatry 3(3): 207.
  31. Minkowski, E. (2019). 《生活时间：现象学与精神病理学研究》，N. Metzel 译。伊利诺伊州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社：xv。
  32. Minkowski, E. (2019). Lived Time: Phenomenological and Psychopathological Studies, trans. N. Metzel. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press: xv.
  33. Minkowski, E. (2019)。《生活时间：现象学与精神病理学研究》，N. Metzel 译。伊利诺伊州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社：185、222、228。
  34. Minkowski, E. (2019). Lived Time: Phenomenological and Psychopathological Studies, trans. N. Metzel. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press: 185, 222, 228.
  35. Minkowski, E. (2019)。《生活时间：现象学与精神病理学研究》，N. Metzel 译。伊利诺伊州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社：227。
  36. Minkowski, E. (2019). Lived Time: Phenomenological and Psychopathological Studies, trans. N. Metzel. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press: 227.
  37. Varela, FJ、Thompson, E. 和 Rosch, E. (1991)。《具身心智：认知科学与人类经验》。马萨诸塞州剑桥：麻省理工学院出版社：15；Gallagher, S. (1997)。《相互启蒙：认知科学中的新现象学》。《意识研究杂志》 4(3): 195–214。
  38. Varela, F.J., Thompson, E., and Rosch, E. (1991). The Embodied Mind: Cognitive Science and Human Experience. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press: 15; Gallagher, S. (1997). Mutual enlightenment: Recent phenomenology in cognitive science. Journal of Consciousness Studies 4(3): 195–214.
  39. Minkowski, E. (2019). 《生活时间：现象学与精神病理学研究》，N. Metzel 译。伊利诺伊州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社：xv。
  40. Minkowski, E. (2019). Lived Time: Phenomenological and Psychopathological Studies, trans. N. Metzel. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press: xv.
  41. 胡塞尔， E.（1962）。现象学心理学。 1925 年夏季学期，编辑。作者：W.比梅尔。 Husserliana 9。海牙：Martinus Nijhoff：539。
  42. Husserl, E. (1962). Phänomenologische Psychologie. Vorlesungen Sommersemester 1925, ed. by W. Biemel. Husserliana 9. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 539.
  43. Schutz, A. (1962).社会现实问题：论文集 I.海牙: Martinus Nijhoff: 34–35; Schutz, A. (1964).社会理论研究：论文集 II . 海牙: Martinus Nijhoff: 6–7。
  44. Schutz, A. (1962). The Problem of Social Reality: Collected Papers I. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 34–35; Schutz, A. (1964). Studies in Social Theory: Collected Papers II. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 6–7.
  45. Schutz, A. (1964).社会理论研究：论文集 II . 海牙：Martinus Nijhoff 出版社：250, 252
  46. Schutz, A. (1964). Studies in Social Theory: Collected Papers II. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 250, 252
  47. Schutz, A. (1967). 《社会世界现象学》，G. Walsh 和 F. Lehnert 译。伊利诺伊州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社：14。
  48. Schutz, A. (1967). The Phenomenology of the Social World, trans. G. Walsh and F. Lehnert. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press: 14.
  49. Schutz, A. (1967). 《社会世界现象学》，G. Walsh 和 F. Lehnert 译。伊利诺伊州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社：181, 184。
  50. Schutz, A. (1967). The Phenomenology of the Social World, trans. G. Walsh and F. Lehnert. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press: 181, 184.
  51. Schutz, A. (1962).社会现实问题：论文集 I。海牙：Martinus Nijhoff：17。
  52. Schutz, A. (1962). The Problem of Social Reality: Collected Papers I. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 17.
  53. Schutz, A. (1962).社会现实问题：论文集 I。海牙：Martinus Nijhoff：25–26。
  54. Schutz, A. (1962). The Problem of Social Reality: Collected Papers I. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 25–26.
  55. Schutz, A. (1962).社会现实问题：论文集 I。海牙：Martinus Nijhoff：14-15。
  56. Schutz, A. (1962). The Problem of Social Reality: Collected Papers I. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 14–15.
  57. Schutz, A. (1962).社会现实问题：论文集 I。海牙：Martinus Nijhoff：15, 149。
  58. Schutz, A. (1962). The Problem of Social Reality: Collected Papers I. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 15, 149.
  59. Schutz, A. (1964).社会理论研究：论文集 II。海牙：Martinus Nijhoff：122–123。
  60. Schutz, A. (1964). Studies in Social Theory: Collected Papers II. The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff: 122–123.
  61. Berger, PL 和 Luckmann, T. (1991)。《现实的社会建构：知识社会学论》。哈蒙兹沃思：企鹅出版社：15。
  62. Berger, P.L. and Luckmann, T. (1991). The Social Construction of Reality: A Treatise in the Sociology of Knowledge. Harmondsworth: Penguin Books: 15.
  63. Berger, PL 和 Luckmann, T. (1991)。《现实的社会建构：知识社会学论》。哈蒙兹沃思：企鹅出版社：27。
  64. Berger, P.L. and Luckmann, T. (1991). The Social Construction of Reality: A Treatise in the Sociology of Knowledge. Harmondsworth: Penguin Books: 27.
  65. Berger, PL 和 Luckmann, T. (1991)。《现实的社会建构：知识社会学论》。哈蒙兹沃思：企鹅出版社：106。
  66. Berger, P.L. and Luckmann, T. (1991). The Social Construction of Reality: A Treatise in the Sociology of Knowledge. Harmondsworth: Penguin Books: 106.
  67. Berger, PL 和 Luckmann, T. (1991)。《现实的社会建构：知识社会学论》。哈蒙兹沃思：企鹅出版社，70。
  68. Berger, P.L. and Luckmann, T. (1991). The Social Construction of Reality: A Treatise in the Sociology of Knowledge. Harmondsworth: Penguin Books: 70.
  69. Berger, PL 和 Luckmann, T. (1991)。《现实的社会建构：知识社会学论》。哈蒙兹沃思：企鹅出版社：85-96。
  70. Berger, P.L. and Luckmann, T. (1991). The Social Construction of Reality: A Treatise in the Sociology of Knowledge. Harmondsworth: Penguin Books: 85–96.
  71. Berger, PL 和 Luckmann, T. (1991)。《现实的社会建构：知识社会学论》。哈蒙兹沃思：企鹅出版社：78。
  72. Berger, P.L. and Luckmann, T. (1991). The Social Construction of Reality: A Treatise in the Sociology of Knowledge. Harmondsworth: Penguin Books: 78.
  73. Berger, PL 和 Luckmann, T. (1991)。《现实的社会建构：知识社会学论》。哈蒙兹沃思：企鹅出版社：149–157。
  74. Berger, P.L. and Luckmann, T. (1991). The Social Construction of Reality: A Treatise in the Sociology of Knowledge. Harmondsworth: Penguin Books: 149–157.
  75. Berger, PL 和 Luckmann, T. (1991)。《现实的社会建构：知识社会学论》。哈蒙兹沃思：企鹅出版社：149。
  76. Berger, P.L. and Luckmann, T. (1991). The Social Construction of Reality: A Treatise in the Sociology of Knowledge. Harmondsworth: Penguin Books: 149.
  77. Spiegelberg, H. (1972)。《心理学和精神病学中的现象学》。伊利诺伊州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社：308。
  78. Spiegelberg, H. (1972). Phenomenology in Psychology and Psychiatry. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press: 308.
