进一步阅读的建议

SUGGESTIONS FOR FURTHER READING

  • 彼得·L·伯杰和托马斯·勒克曼，《现实的社会建构：知识社会学论》。哈蒙兹沃思：企鹅出版社，1991年。
  • Peter L. Berger and Thomas Luckmann, The Social Construction of Reality: A Treatise in the Sociology of Knowledge. Harmondsworth: Penguin, 1991.
  • 赫伯特·施皮格伯格，《心理学和精神病学中的现象学》。伊利诺斯州埃文斯顿：西北大学出版社，1972年。
  • Herbert Spiegelberg, Phenomenology in Psychology and Psychiatry. Evanston, IL: Northwestern University Press, 1972.
  • 约瑟夫·J·科克曼斯（Joseph J. Kockelmans）（编辑），现象学心理学：荷兰学派。多德雷赫特：马蒂努斯·尼霍夫，1987 年。
  • Joseph J. Kockelmans (ed.), Phenomenological Psychology: The Dutch School. Dordrecht: Martinus Nijhoff, 1987.
  • Giovanni Stanghellini 等编，《牛津现象学精神病理学手册》 。牛津：牛津大学出版社，2019 年。
  • Giovanni Stanghellini et al. (eds.), The Oxford Handbook of Phenomenological Psychopathology. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2019.

11当前辩论定性研究与认知科学

11 CURRENT DEBATS IN QUALITATIVE RESEARCH AND THE COGNITIVE SCIENCES

DOI：10.4324/9781003350682-15

DOI: 10.4324/9781003350682-15

许多开创性的工作现象学的心理学、精神病学和社会学的发展发生在20世纪20年代和30年代。现在让我们回顾过去，探讨现象学作为一种定性研究方法的最新研究。

Much of the seminal work in phenomenological psychology, psychiatry, and sociology took place in the 1920s and 1930s. Let us now more forward in time and consider recent work on phenomenology as a qualitative research method.

定性研究

QUALITATIVE RESEARCH

定性研究方法广泛应用于社会学、心理学等学科，人类学旨在获得关于人们如何体验和理解自身及其所处社会世界的丰富而细致的描述。鉴于这样的目标，一些人认为现象学为如何开展定性研究提供了重要的指导方针也就不足为奇了。让我简要介绍并比较三个最受欢迎且最具影响力的提议，即1）阿梅代奥·乔治（Amedeo Giorgi）的描述性的现象学方法，2）乔纳森·史密斯的解释现象学分析（IPA），以及3）马克斯·范·马南的解释现象学。1这三者都广受欢迎，并经常被定性研究者引用和使用。正如我们将看到的，这三者在方法论建议和如何应用现象学方面有所不同。现象学定性研究是否应该保持纯粹的描述性和它应该试图揭示本质结构，还是应该关注个体的特殊性并进行阐释？它应该拥抱并部分采纳胡塞尔的哲学方法论，还是应该让各种现象学概念和区别来指导其研究？

Qualitative research methods are widely used in disciplines such as sociology, psychology, and anthropology to obtain rich and nuanced descriptions of how people experience and understand themselves and the social world they live in. Given such aims, it is not that surprising that some have taken phenomenology to offer important guidelines for how to conduct qualitative research. Let me briefly present and compare three of the most popular and influential proposals, namely 1) Amedeo Giorgi’s descriptive phenomenological method, 2) Jonathan Smith’s interpretative phenomenological analysis (IPA), and 3) Max van Manen’s hermeneutic phenomenology.1 All three enjoy wide popularity and are routinely referenced and used by qualitative researchers. As we shall see, all three differ in their methodological recommendations and in how they apply phenomenology. Should phenomenological qualitative research remain purely descriptive and seek to disclose essential structures, or should it rather focus on the particularity of individual persons and employ interpretation? Should it embrace and adopt part of Husserl’s philosophical methodology, or should it rather let its research be guided by various phenomenological concepts and distinctions?

1. 阿梅代奥·乔治（Amedeo Giorgi）的方法非常明确地体现了其胡塞尔式的取向和背景，乔治明确指出，他自己的现象学心理学是对胡塞尔最初发展的哲学方法的改编和修改。2乔治方法的首要目标是忠实地描述生活经验的本质结构。为了实现这一目标，他经常强调三个方法论步骤。第一个也是最重要的步骤涉及明确地运用现象学还原。正如乔治所坚持的那样，科学研究除非得到某种还原方法的支持，否则不能声称具有现象学地位。3更具体地说，乔治认为，研究人员必须假设

1. Amedeo Giorgi’s approach is very explicit about its Husserlian orientation and background, and Giorgi has specifically argued that his own phenomenological psychology involves an adaptation and modification of the philosophical method originally developed by Husserl.2 The overarching aim of Giorgi’s approach is to offer a faithful description of the essential structures of lived experience. To achieve this goal, three methodological steps are often highlighted. The first and most important one concerns the explicit use of the phenomenological reduction. As Giorgi insists, scientific research cannot claim phenomenological status unless it is supported by some use of the reduction.3 More specifically, Giorgi argues that it is essential that the researcher assumes the

现象学还原的态度，这意味着她必须抵制将任何呈现在她面前的客体或事态设定为存在。研究者仍然会思考她所给予的东西，但她将其视为某种存在于她意识中的东西，并且她避免承认它实际上就是它呈现给她的样子。4

attitude of the phenomenological reduction which means that she must resist from positing as existing whatever object or state of affairs is present to her. The researcher still considers what is given to her but she treats it as something that is present to her consciousness and she refrains from saying that it actually is the way it presents itself to her.4

简而言之，我们不应该假设自己所经历的或他人告知的事物确实存在或发生过，而应该仅仅将其视为既定事实，视为一种有待探索的存在。其次，现象学心理学必须是描述性的，而不是解释性的。5心理学家应该描述体验者是如何体验既定事实的，并且不应该对既定事实进行增减。6我们应该避免借助先前的理论预设来解释既定事实，而是要培养对实际存在事物的高度意识。最后，我们追求的知识应该是普遍而系统的。在仔细考察具体事例的基础上，我们应该努力提取不变的结构。因此，对乔治而言，现象学心理学的方法涉及三个步骤：1）现象学还原，2）描述性聚焦，3）寻找本质。7

In short, one should not assume that whatever one experiences or is being informed about by others actually does exist or did occur, rather one should simply focus on it as given, as a presence to be explored. Secondly, phenomenological psychology must be descriptive, rather than interpretative or explanatory.5 The psychologist should describe how the given is experienced by the experiencer, and this should be done without adding to or subtracting from what is given.6 One should avoid interpreting the given with the help of prior theoretical presuppositions, and instead cultivate a heightened awareness of what is actually present. Finally, the knowledge one should aim for should be general and systematic. On the basis of a careful examination of concrete examples, one should seek to extract invariant structures. For Giorgi, the method of phenomenological psychology consequently involves three steps: 1) the phenomenological reduction, 2) the descriptive focus, and 3) the search for essences.7

在更实用的指导方针方面，Giorgi 提倡研究人员在分析从参与者那里收集到的描述时应采用多步骤的程序。研究人员首先应该阅读整篇访谈记录，以了解其整体含义。在此阶段，不应进行任何分析。下一步是将描述分解成更小的意义单元。对于每一个意义单元，研究人员都应努力发现、阐明和阐释其心理价值和意义。最后一步，研究人员应综合不同的发现，以捕捉被研究体验的精髓。8乔治就访谈记录的分析提供了非常详细的说明，但对于访谈本身的进行方式却没有太多说明。不过，他确实指出，只要参与者是在讲述自己的体验，就应该让参与者畅所欲言。如果参与者开始走神，转而对体验进行理论化，访谈者应该温和地引导她回到描述上。9正如乔治所写，现象学研究者“并不关心具体的细节或内容是什么，只关心它们是否真正揭示了被研究的体验”。10在随后运用乔治方法的过程中，我们发现贝克解释说，应该要求接受采访的参与者描述他们的经历，并且只有当“描述的某些部分似乎缺乏清晰度或深度”时才应该使用后续问题。11此类陈述表明，采访者在这个过程中被赋予了某种被动的角色。

In terms of more practical guidelines, Giorgi has advocated a multi-step procedure that the researcher should use when analysing the descriptions she has collected from the participants. The researcher should first read the entire interview transcript in order to get a sense of its overall meaning. At this stage, no analysis should take place. The next step is to divide the description into smaller meaning units. For each of these meaning units, the researcher should then seek to discover, articulate, and explicate its psychological value and significance. In a final step, the researcher should synthesise the different findings in order to capture the essence of the experience under investigation.8 Whereas Giorgi provides very detailed instructions regarding the analysis of the transcribed interview, he has less to say about how the interview itself is to be conducted. He does note, however, that one should let the participant speak, as long as she is speaking about her experience. If she starts to drift away, and instead begins to theorise about the experience, the interviewer should gently steer the participant back to the description.9 As Giorgi writes, the phenomenological researcher “does not care what the specific details or contents are, only that they are genuinely revelatory of the experience being researched”.10 In a subsequent application of Giorgi’s method, we find Beck explaining that the interviewed participants should be asked to offer descriptions of their experiences, and that follow-up questions should only be used if “certain parts of the description seemed to be lacking clarity or depth”.11 Statements like these suggest that the interviewer is assigned a somewhat passive role in the process.

2. 近年来，史密斯的解释性现象学分析（IPA）在定性研究中越来越受欢迎。这种方法的重点是具体性，因为它试图理解特定事件和生活片段是如何被特定个体体验的。约翰身患严重精神疾病的生活是什么样的？乔治无家可归的经历是怎样的？安妮成为母亲后，她的自我认同感发生了怎样的变化？因此，IPA 并不关注本质结构，而是对具体案例进行细致的探索和微观分析。12此外，与乔治不同，史密斯主要借鉴的不是胡塞尔的现象学，而是更广泛的现象学作者。他没有诉诸现象学的还原，并且对以下观点表示质疑：现象学的心理学必须保持纯粹的描述性。史密斯认为，作为人类，我们始终都在进行着阐释性的意义建构活动。阐释是我们意向性生活的基本结构，因此，它不仅是可以允许的，而且是不可避免的。13

2. In recent years, Smith’s interpretative phenomenological analysis (IPA) has gained increasing popularity among qualitative researchers. The focus of this method is idiographic in that it seeks to understand how particular events and life episodes are experienced by particular individuals. What is it like for John to live with severe mental illness? How does George experience being homeless? How is Anne’s sense of her own identity changed as a result of becoming a mother? IPA is, consequently, not interested in essential structures, but in offering detailed explorations and microanalyses of concrete cases.12 Furthermore, unlike Giorgi, Smith is not primarily drawing on Husserlian phenomenology, but rather on a wider range of phenomenological authors. He makes no appeal to the phenomenological reduction and takes issue with the idea that a phenomenological psychology must remain purely descriptive. Smith holds that we, as human beings, are always already engaged in interpretative meaning-making activities. Interpretation is a basic structure of our intentional life and consequently not only permissible, but unavoidable.13

IPA 的方法显然是定性的。它不进行还原，并力求提供丰富的经验描述。但这足以确保其现象学的权威性吗？史密斯在其早期关于该主题的一篇文章中解释说，他选择“诠释性现象学分析”一词来指代自己的方法，因为他的目标是“探索参与者对世界的看法，并尽可能地采用‘内部人士的视角’来看待所研究的现象”。14史密斯还写道，IPA 是一种现象学方法

The approach of IPA is clearly qualitative. It is non-reductive and it seeks to provide rich experiential descriptions. But is that enough to secure its phenomenological credentials? In one of his early texts on the topic, Smith explains that he chose the term “interpretative phenomenological analysis” for his own approach, since his aim was to “explore the participant’s view of the world and to adopt, as far as is possible, an ‘insider’s perspective’ of the phenomenon under study”.14 Smith also writes that IPA is a phenomenological approach

它涉及对参与者生活世界的详细考察；它试图探索个人经历，关注个人对某个物体或事件的个人看法或描述，而不是试图对物体或事件本身做出客观的陈述。15

in that it involves detailed examination of the participant’s lifeworld; it attempts to explore personal experience and is concerned with an individual’s personal perception or account of an object or event, as opposed to an attempt to produce an objective statement of the object or event itself.15

然而，一个值得思考的问题是，仅仅考虑施事者/病人/客户的视角，是否就足以将该方法定性为现象学方法？基于现象学的定性研究与现象学哲学有着不同的目标，但如果前者与后者完全无关，它真的能被称为现象学方法吗？一本广受欢迎的IPA导论著作《解释现象学分析：理论、方法与研究》确实简要介绍了胡塞尔、海德格尔、梅洛-庞蒂和萨特的理论著作，但他们的著作在后续方法描述中究竟扮演了什么角色，目前仍不清楚。16

One question to ask, however, is whether it really is sufficient to simply consider the perspective of the agent/patient/client in order to qualify the approach as phenomenological? Phenomenologically informed qualitative research has different aims than phenomenological philosophy, but can the former really qualify as phenomenological if it doesn’t engage at all with the latter? One popular introduction to IPA, Interpretative Phenomenological Analysis: Theory, Method and Research, does contain brief descriptions of the theoretical work of Husserl, Heidegger, Merleau-Ponty, and Sartre, but it remains rather unclear what role their work actually plays in the subsequent description of the method.16

在《质性健康研究》杂志上，史密斯和范马南进行了一场激烈的辩论。范马南指责史密斯盗用“现象学”一词，将其用于自己的心理分析类型，17并认为史密斯的框架“在任何可接受的意义上都完全歪曲了现象学”。18史密斯在回复中表示警告不要对什么是现象学做过多的规定，并坚持认为没有任何一个人有权威来规定什么是或什么不是现象学。19这或许是对的，但简单地接受其反面并接受任何定义都是不明智的。IPA 通过这样给自己贴标签，显然是想强调其自身努力与现象学哲学传统之间的联系。然而，这种联系的意义并不明显，而且当 Giorgi 写道如果 IPA 被称为 IEA（解释性经验分析）会更好时，我们很难不同意他的观点。20

In a heated exchange between Smith and van Manen in Qualitative Health Research, van Manen accused Smith of hijacking the term “phenomenology” for his own type of psychological analysis,17 and argued that Smith’s framework was “hopelessly misrepresentative of phenomenology in any acceptable sense”.18 In his reply, Smith warned against being overly prescriptive about what counts as phenomenological and insisted that no single person has the authority to prescribe rules about what does or does not constitute phenomenology.19 This might be right, but it would be unwise to simply accept the flipside of this and embrace any definition. By labelling itself the way it does, IPA clearly wants to stress the link between its own endeavour and the tradition of phenomenological philosophy. It is not obvious, however, that that link amounts to very much, and it is hard to disagree with Giorgi when he writes that it would have been better if IPA had instead been termed IEA: Interpretative experiential analysis.20

3. 范·马南反复强调的一个观点是，定性研究者不应仅依赖二手文献，而必须回归本源，参考“现象学的原始文献、传统和运动”。21因此，与乔治一样，范·马南认为，对现象学感兴趣的定性研究者必须对其理论基础和含义有所了解。22基于自己对一系列古典和当代现象学哲学领域有影响力人物著作的研读，范·马南就（a）现象学研究的目的，以及（b）现象学研究的性质提出了一些具体主张。现象学方法。

3. A recurrent claim of van Manen is that qualitative researchers should not make do with secondary literature, but must return to the origin and consult “the primary literature, tradition, and movements of phenomenology”.21 Like Giorgi, van Manen consequently argues that qualitative researchers interested in phenomenology must have some knowledge of its theoretical underpinnings and implications.22 Based on his own engagement with the writings of a whole range of influential figures in classical and contemporary phenomenological philosophy, van Manen has made some specific claims concerning (a) the aim of a phenomenological investigation and (b) the nature of the phenomenological method.

就其目的而言，范·马南认为现象学是对经验的活生生的意义的研究。事实上，范·马南认为现象学的基本问题是“那种体验是什么样的？” 23，他提到了诸如“喝咖啡是什么感觉？”和“分享从桥上看水的体验是什么感觉？” 24 等问题作为现象学核心问题的例子。范·马南还声称现象学是“对……的洞察追求”生活经验的现象性” 25，胡塞尔的现象学并不关注外部对象，而只关注我们对该对象的经验26 ，显然，他明显偏离了我在前几章中提出的现象学论述。如前所述，现象学的重点在于心灵与世界的交汇，两者无法孤立地理解。更具体地说，对感知经验或恐惧体验也必须探究其意向关联，即被感知或恐惧的对象。认为只有前者才属于现象学的范畴，是对胡塞尔研究方向的误解。

When it comes to the aim, van Manen claims that phenomenology is the study of the lived meaning of experience. Indeed, van Manen claims that the basic phenomenological question is the question of “What is that experience like?”,23 and he mentions questions such as “What is it like to sip coffee?” and “What is it like to share the experience of looking at water from a bridge?”24 as examples of core phenomenological questions. When van Manen also claims that phenomenology is the “pursuit of insight into the phenomenality of lived experience”25 and that Husserlian phenomenology is not concerned with the external object, but only with our experience of that object,26 it should be clear that he is departing markedly from the account of phenomenology I have offered in previous chapters. As already mentioned, the focus of phenomenology is on the intersection between mind and world, neither of which can be understood in separation from each other. To speak more concretely, a phenomenological investigation of a perceptual experience or an experience of fear must also investigate the intentional correlate, the perceived or feared object. To suggest that only the former is within the purview of phenomenology is to misunderstand Husserl’s project.

归根结底，范梅南并没有赋予我们现象学的本意，而是在无意中传播了一种在分析心灵哲学中也能找到的现象学理解。在分析心灵哲学领域，目前人们普遍认识到，对意识的恰当解释必须包含并处理现象学，但“现象学”一词经常被简单地用作“现象性”的同义词，即经验的定性特征的标签。因此，在这种语境下讨论现象学，实际上是在讨论经验的某个维度，充其量只是以第一人称的方式描述经验的“本来面目”。然而，这种谈论现象学的方式与将现象学理解为一项独特的哲学课题几乎没有关系。

Ultimately, van Manen is not giving us the original sense of phenomenology but unwittingly propagating an understanding of phenomenology that can also be found in analytic philosophy of mind. In the latter field, there is currently a widespread recognition of the fact that a proper account of consciousness must include and address phenomenology, but the term “phenomenology” is frequently simply used as a synonym for “phenomenality”, that is, as a label for the qualitative character of experience. To discuss phenomenology in that context is consequently to discuss a certain dimension of experience and at best to offer first-person descriptions of what the “what it is like” of experience is really like. This way of talking about phenomenology has, however, little to do with phenomenology understood as a distinct philosophical project.

那么方法又如何呢？范·马南偶尔会坚持认为“现象学的方法就是没有方法”，但他也曾声称，现象学是一种为“当代人文科学研究实践”提供方法论基础的传统。27他还谈到，如果要揭示“人类经验的现象学意义”，就需要运用现象学分析的基本方法，即“回溯法和还原法” 。28

What about the method? While occasionally insisting that “the method of phenomenology is that there is no method”, van Manen has also claimed that phenomenology is a tradition that provides “a methodological ground for present human science research practices”27 and spoken of the need to employ the basic method of phenomenological analysis, namely “the epoché and the reduction”, if one is to disclose “the phenomenological meaning of a human experience”.28

我们在范马南广受好评的《实践现象学》一书中也发现了类似的方法论建议，他在书中也相当合理地强调了不要以过于技术性的方式呈现现象学项目和方法论的重要性。事实上，这本书的核心目标是让“那些本身不是专业哲学家或不具备相关现象学哲学文献广泛深入背景的研究者能够理解和掌握现象学哲学”。29然而，在专门讨论哲学现象学方法的章节中，范马南不仅提到了回溯和还原，还向读者介绍了启发式还原、解释学还原、经验还原、方法论还原、本质还原、本体论还原、伦理还原、彻底还原和本源还原。30这既不是对哲学现象学的非技术性且易于理解的呈现，也不是牢固地扎根于原文并基于原文，因为其中的许多术语都是范马南自己的发明。*

We find similar methodological recommendations in van Manen’s acclaimed book Phenomenology of Practice, where he also quite reasonably stresses the importance of not presenting the project and methodology of phenomenology in an overly technical manner. Indeed, a central aim of the book has been to make “phenomenological philosophy accessible and do-able by researchers who are not themselves professional philosophers or who do not possess an extensive and in-depth background in the relevant phenomenological philosophical literature”.29 In the chapter specifically discussing the method of philosophical phenomenology, however, van Manen doesn’t merely refer to the epoché and the reduction, but introduces the reader to the heuristic reduction, the hermeneutic reduction, the experiential reduction, the methodological reduction, the eidetic reduction, the ontological reduction, the ethical reduction, the radical reduction, and the originary reduction.30 This is neither a non-technical and easily accessible presentation of philosophical phenomenology, nor is it solidly rooted in and based on the original texts, since many of the terms are van Manen’s own inventions. *

乔治、史密斯和范·马南的方法影响深远，但它们真的值得效仿吗？批评的声音时不时地对这些方法在方法论上的严谨性表示质疑。约翰·佩利就是一位坚持不懈的批评者，多年来他一直试图说服定性研究人员，如果他们正在寻找哲学灵感或方法论指导，就不应该求助于现象学。31

The approaches of Giorgi, Smith, and van Manen have been tremendously influential, but are they exemplary? From time to time, critical voices have expressed reservations about the methodological rigour of these approaches. One persistent critic is John Paley, who for years has attempted to convince qualitative researchers that they shouldn’t look to phenomenology if they are on the lookout for philosophical inspiration or methodological guidance.31

在他最全面的讨论中， 《现象学》一书在《质性研究》中，Paley 认为，对现象学作为一种质性研究方法的批判性评估应该完全不涉及现象学哲学，因为后者的“回旋”只能“分散注意力”。32事实上，在他看来，胡塞尔“几乎可以故意含糊其辞”。33这很难说是一个有希望的设定，Paley 最终得出的结论相当不利也就不足为奇了。在对 Giorgi、Smith 和 van Manen 进行了广泛的讨论之后，Paley 声称这三个人都未能对他们使用的核心概念提供清晰的定义，他们的方法缺乏方法论的严谨性，采用了任意的程序，并且完全渗透了个人特质。34 Paley的作品随后因揭露“皇帝的赤身裸体并将他推到聚光灯下供所有人观看”而受到称赞。35它甚至导致一些人提出这样的问题：“是否存在Paley之后的护理现象学？》36

In his most comprehensive discussion, the book Phenomenology as Qualitative Research, Paley argues that a critical assessment of phenomenology as a qualitative research method should be conducted without engaging at all with phenomenological philosophy, since the “convolutions” of the latter “can only be a distraction”.32 Indeed, on his account, Husserl “can be almost wilfully obscure”.33 This is hardly a promising setup, and it shouldn’t surprise that the conclusion Paley eventually reaches is quite unfavourable. After an extensive discussion of Giorgi, Smith, and van Manen, Paley claims that all three fail to provide clear definitions of the central concepts they use and that their approaches lack methodological rigour, employ arbitrary procedures, and are thoroughly permeated by personal idiosyncrasies.34 Paley’s work has subsequently been applauded for having revealed the “emperor’s lack of clothing and pushed him into the spotlight for all to see”.35 It has even led some to ask the question, “Is there nursing phenomenology after Paley?”36

在此，我们若要对佩利颇为尖锐的批评进行更全面的评估，那就跑题了，37但值得注意的是，他仍然专注于批评乔治、史密斯和范·马南，以至于完全忽视了其他方法和资源的存在。近年来，不仅有人努力探索在定性研究中采用和应用现象学思想的新方法，38而且这些努力也部分受到了一种平行发展的启发，这种发展在近几十年来一直存在。三十年来，我们一直致力于将现象学的思想应用于认知科学。

It would lead us too far afield to offer a more comprehensive assessment of Paley’s rather uncharitable criticism here,37 but it is noteworthy that he remains so focused on criticising Giorgi, Smith, and van Manen that he completely overlooks the existence of other approaches and resources. Not only have there in recent years been efforts to develop new ways of adopting and applying phenomenological ideas in qualitative research,38 but these efforts have also partially been inspired by a parallel development that for more than three decades has sought to apply ideas from phenomenology in the domain of the cognitive sciences.

认知科学

THE COGNITIVE SCIENCES

现象学分析与意识实证研究之间是否有可能弥合差距？尽管这个问题自20世纪初就已引发讨论，但毫无疑问，智利神经科学家弗朗西斯科·瓦雷拉（Francisco Varela，1946-2001）的研究重新点燃了人们对这个问题的兴趣。

Is it possible to bridge the gap between phenomenological analyses and empirical work on consciousness? Although the question has been discussed since the beginning of the 20th century, there is no doubt that the work of the Chilean neuroscientist Francisco Varela (1946–2001) rekindled interest in the question.

在 20 世纪 90 年代的许多出版物中，瓦雷拉概述了一种新的认知方法神经科学认为，从现象学的角度对生活经验进行的分析所得的数据与认知神经科学中基于实验的描述具有同等地位，且相互制约。39正如瓦雷拉所指出的，如果认知科学要实现其目标，即提供一个真正科学的意识理论，就不能也不应该忽视经验维度，因为这样一来，它们就会忽视被解释项的一个关键部分。换句话说，如果我们的目标是全面理解心灵，那么仅仅关注经验背后的亚个人事件的性质，而不考虑经验本身的特质和结构，就不会让我们走得太远。更具体地说，瓦雷拉认为，主观维度本质上是可以接受主体间验证的，只要我们利用一种方法和程序来这样做。他认为古典哲学现象学已经提供了这样一种方法，并认为认知科学家实际上学会使用胡塞尔和梅洛-庞蒂开发的一些方法论工具对于认知科学的未来发展至关重要。40

In a number of publications up through the 1990s, Varela outlined a novel approach in cognitive neuroscience, one which considered the data from phenomenologically disciplined analyses of lived experience and the experimentally based accounts found in cognitive neuroscience to have equal status and to be linked by mutual constraints.39 As Varela pointed out, if the cognitive sciences are to accomplish their goal, namely to provide a truly scientific theory of consciousness, they cannot and must not ignore the experiential dimension, since they would thereby be disregarding a crucial part of the explanandum. To put it differently, if our aim is to obtain a comprehensive understanding of the mind, then focusing narrowly on the nature of the subpersonal events that underlie experience without considering the qualities and structures of the experience itself will just not take us very far. More specifically, Varela argued that the subjective dimension is intrinsically open to intersubjective validation, if only we avail ourselves of a method and procedure for doing so. He thought classical philosophical phenomenology had provided such a method and considered it crucial for the future development of the cognitive sciences that cognitive scientists actually learned to use some of the methodological tools that had been developed by Husserl and Merleau-Ponty.40

梅洛-庞蒂的启发尤为明显。早在1942年出版的首部著作《行为结构》中，我们就发现梅洛-庞蒂探讨了弗洛伊德、巴甫洛夫、科夫卡、沃森、瓦隆和皮亚杰等心理学家的研究成果。该书最后一部分的标题是“难道在自然主义？”这种对经验研究的兴趣，以及它对现象学的重要性，在梅洛的许多著作中仍然很突出。庞蒂的后期作品。他引用并运用神经病理学（盖尔布和戈尔茨坦对脑损伤患者施耐德的分析）在《知觉现象学》中的应用尤为引人注目。在1949年至1952年期间，梅洛-庞蒂甚至教授了发展性索邦大学的心理学。自始至终，梅洛-庞蒂并没有将现象学与经验科学之间的关系视为如何简单应用已有现象学洞见的问题。梅洛-庞蒂的观点是，双方都能从对话与交流中获益，并共同繁荣。

The inspiration from Merleau-Ponty is particularly evident. Already in his first published work The Structure of Behavior from 1942, we find Merleau-Ponty engaging with the work of psychologists such as Freud, Pavlov, Koffka, Watson, Wallon, and Piaget. The last section of the book carries the heading “Is there not a truth in naturalism?” This interest in empirical research, in its importance for phenomenology, remained prominent in many of MerleauPonty’s later works. His reference to and use of neuropathology (Gelb and Goldstein’s analysis of the brain-damaged patient Schneider) in Phenomenology of Perception is particularly striking. For some years, in the period 1949–1952, Merleau-Ponty even taught developmental psychology at Sorbonne. Throughout, Merleau-Ponty didn’t conceive of the relation between phenomenology and empirical science as a question of how to simply apply already obtained phenomenological insights. Merleau-Ponty’s view was rather that both sides could profit from and flourish as a result of their dialogue and exchange.

瓦雷拉称梅洛-庞蒂很早就“主张直接生活经验的现象学、心理学和神经生理学之间的相互启发”，41瓦雷拉的一个更具体的建议是，应该将现象学的研究形式纳入到意识神经科学研究的实验方案中。应该训练参与的受试者抛开先入为主的观念和理论，教他们将注意力集中在体验本身上，以便将通常被忽视的意识维度和方面带入焦点。随后，应该要求他们使用开放式问题的形式仔细描述这些体验。随后可以对随后的描述进行主体间验证，然后用于分析和解释相关的神经生理过程。42

Heralding Merleau-Ponty as someone who already early on “argued for the mutual illumination among a phenomenology of direct lived experience, psychology and neurophysiology”,41 one of Varela’s more specific proposals was that one should incorporate phenomenological forms of investigation into the experimental protocols of neuroscientific research on consciousness. One should train the participating subjects to set aside their preconceived ideas and theories and teach them to focus their attention on the experience itself in order to bring into focus dimensions and aspects of consciousness that normally remain unnoticed. Subsequently, one should then ask them to provide careful descriptions of these experiences using an open-question format. The ensuing descriptions could subsequently be validated intersubjectively, and then be used in the analysis and interpretation of the correlated neurophysiological processes.42

瓦雷拉在该领域的最初出版物引发了关于现象学和认知科学之间关系的激烈争论，更普遍地说，是关于现象学是否能够而且应该被自然化的争论。43毫不奇怪，一个争议问题是，这种自然化究竟意味着什么。

Varela’s initial publications in this area generated an intense debate about the relation between phenomenology and the cognitive sciences, and more generally about whether phenomenology could and ought to be naturalised.43 Not surprisingly, one issue of controversy was the question of what precisely such a naturalisation might imply.

答案可以在瓦雷拉1999年参与编辑的里程碑著作《自然化现象学》的长篇导言中找到。在导言中，四位编辑认为，最终目标必须是对意识的自然解释，即一种只诉诸自然科学所承认的实体和属性的解释，而这需要将现象学纳入自然科学的解释框架。44 根据这一提议，将现象学自然化意味着将现象学变成自然科学的一部分，或至少是自然科学的延伸。然而，与此同时，编辑们也谈到了重塑自然概念本身的必要性，以及客观性，并声称有必要摒弃这样一种观点，即科学的客观性是以对独立于观察者的现实的承诺为前提的。45

One answer can be found in the long introduction to the milestone work Naturalizing Phenomenology from 1999, which Varela co-edited. In the introduction, the four editors argued that the ultimate goal must be a natural explanation of consciousness, i.e., an explanation that only appeals to entities and properties admitted by the natural sciences, and that this will require phenomenology to be integrated into the explanatory framework of natural science.44 According to this proposal, to naturalise phenomenology entails making phenomenology into a part of, or at least an extension of, natural science. At the same time, however, the editors also spoke of the need for recasting the very notion of nature and objectivity and claimed that it was necessary to dispense with the idea that scientific objectivity presupposes a commitment to an observer-independent reality.45

另一种截然不同的主张认为，现象学自然化仅仅意味着让现象学从经验研究中汲取养分并参与其中。这种参与应该采取何种形式？在一篇2000年题为“桥接”的文章中在《具身认知与脑功能：现象学的作用》一书中，Borrett、Kelly 和 Kwan 论述如下：

According to a rather different proposal, to naturalise phenomenology simply means to let phenomenology be informed by and engage with empirical research. What form should this engagement take? In an article from 2000 entitled “Bridging embodied cognition and brain function: The role of phenomenology”, Borrett, Kelly, and Kwan argued as follows:

现象学与脑科学之间的正确关系在于数据与模型的关系：脑科学最终关注的是解释大脑的物理过程如何共同产生人类经验现象；只要现象学致力于对这些现象的准确描述，它就能提供最完整、最准确的数据呈现，而这些数据最终必须由大脑功能模型来解释……。因此，对人类行为某一方面的现象学解释旨在提供对该行为特征的描述，任何物理解释都必须能够重现这些特征。46

[T]he right relation between phenomenology and brain science is that of data to model: brain science is ultimately concerned with explaining the way the physical processes of the brain conspire to produce the phenomena of human experience; insofar as phenomenology devotes itself to the accurate description of these phenomena, it provides the most complete and accurate presentation of the data that ultimately must be accounted for by models of brain function [. . .]. Thus, the phenomenological account of a given aspect of human behavior is meant to provide a description of the characteristics of that behavior which any physical explanation of it must be able to reproduce.46

然而，这种说法过于谦虚。现象学确实对感知、想象、身体意识、回忆、社会认知、自我体验等进行了细致的分析。时间性等等，并且在提供此类分析时，现象学所能做的不仅仅是为现有模型提供数据，所能提供的不仅仅是对已建立的被解释项进行精细化的描述。现象学不仅仅是进行描述。它还提供自身的理论阐释，这些阐释可以挑战现有模型和背景假设，有时甚至可能导致发现截然不同的被解释项。然而，与此同时，就现象学研究可供实证研究的现象而言，它应该以现有的最佳科学知识为指导，在某些情况下，实证研究结果可能

This suggestion is far too modest, however. Phenomenology does offer detailed analyses of perception, imagination, body-awareness, recollection, social cognition, self-experience, temporality, etc., and in providing such analyses, phenomenology can do more than merely supply data to existing models, can provide more than refined descriptions of an already established explanandum. Phenomenology is not merely in the descriptive business. It also offers theoretical accounts of its own that can challenge existing models and background assumptions, and which might occasionally lead to the discovery of quite different explananda. At the same time, however, insofar as phenomenology studies phenomena that are open to empirical investigation, it ought to be informed by the best available scientific knowledge, and in some cases empirical findings might

挑战了经典的现象学分析，并由此导致了对它们的修正或细化。现象学的口号是“回归”“回归事物本身”要求我们以经验指导理论。我们应该关注现实如何通过经验得以体现。经验研究者或许不太关注深奥的哲学问题，但作为经验研究者，他们实际上非常关注具体现象，因此可能不像一般的空谈哲学家那样容易低估现象的丰富性、复杂性和多样性。

challenge the classical phenomenological analyses and thereby also lead to a revision or refinement of them. The phenomenological slogan “Back to the things themselves” calls for us to let our experience guide our theories. We should pay attention to the way in which reality is experientially manifest. Empirical researchers might not pay much attention to deep philosophical questions, but as empirical researchers they do in fact pay quite a lot of attention to concrete phenomena and might consequently be less apt than the average armchair philosopher to underestimate the richness, complexity, and variety of the phenomena.

让我提供一些具体的例子来说明在最好的情况下可以称为互相启发。

Let me offer some concrete examples that can illustrate what in the best instance might be called relations of mutual enlightenment.

  1. 在第七章中，我介绍了具身化现象学分析的各个方面。我们看到现象学家如何以不同的方式强调前反思身体意识的关键性。近期关于神经病理学对这种隐性身体意识的各种障碍提供了丰富的描述，这些障碍随后被受现象学影响的研究人员所采用和讨论。例如，乔纳森·科尔对伊恩·沃特曼的细致分析，沃特曼在19岁时因病失去了所有的触觉和颈部以下的本体感觉。47沃特曼在疾病发作后不久，尝试移动肢体或整个身体时，他可以主动发起动作，但无法控制移动部位最终的位置。如果他伸手去拿东西，双手会失手或过度伸展，除非他一直盯着自己的双手，否则它们会开始“游走”，他只能通过视觉来重新定位它们。经过一段极其艰难的学习过程，他才得以重新获得对动作的部分控制。但他对身体的意识发生了转变。他之前对身体运动的前反射性意识不再有效，取而代之的是反射性的身体意识。每一个动作都需要高度的精神集中和视觉监控。即使坐在椅子上而不摔倒也需要持续的注意力。站立时，沃特曼也很容易因为闭上眼睛、灯熄灭或打喷嚏而摔倒。随着时间的推移，沃特曼走路越来越熟练，这并不是因为不再需要注意力，而是因为经过不断的练习，刻意控制变得不再那么费力。48一方面，这个案例研究表明了我们的行动能力对前反思身体意识的依赖程度，以及后者的损害是多么令人难以承受。从这个意义上讲，这个案例可以很好地说明一些现象学区别和分析的实证意义。然而，另一方面，沃特曼的案例也可能迫使我们重新审视一些经典的现象学解释。尽管沃特曼几乎完全缺乏本体感觉，但他在某种程度上能够重新控制和重新利用自己的身体。这不仅表明我们可能比假设的更有韧性，也表明存在经典现象学家可能没有预见到的补偿策略。
  2. In Chapter 7, I presented various facets of the phenomenological analyses of embodiment. We saw how phenomenologists in different ways highlighted the crucial importance of pre-reflective body-awareness. Recent literature on neuropathology offers rich descriptions of various disorders of this tacit body-awareness, which have subsequently been taken up and discussed by researchers influenced by phenomenology. Consider, for example, Jonathan Cole’s careful analysis of Ian Waterman, who at the age of 19, due to illness, lost all sense of touch and proprioception from the neck down.47 When Waterman shortly after the onset of his disorder, tried to move a limb or his entire body, he could initiate the movement, but had no control over where the moving part ended up. If he reached for something, the hands would miss or overshoot wildly, and unless he kept an eye on his hands, they would start to “wander”, and he would only be able to relocate them by means of vision. It was only after an intensely difficult learning process that he was able to regain some control over his movements. But his awareness of his body was transformed. His previous pre-reflective awareness of bodily movements was no longer operative and available and had been replaced by a reflective body-awareness. Every single movement required intense mental concentration and visual monitoring. Even to sit in a chair without falling out of it required constant attention. When standing, Waterman could also easily fall over if he closed his eyes, if the light went out, or if he sneezed. Over time, Waterman became more adept at walking, not because attention was no longer required, but because the deliberate control became less taxing as a result of constant practice.48 On the one hand, this case study demonstrates how dependent our ability to act is on our pre-reflective body-awareness, and how dramatically disabling an impairment of the latter is. To that extent, the case might serve as a good illustration of the empirical relevance of some of the phenomenological distinctions and analyses. On the other hand, however, the case of Waterman might also force us to revisit some of the classical phenomenological accounts. Despite his almost complete lack of proprioception, Waterman was to some extent able to regain control over and re-appropriate his body. This suggests not only that we might be more resilient than assumed, but also that compensatory strategies are available that the classical phenomenologists might not have foreseen.
  3. 第二个例子来自发展领域心理学。在第八章中，我们看到现象学家如何批评人际理解的核心是一个理论驱动的推理过程的观点，以及他们如何倾向于用具身感知的方法来处理主体间性。他们对后者的解释得到了许多发展心理学家的证实和完善，他们研究了在社会理解中发现的基本但原始的形式。婴幼儿。49虽然我们在成年生活中经常将心理状态推断性地归因于他人，但这种归因不能被视为婴儿身上所具有的顺畅而直接的人际互动（通常称为初级主体间性）的基础。50婴儿从很小的时候就能区分生物和非生物物体，并区分生物运动和非生物运动。在一篇调查和总结婴儿社会认知发展研究的文章中，Rochat 和 Striano 得出结论，婴儿对社会刺激表现出本质上是天生的敏感性，从大约两个月大开始就存在一种早期的主体间性，婴儿有一种与他人共同经历和互惠的感觉，51并且“情感、感觉和行为的共鸣”情绪发生在婴儿和照顾者之间的互动中”是“发展更高级社会认知，包括心理理论的必要元素”。52两到三个月大的婴儿已经能够通过微笑和发声与他人进行“原始对话”，并能展示出改变说话时间和强度的能力。与伴侣的沟通。事实上，婴儿似乎期望人们在面对面的互动中与他们进行互动，并会积极地维持和调节这种互动。发展心理学的研究成果不仅可以证实现象学研究中关于共情等的核心主张，53还能对一系列特定的社会现象提供更为详细的描述。最后，它们可以挑战现象学家的一些主张。例如，梅洛-庞蒂基于他那个时代的实证研究，认为不存在自我与他人的分化婴儿出生后才开始感知他人，大约六个月大的时候才开始。54随后的实证研究对这些说法提出了质疑。55
  4. The second example comes from the domain of developmental psychology. In Chapter 8, we saw how phenomenologists have criticised the suggestion that interpersonal understanding is at its core a theory-driven inferential process, and how they instead favoured an embodied perceptual approach to the problem of intersubjectivity. Their account of the latter has been corroborated and refined by a number of developmental psychologists, who have investigated fundamental but primitive forms of social understanding found in infants and young children.49 Whereas we, in adult life, regularly make inferential attributions of mental states to other people, such attributions cannot be considered the basis of the smooth and immediate interpersonal interaction – often called primary intersubjectivity – found in young infants.50 From very early on, infants are able to discriminate animate and inanimate objects and distinguish biological movement from non-biological movement. In an article surveying and summarising research on socio-cognitive development in infancy, Rochat and Striano concluded that infants manifest an essentially innate sensitivity to social stimuli, that there is an early form of intersubjectivity at play from around two months of age, where the infant has a sense of shared experience and reciprocity with others,51 and that the “echoing of affects, feelings and emotions that takes place in reciprocal interaction between young infants and their caretakers” is a “necessary element to the development of more advanced social cognition, including theory of mind”.52 Two- to three-month-old infants will already engage in “proto-conversations” with other people by smiling and vocalising, and will demonstrate a capacity to vary the timing and intensity of communication with their partners. In fact, infants seem to expect people to communicate reciprocally with them in face-to-face interactions and will work actively to sustain and regulate the interaction. Findings in developmental psychology can not only corroborate central claims found in phenomenological work on, say, empathy,53 they also offer far more detailed descriptions of a range of specific social phenomena. Finally, they can challenge some of the claims made by phenomenologists. Drawing on the empirical research of his time, Merleau-Ponty, for instance, argued that there is no self–other differentiation at birth and that infants only start to perceive others at around six months of age.54 These are claims that subsequent empirical research has called into question.55
  5. 作为最后一个例子，让我们考虑一下精神病理学。现象学精神病学并未随着闵可夫斯基的终结而终结，而是持续蓬勃发展，目前以约瑟夫·帕纳斯、路易斯·萨斯和托马斯·福克斯等人物为代表。所有这些作者都受到了关于自我和自我体验的现象学研究的启发，尤其是这种观点：体验因其主观性或第一人称特征而必然包含一种基本形式的“我”性。56有人认为精神分裂症涉及这种最基本的自我意识的转变和改变，而此类自我障碍可能被赋予生成性和致病性的作用。它们先于、构成并塑造了后期精神病理学的出现，并可能因此将那些从纯粹描述性精神病学角度来看看似毫不相关甚至截然相反的综合征和症状统一起来。57同时，这项关于异常自我体验和异化形式的实证研究自我意识不仅使我们能够进一步完善对自我的现象学理解，58而且也被应用于临床实践。
  6. As a final example, let us consider the case of psychopathology. The tradition of phenomenological psychiatry did not end with Minkowski, but has continued to flourish and is currently represented by figures like Josef Parnas, Louis Sass, and Thomas Fuchs. All of these authors have been inspired by phenomenological work on self and self-experience, especially the idea that experience by virtue of its subjective or first-personal character necessarily involves a fundamental form of for-me-ness.56 It has been argued that schizophrenia involves transformations and alterations of this very basic sense of self and that such self-disorders may be ascribed a generating, pathogenic role. They antecede, underlie, and shape the emergence of later and psychotic pathology and may thus unify what, from a purely descriptive psychiatric standpoint, may seem to be unrelated or even antithetical syndromes and symptoms.57 At the same time, this empirical work on anomalous self-experience and alienated forms of self-consciousness has not only allowed for further refinements of the phenomenological understanding of selfhood,58 but has also been taken up in clinical practice.

这一发展的一个里程碑事件是 2005 年发布的定性半结构化心理测量清单，其中包含 57 个不同的项目，称为EASE（异常自我体验检查）。该清单汲取了多年临床工作的经验，并受到哲学现象学思想的启发和指导，旨在系统地探索和评估主观体验的细微紊乱。59后续结果表明，异常主观体验，尤其是自我紊乱和困惑，是重要的预后指标，有助于识别罹患精神分裂症高风险人群。60

EASE 强调的一个问题涉及现象学访谈。这样的访谈该如何进行？正如我们已经看到的，定性研究人员偶尔会维护的一个观点是，必须非常小心，不要提出任何引导性问题。如果目的是了解特定事件和生活片段是如何被研究对象体验的，那么重要的是允许受访者表达自己的经历，而不要受到访谈者研究议程的过度影响或限制。这就是为什么伍德甚至建议“在真正的现象学研究中，通常只提出一个问题来引出数据”。61通常情况下，开场问题会相当宽泛且不具指导性，只是一个鼓励受访者开始描述其经历的问题。然而，这种方法面临着一个相当明显的问题。如果被要求提供丰富描述（例如，与精神分裂症或糖尿病共存的生活感受）的受访者只能提供非常粗略和肤浅的描述，该怎么办？

EASE 体现了一种截然不同的方法。它并非简单地假设受访者能够从一开始就提供丰富的描述，而访谈者的任务仅仅是记录所有被访者所说的内容，而是旨在与受访者合作，共同创造知识。简而言之，访谈者的任务是进行一种苏格拉底式的助产术，帮助受访者获得他或她自己的新见解。为了实现这种合作，访谈者 1）必须采取开放和同理心的态度，以便与受访者建立基本的信任，2）必须不断地自我批评，评估他或她自己的先入之见和偏见，3）必须主动与受访者接触，以引出相关详细的描述。62精神科医生使用 EASE 手册提供的清单，与参与者进行探索性接触，并进行半结构化访谈，以引出有关被认为特别相关的各个领域的描述。例如，这可能包括身体、时间和社会维度，这些维度的重要性已被现象学哲学家精确强调。虽然我们当然应该准备好根据患者的诉求修改自己的理论假设，但进行访谈的方法论前提绝不是要求我们首先摒弃先入为主的观念。相反，访谈的重点在于根据源自现象学理论的具体思想和概念进行。因此，这种方法的现象学特征不仅仅在于它旨在从患者那里获取第一人称的陈述。它还在于运用一个全面的理论框架，该框架涵盖了主体与自身、与世界以及与他人的关系结构，使我们能够提出正确的问题。

值得注意的是，接受EASE访谈的患者常常会感到如释重负，因为他们意识到访谈者了解他们的经历，并且其他人也经历过类似的经历。这本身就能减轻这些经历带来的恐惧和困扰。因此，被倾听和认真对待本身就具有治疗价值，而接受治疗多年的患者常常会疑惑，为什么以前从来没有人问过他们这样的问题。

A milestone event in this development was the publication in 2005 of a qualitative semi-structured psychometric checklist containing 57 different items called EASE (Examination of Anomalous Self-Experience). The checklist, which drew on many years of clinical work and was inspired and informed by ideas found in philosophical phenomenology, was precisely designed to support a systematic exploration and assessment of subtle disturbances of subjective experiences.59 Subsequent results indicate that the presence of anomalous subjective experiences, in particular self-disorders and perplexity, are important prognostic indicators and can help to identify those with a high risk of developing schizo-phrenia.60

One issue highlighted by EASE concerns the nature of the phenomenological interview. How are such interviews to be conducted? As we have already seen, one idea occasionally defended by qualitative researchers is that one has to be very careful in not asking any guiding questions. If the aim is to understand how particular events and life episodes are experienced by the individuals in question, it is important to allow the interviewees to express themselves about their own experience without being unduly influenced or constrained by the interviewer’s research agenda. This is why Wood, for instance, even suggests that “in true phenomenological research only one question is usually asked to elicit data”.61 Typically, the opening question will be quite broad and non-directive, and simply be a question that encourages the interviewee to start describing his or her experiences. However, such an approach is confronted with a fairly obvious problem. What if the participants who are being interviewed and who are requested to provide rich descriptions of, say, what it is like to live with schizophrenia or diabetes, are only able to offer very coarse and superficial descriptions?

EASE exemplifies a very different approach. Rather than simply assuming that the interviewee is able to come up with rich descriptions from the outset and that the task of the interviewer is merely to register everything being said, the idea is rather to engage collaboratively with the interviewee in order to co-generate knowledge. In short, the task of the interviewer is to engage in a kind of Socratic midwifery and help the interviewee obtain new insights of his or her own. To allow for this collaboration, the interviewer 1) must adopt an open-minded and empathic attitude in order to establish basic trust with the interviewee, 2) must engage in a continuous self-critical assessment of his or her own preconceptions and biases, and, 3) must engage proactively with the interviewee in order to elicit relevantly detailed descriptions.62 Using the checklist provided by the EASE manual, the psychiatrists engage exploratively with the participants and conduct semi-structured interviews in order to elicit descriptions regarding various domains that are considered to be of particular relevance. This might, for instance, include bodily, temporal, and social dimensions, i.e., dimensions the significance of which have precisely been highlighted by phenomenological philosophers. Although one should of course be prepared to revise one’s theoretical assumptions in the face of what the patient is saying, a methodological prerequisite for doing the interview is by no means that one initially strips one’s own mind of preconceived ideas. On the contrary, it is all about conducting the interview in light of quite specific ideas and notions that derive from phenomenological theory. The phenomenological character of this approach is consequently not simply to be found in its interest in eliciting first-person reports from the patients. It is very much about also employing a comprehensive theoretical framework concerning the structure of the subject’s relation to itself, to the world, and to others that will allow one to ask the right kind of questions.

It is noteworthy that patients interviewed on the basis of EASE often express feelings of relief when realizing that the interviewer is familiar with the nature of their experiences and that others suffer from similar experiences. This in itself can make the experiences less frightening and disturbing. The very fact of being listened to and taken seriously consequently has therapeutic value, and often patients who have been in treatment for years wonder why nobody has ever asked them these types of questions before.

在许多主流认知科学的倡导者看来，将现象学的思想应用于心智实证研究的尝试仍然存在争议。尽管许多人现在可能准备承认，对意识的科学研究也应该考虑并处理事物的经验层面——因此，非技术性的现象学概念可能具有相关性——大多数人会拒绝接受或采纳古典哲学现象学中任何更具体的方法论程序或理论假设。然而，瓦雷拉、汤普森、加拉格尔等人的研究引发了一场激烈而持续的争论。这场争论促成了《现象学与认知科学》期刊的创刊，并被证明对其他相关领域的持续发展产生了影响，包括对认知现象学的研究。具身认知和意义建构。

The attempt to employ ideas from phenomenology in the empirical study of the mind remains controversial in the eyes of many advocates of mainstream cognitive science. Although many might now be prepared to concede that a scientific investigation of consciousness should also consider and address the experiential side of matters – and that a non-technical sense of phenomenology might, consequently, be relevant – the majority would resist the suggestion that they ought to accept or embrace any of the more specific methodological procedures or theoretical assumptions found in classical philosophical phenomenology. Nevertheless, the work of Varela, Thompson, Gallagher, and others have triggered an intense and ongoing debate. It led to the launch of the journal Phenomenology and the Cognitive Sciences and has also proven influential in the continuing development of other related areas including research on embodied cognition and sense-making.

笔记

Roy (eds.), Naturalizing Phenomenology (pp. 1–83). Stanford, CA: Stanford University Press: 54. Mind in Life: Biology, Phenomenology, and the Sciences of Mind. Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press.

进一步阅读的建议

SUGGESTIONS FOR FURTHER READING

  • Scott D. Churchill 和 Frederick J. Wertz，“心理学现象学研究导论：历史、概念和方法论基础”。载 KJ Schneider 和 JF Pierson 编，《人本主义心理学手册：理论、研究与实践的前沿》（第 275-295 页）。加州千橡市：Sage 出版社，2015 年。
  • Scott D. Churchill and Frederick J. Wertz, “An introduction to phenomenological research in psychology: Historical, conceptual, and methodological foundations.” In K.J. Schneider and J.F. Pierson (eds.), The Handbook of Humanistic Psychology: Leading Edges in Theory, Research, and Practice (pp. 275–295). Thousand Oaks, CA: Sage, 2015.
  • Linda Finlay，“辩论现象学研究方法”。《现象学与实践》 3(1)，2009，6-25。
  • Linda Finlay, “Debating phenomenological research methods.” Phenomenology & Practice 3(1), 2009, 6–25.
  • Katrin Heimann、Simon Høffding、Kristian Martiny 编，《现象学访谈：运用他人经验》。《现象学与认知科学特刊》第22卷，2023年，1-311页。
  • Katrin Heimann, Simon Høffding, and Kristian Martiny (eds.), Phenomenological Interviews: Working with Others’ Experiences. Special Issue of Phenomenology and the Cognitive Sciences 22, 2023, 1–311.
  • Shaun Gallagher 和 Dan Zahavi，《现象学心灵》。第三版。伦敦：劳特利奇，2021 年。
  • Shaun Gallagher and Dan Zahavi, The Phenomenological Mind. 3rd edn. London: Routledge, 2021.

12一种方法、一种态度、一个理论框架

12 A METHOD, AN ATTITUDE, A THEORETICAL FRAMEWORK

DOI：10.4324/9781003350682-16

DOI: 10.4324/9781003350682-16

如果我们再次简要地考虑一下心理学和精神病学领域受到现象学哲学的启发，值得注意的是，他们中很少有人对胡塞尔关于如何在方法论上运用“跃迁”（epoché）和“还原”（reduction）的更具体指导感兴趣。施皮格尔伯格在其综述《心理学和精神病学中的现象学》（涵盖并讨论了大量人物）的结论中明确警告不要“正统地回归胡塞尔”，并指出，如果要实现心理学和现象学之间真正的双向交流，就迫切需要摆脱胡塞尔哲学的一些技术性限制。这并非巧合。1

If we once again briefly consider some of the classical figures in psychology and psychiatry who were inspired by phenomenological philosophy, it is noteworthy that few of them seemed interested in Husserl’s more specific instructions regarding how to methodologically employ the epoché and the reduction. It is not coincidental that Spiegelberg in the conclusion to his survey Phenomenology in Psychology and Psychiatry – which covers and discusses an impressive number of figures – explicitly warns against “an orthodox return to Husserl” and argues that it is urgent to free oneself from some of the technicalities of Husserl’s philosophy if a true two-way exchange between psychology and phenomenology is to be possible.1

一个具体的例子可以在精神病学家路德维希·宾斯旺格（Ludwig Binswanger，1881-1966）的著作中找到。宾斯旺格在其1922年出版的《普通心理学问题导论》一书中指出，胡塞尔和舍勒的工作不仅能够帮助经验心理学获得更牢固的基础，而且还产生了许多与心理学直接相关的成果。2 宾斯旺格随后强调的一个具体例子涉及人际理解的本质。正如宾斯旺格指出的那样，现象学家已经认识到，我们通常与其他人相遇的方式是不可分割的心理物理统一体，即既不是单纯的身体，也不是纯粹的心灵。3通过强调社会感知形式的存在，从而消除了诉诸投射或类比推理的基本形式的需要，宾斯旺格认为现象学为心理学和精神病学提供了至关重要的见解。4在提出这一论点时，宾斯旺格不仅预见了认知科学后来的发展，而且他这样做并没有参考那个时代和现象学还原。

One concrete example of this can be found in the work of the psychiatrist Ludwig Binswanger (1881–1966). In his book Introduction to the Problems of General Psychology from 1922, Binswanger argued that Husserl’s and Scheler’s work couldn’t merely help empirical psychology gain a more secure foundation, but that it had also produced a number of results of direct relevance for psychology.2 One specific example that Binswanger then highlights concerns the nature of interpersonal understanding. As Binswanger points out, phenomenologists have recognised that the way we typically encounter other human beings is as undivided psychophysical unities, i.e., neither as mere bodies nor as pure minds.3 By stressing the existence of a form of social perception and by thereby having eliminated the need for an appeal to a fundamental form of projection or analogical inference, Binswanger took phenomenology to have offered crucial insights to both psychology and psychiatry.4 In making this argument, Binswanger wasn’t merely anticipating much later developments in cognitive science, he was also doing so without referencing the epoché and the phenomenological reduction.

一些当代现象学心理学家会认为这是不可接受的。正如我们所见，乔治坚持认为，除非科学研究运用了某种还原论，否则它不能声称具有现象学地位。5正如莫利在讨论现象学定性研究方法论时所论证的那样：“它始终关乎时代”。6

Some contemporary phenomenological psychologists would find this unacceptable. As we have seen, Giorgi would insist that scientific research cannot claim phenomenological status unless it is supported by some use of the reduction.5 And as Morley has argued in a discussion of phenomenological qualitative research methodology: “It’s always about the epoché”.6

但胡塞尔最初引入这些方法论步骤的动机究竟是什么？正如我在第三章中指出的，胡塞尔引入“回溯”（epoché）是为了中止我们对独立于心灵的实在的天真和不加质疑的依赖，而随后的还原则是为了系统地考察心灵与世界之间的关联；这一研究最终将揭示后者在多大程度上依赖于主观性。正如胡塞尔在《危机》中所言，只有这样，现象学家才能实现其主要目标，即“将世界存在的普遍显而易见性——对他而言，这是所有谜团中最大的谜团——转化为某种可理解的东西” 。7

But what exactly was Husserl’s reason for introducing these methodological steps in the first place? As I pointed out in Chapter 3, Husserl introduced the epoché in order to suspend our naïve and unquestioned reliance on the existence of a mind-independent reality, and the aim of the subsequent reduction was then to allow for a systematic investigation of the correlation between mind and world; an investigation that would eventually reveal to what extent the latter depends upon subjectivity. As Husserl remarks in Crisis, it is only in this manner that the phenomenologist will then be able to achieve his main goal, namely, to transform “the universal obviousness of the being of the world—for him the greatest of all enigmas—into something intelligible”.7

显而易见的问题是，坚持要求任何希望进行应用现象学研究的人、任何希望在教育研究、实验心理学中使用现象学的人，护理研究、运动科学、人类学、社会学、文学研究等学科必须“抵制将任何存在的客体或事态设定为存在” ，并学会搁置关于世界独立于心智状态的普遍性论题和各种根深蒂固的形而上学假设。我不仅认为这种建议缺乏理论依据，而且事实证明它适得其反。它没有让研究人员直接参与到现象本身，反而常常让他们被方法论的束缚所困，误入歧途。元反思，并产生了大量出版物，其中的支持者和反对者都在努力理解这些技术概念，并且通常最终会误解它们。举几个例子，请考虑兰德里奇和佩利的解释。兰德里奇声称胡塞尔通过括号过程试图“超越[...] noetic-noematic相关性并以‘上帝视角’看待经验”，9而佩利写道，胡塞尔通过现象学还原试图“突破经验（进入纯粹意识领域）”。10任何熟悉胡塞尔作品的人都知道，这两种解释都没有多大意义。一些提议的方法技术性强，有时甚至晦涩难懂，这不仅产生了内部混乱，还导致不同方法的倡导者互相批评，指责对方误解了现象学的核心方面。这也引发了外界持续不断的批评，并导致有人指责应用现象学“是在空谈，即用充斥着专业术语的空话来掩盖其主张的空洞性和方法的任意性”。11最终的结果是，许多寻求理论灵感或方法指导的潜在申请者转向了其他更容易理解的理论框架。

The obvious question to ask is whether it really is reasonable to insist that anybody wishing to conduct applied phenomenological research, anybody wishing to use phenomenology in educational research, experimental psychology, nursing research, sports science, anthropology, sociology, literary studies, etc., must “resist from positing as existing whatever object or state of affairs is present”8 and learn to suspend the general thesis and various deep-seated metaphysical assumptions about the mind-independent status of the world. Not only do I think this proposal is without theoretical justification, I also think it has proven quite counterproductive. Instead of letting researchers engage with the phenomena themselves, it has often led them astray by making them choke on methodological meta-reflections and generated an enormous number of publications where protagonists and antagonists alike struggle with these technical concepts and typically end up misinterpreting them. For a few examples, consider the interpretations of Langdridge and Paley. Whereas Langdridge claims that Husserl through his process of bracketing attempted to “transcend [. . .] the noetic-noematic correlation and take a ‘God’s eye view’ on experience”,9 Paley writes that Husserl through the phenomenological reduction tried to “break out of experience (into the realm of pure consciousness)”.10 Neither of these interpretations makes much sense, as anybody familiar with Husserl’s work would know. The technical and at times arcane complexity of some of the proposed approaches has not only generated internal confusions and led protagonists of different approaches to criticise each other for having misinterpreted central aspects of phenomenology. It has also motivated persisting external criticisms and led to the accusation that applied phenomenology “has risen to prominence on hot air, i.e., jargon-laced gas that obscures the emptiness of its claims and the arbitrariness of its methods”.11 The end result has been that many potential applicants who were looking for theoretical inspiration or methodological guidance have turned to other more easily comprehensible theoretical frameworks.

任何有资格被称为现象学的程序或方法都必须熟悉现象学理论。这是必要的条件。然而，在非哲学的语境中，对生活世界、意向性、共情、前反思经验等现象学核心概念进行恰当且富有创造性的运用，地平线，历史性、活生生的身体等等，或许比严格遵守和坚持执行“回溯”（epoché）和还原（reduction）更有价值、更有成效，正是因为后者有着如此明确的哲学焦点和目标。需要明确的是，这并不意味着非哲学家应该被禁止使用这些概念，但我不明白，如果要将非哲学视角下的现象学研究视为成功，为什么必须使用这些概念。

Any procedure or approach that is supposed to merit the label phenomenological must be familiar with phenomenological theory. This is a necessary requirement. In a non-philosophical context, however, a relevant and creative use of central phenomenological concepts such as lifeworld, intentionality, empathy, pre-reflective experience, horizon, historicity, lived body, etc. might be far more valuable and productive than a strict adherence to and insistence on the performance of the epoché and reduction, precisely because the latter procedures have such an explicit philosophical focus and aim. To be very clear, this is not meant to suggest that non-philosophers should somehow be prohibited from making use of these notions, but I fail to see why their employment should be necessary if a non-philosophical engagement with phenomenology is to be deemed successful.

让我提供最后几个成功使用的例子，这次来自医疗保健。如果我们想提供适当的护理，尤其是在治疗慢性病和影响生活的疾病时——护理患者会觉得有帮助且有意义的——我们不应该孤立地关注症状，而需要了解相关疾病如何影响患者更普遍的生活状况。我们需要了解它如何影响患者的“在世存在”（being-in-the-world），例如，他的意向性、时间性、空间性和社会性意义建构。而这正是医疗保健专业人员可以从意向性、具身性、时间性、同理心、空间性等

Let me offer a few final examples of such successful uses, and this time from the domain of health care. If we wish to offer proper care, especially in the case of more chronic and life-changing illnesses – care that the patient will find helpful and meaningful – we shouldn’t focus on the symptoms in isolation, but need to understand how the illness in question affects the more general life-situation of the patient. We need to understand how it affects the patient’s being-in-the-world, e.g., his or her intentional, temporal, spatial, and social sense-making. And this is precisely where health care professionals can profit from phenomenological investigations of intentionality, embodiment, temporality, empathy, spatiality, etc.

在日常生活中，我们的身体能力被视为理所当然。骑自行车或刷牙时，我们很少注意到自己的身体技能。它们作为我们可以依赖的东西，始终处于幕后。世界被赋予我们一个可供性的世界，即作为意义的情境和行动的环境，作为允许或阻止特定身体活动的环境，身体在每一个感知和每一个行动中都发挥作用，它构成了我们的观点和出发点，这些事实通常并非我们关注的。当然，这种情况可能会迅速改变，例如疼痛、疲惫、疾病，或者残疾。之前习以为常的事情突然变得棘手起来。正如卡雷尔所写：

In normal life, our bodily capacities are taken for granted. When riding our bike or brushing our teeth, we seldomly attend to our bodily skills. They remain in the background as something we can count on. The fact that the world is given to us as a world of affordances, i.e., as situations of meaning and circumstances for action, as allowing or preventing specific bodily activities, the fact that the body is operative in every perception and every action, the fact that it constitutes our point of view and our point of departure is not something we normally attend to. But of course, this can quickly change, because of pain, exhaustion, illness, or disability. What was previously taken for granted is suddenly problematised. As Carel writes:

疾病不仅会扰乱身体上的自信、熟悉感和连续性，还会扰乱一系列基于此的假设。例如，一个人的未来计划取决于身体能力，因此会受到健康状况不佳的限制。一个人的时间感会因预后不佳而发生根本性改变。一个人的价值观和对人生重要性的理解常常会因疾病而改变；身体上的局限性通常会影响一个人的生存。12

[c]ases of illness make apparent not only the bodily feeling of confidence, familiarity, and continuity that is disturbed, but also a host of assumptions that hang on it. For example, one’s future plans depend on bodily capacities and thus are limited by ill health. one’s temporal sense is radically changed by a poor prognosis. one’s values and sense of what is important in life are frequently modified in light of illness; bodily limitations impact on one’s existence generally.12

一个发现自己被束缚在轮椅上的人，经历的不仅仅是运动控制能力的改变。他还会发现周围的环境也发生了变化。曾经很容易进入的地下室储藏室，现在变成了房子里一个无法进入和使用的地方。即使到橱柜顶层的距离以厘米为单位保持不变，但现在它已经遥不可及了。在某些情况下，疾病也会改变身份。一位职业芭蕾舞演员在交通事故中膝盖骨骨折，可能不得不努力重新定义自己，因为她过去认为定义身份的目标和活动已经不再存在。或者考虑一下闭锁综合征患者，意识清醒，认知功能正常，但瘫痪且无法言语交流。在这种情况下，身体很可能被视为一种对抗，而非“我”本身（的一部分）。

A person who finds himself bound to a wheelchair doesn’t simply undergo a change in motor control. He will also find the environment changed. What used to be an easily accessible storeroom in the basement will now appear as an inaccessible and unusable part of the house. Even if the distance to the top shelf of the cupboard remains the same when measured in centimetres, it is now out of reach. In some cases, illness can also be identity transforming. A professional ballet dancer whose kneecap is broken in a traffic accident might have to struggle with the task of redefining who she is, since the goals and activities that she used to consider identity defining are no longer available. Or consider somebody with locked-in syndrome, who is conscious and cognitively unimpaired, but paralysed and unable to communicate verbally. In such circumstances, the body might well be experienced as an antagonist rather than as (part of) who I am.

这些简短的评论仅触及了对身体的现象学分析的表面，但应该清楚地表明，熟悉关于身体的现象学理论可以帮助医疗保健专业人员更好地理解疾病或残疾如何影响患者的生活，从而更好地为个体患者量身定制护理。13同样，考虑一个经典的现象学区别，例如时钟时间和生活时间之间的区别。考虑时间体验如何因诊断而改变。考虑它如何影响短期和长期规划，考虑它如何改变人们对未来开放性的体验。想想一个小时的痛苦，或一个小时的等待治疗，可能比花一个小时看一部精彩的电影感觉要长得多，即使这个小时仍然包含相同数量的分钟。

These brief remarks only touch the surface of a phenomenological analysis of the body, but should make it evident how a familiarity with phenomenological theorising about the body can help health care professionals better tailor their care to individual patients by helping them better understand how illness or disability affect the life of the patient.13 Likewise, consider a classical phenomenological distinction such as that between the time of the clock and lived time. Consider how the experience of time can change as a result of a diagnosis. Consider how it might affect short- and long-term planning, consider how it might change one’s experience of the openness of the future. Consider how an hour in pain, or an hour waiting for treatment, might feel much longer than an hour spent watching an exciting movie, even though the hour still contains the same number of minutes.

然而，现象学与医疗保健的关联性并不局限于这类分析。现象学也提供了更具系统性的见解。一个有趣的例子可以在Ashworth及其同事的一项较早的研究中发现。14患者应该积极参与医疗保健决策，而不是仅仅被动接受，这一观点广为流传，尤其被认为是提高患者依从性的决定性因素。但是，让患者参与的正确方法是什么？这种参与的障碍又是什么？为了解答这些问题，作者们转向了舒茨及其关于社会互动的研究。他们简要介绍了他的一些核心思想，并特别强调了舒茨关于知识的社会分布。作者随后展示了这些理念如何应用于日常临床实践。参与始终与具体情境相关；它是一种共同的文化实践，通常依赖于一些习以为常的假设。患者正确参与的一个明显挑战是，鼓励和邀请患者参与涉及特定任务的医疗环境，他们通常对各种程序、目标、角色和地位并不熟悉，与医护人员的地位也完全不平等。护士是训练有素的专家，熟悉入院、病史采集、查房、出院等所有相关的标准和流程，但许多流程对患者来说却相当令人困惑，他们会试图根据自身过往经验去理解。护士和患者知识储备的不匹配很容易导致沟通不畅和误解。事实上，护士试图让患者积极参与到自己的医疗保健决策中，甚至可能让患者感到意外，并被解读为护士缺乏关爱和关怀的证据。如果护士能够成功地让患者真正参与到护理中，以病人为中心的护理，因此护士了解并认识到病人多样化的生活经历至关重要。

The relevance of phenomenology for health care is not restricted to these kinds of analyses, however. Phenomenology also offers insights of a more systemic nature. One interesting example can be found in an older study by Ashworth and colleagues.14 The idea that patients should be actively involved in rather than simply passive recipients of health care decisions is widespread and has in particular been considered decisive for increased patient compliance. But what is the right way to involve the patient and what are the obstacles to such involvement? In order to address these questions, the authors turned to Schutz and his work on social interaction. They briefly presented some of his core ideas, and in particular highlighted Schutz’s discussion of the social distribution of knowledge. The authors then proceeded to show how these ideas might be used in everyday clinical practice. Participation is always contextual; it is participation in a shared cultural practice that often relies on a number of taken-for-granted assumptions. One obvious challenge to proper patient participation is that the patients are encouraged and invited to participate in a medical setting involving specific tasks, procedures, aims, roles, and statuses that they are often quite unfamiliar with, and where they and the health care professionals are not at all on equal footing. Whereas the nurses are trained experts who are thoroughly familiar with all the standards and routines connected to admission, history taking, ward rounds, discharge, etc., many of these procedures will be quite bewildering to the patients, who will attempt to make sense of them on the basis of their own past experiences. The mismatch between the nurses’ and patients’ stock of knowledge can easily lead to miscommunication and misunderstanding. Indeed, the very attempt by the nurses to actively involve the patients in their own health care decision, might even come as a surprise to the patients and be interpreted as evidence of the nurses’ lack of care and concern. If the nurses are to succeed in involving the patients in genuinely patient-centred care, it is consequently crucial that the nurses are aware of and recognise the patients’ varied life experiences.

总而言之，在临床情境中运用现象学，很少关注现实最终的主体依赖性，也不仅仅是对病人的体验描述表现出不带偏见的兴趣。部分任务恰恰在于运用一种思维模式和理论框架，使人能够捕捉改变的生活情境的基本结构。如果你与……生活在一起，你的存在感会发生怎样的转变？精神分裂症、脑瘫或偏侧空间忽视？疾病、残疾或精神障碍如何影响你与自己、与世界以及与他人的关系？

Summing up, using phenomenology in a clinical context is rarely about being concerned with the ultimate subject-dependent nature of reality, nor is it simply a question of showing an unprejudiced interest in the patient’s experiential descriptions. Part of the task is precisely to apply a mindset and a theoretical framework that will allow one to capture the fundamental structures of the changed life situation. How is your very being-in-the-world transformed if you are living with schizophrenia, cerebral palsy, or hemispatial neglect? How does illness, disability, or disorder affect your relation to yourself, to the world, and to others?

最后，让我概述一下当前研究和实践在成功参与现象学时面临的三个挑战。

Let me in conclusion outline three challenges that current research and practice is confronted with when it comes to a successful engagement with phenomenology.

第一个挑战是过于肤浅。有时，一项研究仅仅因为包含对经验的细致的第一人称描述而被呈现为现象学研究。但是，仅仅因为一项研究或一种方法考虑了信息提供者的视角，是定性的、非还原性的，并试图提供丰富的经验描述，就将其定义为现象学研究真的合适吗？这种方法真的与其他方法有什么不同吗？在定性研究中，这样的研究能否带来一些原本无法获得的洞见？现象学难道不远不止于思想开放和对第一人称体验的兴趣吗？

The first challenge is that of being too superficial. Occasionally, a study is presented as phenomenological simply because it contains careful first-person descriptions of experience. But is it really appropriate to qualify a study or an approach as phenomenological merely because it considers the perspective of the informant, is qualitative and non-reductive, and seeks to provide rich experiential descriptions? Would such an approach really differ from other approaches in qualitative research, would such a study allow for insights that one could not have obtained otherwise? Is there not far more to phenomenology than simply being open-minded and interested in first-person experience?

针对肤浅指控的一个可能的补救措施是接触古典文本并从中寻求灵感。事实上，任何声称使用……的研究人员或实践者似乎都有理由期待现象学方法、程序或途径需要对现象学理论有一定的了解。然而，这立即使我们面临着下一个挑战，那就是过于哲学化，即使用太多技术性的哲学概念或方法论要求，而这些概念或要求的具体相关性仍然不明确。至关重要的是，现象学的使用方式要透明，即要清楚使用了哪些要素以及它们应该发挥什么作用。因此，一定的实用主义是合适的。人们应该只使用与当前任务相关的概念和方法工具，并且可以带来新的见解或更好的治疗干预。追求纯粹性和正统性是转移注意力的手段。

A possible remedy against the superficiality charge is to engage with the classical texts and seek inspiration from them. Indeed, it seems reasonable to expect any researcher or practitioner who claims to be using a phenomenological method, procedure, or approach to have some familiarity with phenomenological theory. This immediately confronts us with the next challenge, however, which is that of being too philosophical, i.e., operating with too many technical philosophical concepts or methodological requirements whose concrete relevance remains unclear. It is essential that phenomenology is being used in a transparent way, i.e., in such a way that it is clear which elements are being used and what role they are supposed to play. A certain pragmatism is consequently appropriate. One should only employ concepts and methodological tools that are pertinent for the task at hand, and which can allow for new insights or better therapeutic interventions. The pursuit of purity and orthodoxy is a red herring.

这最终引出了我的第三个指责，即过于孤立。多年来，现象学已在众多学科中得到应用。然而，有些令人惊讶的是，一个成功的学科应用所产生的洞见很少被其他学科采纳。有时，对其他学科正在发生的事情的理解不仅有限，而且相当错误。声称像雅斯贝斯、闵可夫斯基和宾斯旺格这样的现象学精神病学家提供了“对心理治疗实施的多种洞见和修正主义理解”，并且这些治疗师“确实修改了他们的实践，但那是基于个体的，而且是治疗实践，而非研究” 15，正如乔治最近所说的那样，这成功地从根本上歪曲了现象学精神病学家的传统。现象学精神病学所能提供的帮助。这是一个错失的机会。前进的道路是跨学科合作，借鉴和学习典范方法和最佳实践模式。

This finally brings me to the third charge, which is that of remaining too insular. Over the years, phenomenology has found use in a variety of disciplines. Somewhat surprisingly, however, insights from one successful disciplinary application have rarely been taken up by other disciplines. Occasionally, the understanding of what is happening in other disciplines is not only limited but quite mistaken. To claim that phenomenological psychiatrists like Jaspers, Minkowski, and Binswanger have offered “multiple insights and revisionist understandings of the conduct of psychotherapy” and that these therapists “did modify their practices but it was done on an individual basis and it was therapeutic practice, not research”15 as Giorgi has recently done, manages to mischaracterise in a rather fundamental way, what the tradition of phenomenological psychiatry has to offer. This is a missed opportunity. The way forward is to collaborate across the disciplines and to draw on and learn from exemplary approaches and best practice models.

那么，这些反思的结果是什么呢？正如希望大家能够理解的那样，我并不是建议不要应用现象学。多年来，现象学提供了至关重要的为一系列实证学科提供输入。现象学之所以能够如此成功，部分原因在于它远非仅仅是一个描述性的学科。现象学也提供自身的理论阐释，可以挑战现有的模型和背景假设。

What is then the outcome of these reflections? As should hopefully be apparent, I am not proposing that phenomenology should not be applied. Phenomenology has over the years provided crucial inputs to a whole range of empirical disciplines. The reason it has been able to do this so successfully is partially because phenomenology is far from merely being a descriptive enterprise. Phenomenology also offers theoretical accounts of its own that can challenge existing models and background assumptions.

归根结底，任何对现象学实证应用感兴趣的人，不应首先将其视为一种严谨的方法，而应将其视为一种开放的态度和理论框架，可以与多种方法结合使用。护士、理疗师、心理学家、教育家、精神病学家、人类学家等希望借鉴现象学的人士，应采取务实的态度，而不应过于在意其程序是否符合胡塞尔、海德格尔或梅洛-庞蒂关于如何发展非哲学现象学的粗略指导。更重要的是，所使用的现象学工具是否恰当，是否能够带来新的见解或更好的治疗干预，即它们是否对科学界和/或来访者产生有价值的影响。

Ultimately, anybody interested in an empirical use of phenomenology should not primarily look to it as a rigorous method, but as an open-minded attitude and theoretical framework that can be used in conjunction with a variety of methods. Nurses, physiotherapists, psychologists, educators, psychiatrists, anthropologists, etc. who wish to draw on phenomenology should adopt a pragmatic attitude and be less concerned with whether or not the procedure accords with Husserl’s, Heidegger’s, or Merleau-Ponty’s own cursory instructions about how to develop a non-philosophical phenomenology. Of far more importance is whether the phenomenological tools being employed are pertinent, whether they allow for new insights or better therapeutic interventions, i.e., whether they make a valuable difference to the scientific community and/or the clients.

笔记

  24. Carel, H. (2013). Bodily doubt. Journal of Consciousness Studies 20(7–8): 184.
